Abdominal aortic aneurysm.name: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
Abdominal aortic aneurysm.overview:
Description
An enlargement of the aorta, the main blood vessel that delivers blood to the body, at the level of the abdomen.An abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) can be life-threatening if it bursts. Abdominal aortic aneurysms are most common in older men and smokers.An abdominal aortic aneurysm often grows slowly, without symptoms. As it grows, some people may notice a pulsating feeling near the navel. Pain in the back, belly, or side may be signs of impending rupture.Stopping smoking may slow their growth. Small ones may only need monitoring. Aneurysms that are too large or growing too quickly should be repaired with surgery.
Abdominal aortic aneurysm.subtitle: Very common
Abdominal aortic aneurysm.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Stopping smoking may slow their growth. Small ones may only need monitoring. Aneurysms that are too large or growing too quickly should be repaired with surgery.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Open surgical repair with vascular stent graft and Endovascular aneurysm repair

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: An abdominal aortic aneurysm often grows slowly, without symptoms. As it grows, some people may notice a pulsating feeling near the navel. Pain in the back, belly, or side may be signs of impending rupture.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, back, or flank
Also common: nausea or pulsating abdominal mass

Abscess.name: Abscess
Abscess.overview:
Description
A confined pocket of pus that collects in tissues, organs, or spaces inside the body.When an area in the body becomes infected, the body's immune system sends white blood cells to fight the infection. These cells collect and combine with the damaged tissue and germs, creating liquid called pus.An abscess is characterized by a painful, swollen lump that's filled with pus.Treatments include draining the abscess and antibiotics.
Abscess.subtitle: Common
Abscess.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of procedures
treatment.content: Treatments include draining the abscess and antibiotics.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Incision and drainage, Removal of unhealthy tissue, and Procedural sedation and analgesia

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: An abscess is characterized by a painful, swollen lump that's filled with pus.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: chills or fever
Skin: pimples or redness
Also common: pus, painful lump, tenderness, swelling, or swollen lymph nodes

Acne.name: Acne
Acne.overview:
Description
A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles plug with oil and dead skin cells.Acne is most common in teenagers and young adults.Symptoms range from uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red, and tender bumps.Treatments include over-the-counter creams and cleanser, as well as prescription antibiotics.
Acne.subtitle: Very common
Acne.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of skin care
treatment.content: Treatments include over-the-counter creams and cleanser, as well as prescription antibiotics.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Benzoyl peroxide / Salicylic acid, Clindamycin / Tretinoin, and Antibacterial soap

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Anti-inflammatory, Vitamin A derivative, Antibiotics, and Topical antiseptic

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms range from uninflamed blackheads to pus-filled pimples or large, red, and tender bumps.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: pimples, redness, or tenderness
Also common: pimple or blackhead

Acute cholecystitis.name: Acute cholecystitis
Acute cholecystitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the gallbladder, a small, digestive organ beneath the liver.Cholecystitis is often caused by stones that block the tube leading from the gallbladder to the small intestine.Severe pain in the upper right belly and bloating are symptoms.Treatment includes a hospital stay and surgical removal.
Acute cholecystitis.subtitle: Common
Acute cholecystitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and surgery
treatment.content: Treatment includes a hospital stay and surgical removal.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Severe pain in the upper right belly and bloating are symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, shoulder, or upper-right abdomen
Gastrointestinal: bloating, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: chills, fever, or sweating
Also common: abdominal cramping from gallstones or yellow skin and eyes

Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.name: Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia
Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.overview:
Description
A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow that affects white blood cells.Acute lymphoblastic leukemia is the most common childhood cancer. It occurs when a bone marrow cell develops errors in its DNA.Symptoms may include enlarged lymph nodes, bruising, fever, bone pain, bleeding from the gums, and frequent infections.Treatments may include chemotherapy or targeted drugs that specifically kill cancer cells.
Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.subtitle: Rare
Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments may include chemotherapy or targeted drugs that specifically kill cancer cells.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms may include enlarged lymph nodes, bruising, fever, bone pain, bleeding from the gums, and frequent infections.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bones
Whole body: fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, or night sweats
Also common: bleeding gums, easy bruising, infection, nosebleed, pallor, red spots on skin, shortness of breath, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Acute myeloid leukaemia.name: Acute myeloid leukaemia
Acute myeloid leukaemia.overview:
Description
A type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow with excess immature white blood cells.AML progresses rapidly, with myeloid cells interfering with the production of normal white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.Symptoms include fatigue, recurrent infections, and bruising easily.Treatments include chemotherapy, other drug therapy, and stem-cell transplants.
Acute myeloid leukaemia.subtitle: Rare
Acute myeloid leukaemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include chemotherapy, other drug therapy, and stem-cell transplants.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fatigue, recurrent infections, and bruising easily.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: bleeding, bruising, infection, pallor, red spots on skin, or shortness of breath

Addison's disease.name: Addison's disease
Addison's disease.overview:
Description
A disorder in which the adrenal glands don't produce enough hormones.Specifically, the adrenal glands produce insufficient amounts of the hormone cortisol and sometimes aldosterone, too. When the body is under stress (e.g. fighting an infection), this deficiency of cortisol can result in a life threatening Addisonian crisis characterized by low blood pressure.Symptoms tend to be non-specific and include fatigue, nausea, darkening of the skin, and dizziness upon standing.Treatment involves taking hormones to replace those not produced by the adrenal glands.
Addison's disease.subtitle: Rare
Addison's disease.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of steroids
treatment.content: Treatment involves taking hormones to replace those not produced by the adrenal glands.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms tend to be non-specific and include fatigue, nausea, darkening of the skin, and dizziness upon standing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or muscles
Whole body: dehydration, dizziness, fainting, fatigue, lightheadedness, loss of appetite, low blood pressure, low blood sugar, water-electrolyte imbalance, or sweating
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: absence of menstruation, craving salty foods, darkening of the skin, excess urination, muscle weakness, reduced sex drive, or weight loss

Allergic rhinitis.name: Allergic rhinitis
Allergic rhinitis.overview:
Description
An allergic response causing itchy, watery eyes, sneezing, and other similar symptoms.Allergic rhinitis occurs seasonally or year-round. Diagnosis involves history-taking, examination of the nasal passages, and sometimes skin testing.Symptoms include sneezing, runny nose, and red, watery, and itchy eyes.Antihistamine medications can reduce symptoms.
Allergic rhinitis.subtitle: Very common
Allergic rhinitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and antihistamines
treatment.content: Antihistamine medications can reduce symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Steroid, Antihistamine, Decongestant, Eye decongestant, Bronchodilator, and Anti-inflammatory

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include sneezing, runny nose, and red, watery, and itchy eyes.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear
Nasal: congestion, loss of smell, redness, runny nose, post-nasal drip, sneezing, or stuffy nose
Eyes: itchiness, puffy eyes, redness, or watery eyes
Respiratory: breathing through the mouth or wheezing
Also common: coughing, fatigue, headache, itching, phlegm, or throat irritation

Alzheimer.name: Alzheimer
Alzheimer.overview:
Description
A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.Brain cell connections and the cells themselves degenerate and die, eventually destroying memory and other important mental functions.Memory loss and confusion are the main symptoms.No cure exists, but medications and management strategies may temporarily improve symptoms.
Alzheimer.subtitle: Very common
Alzheimer.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of cognition enhancing medications
treatment.content: No cure exists, but medications and management strategies may temporarily improve symptoms.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Memory loss and confusion are the main symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cognitive: mental decline, difficulty thinking and understanding, confusion in the evening hours, delusion, disorientation, forgetfulness, making things up, mental confusion, difficulty concentrating, inability to create new memories, inability to do simple math, or inability to recognize common things
Behavioral: aggression, agitation, difficulty with self care, irritability, meaningless repetition of own words, personality changes, restlessness, lack of restraint, or wandering and getting lost
Mood: anger, apathy, general discontent, loneliness, or mood swings
Psychological: depression, hallucination, or paranoia
Also common: inability to combine muscle movements, jumbled speech, or loss of appetite

Anaphylaxis.name: Anaphylaxis
Anaphylaxis.overview:
Description
A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction.The reaction can occur within seconds or minutes of exposure to an allergen.Symptoms include a skin rash, nausea, vomiting, difficulty breathing, and shock.If not treated right away, usually with epinephrine, it can result in unconsciousness or death.
Anaphylaxis.subtitle: Common
Anaphylaxis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of vasoconstrictors
treatment.content: If not treated right away, usually with epinephrine, it can result in unconsciousness or death.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Tracheal intubation, Cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a skin rash, nausea, vomiting, difficulty breathing, and shock.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fainting, lightheadedness, low blood pressure, dizziness, or flushing
Respiratory: difficulty breathing, rapid breathing, shortness of breath, or wheezing
Skin: hives, swelling under the skin, blue skin from poor circulation, or rashes
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: fast heart rate, feeling of impending doom, itching, tongue swelling, difficulty swallowing, facial swelling, mental confusion, nasal congestion, or impaired voice

Ankylosing spondylitis.name: Ankylosing spondylitis
Ankylosing spondylitis.overview:
Description
An inflammatory arthritis affecting the spine and large joints.The condition is more common among men and usually begins in early adulthood.Symptoms typically appear in early adulthood and include reduced flexibility in the spine. This reduced flexibility eventually results in a hunched-forward posture. Pain in the back and joints is also common.Treatment includes medication, physical therapy, and in rare cases surgery.
Ankylosing spondylitis.subtitle: Common
Ankylosing spondylitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of anti-inflammatories and self care
treatment.content: Treatment includes medication, physical therapy, and in rare cases surgery.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Immunosuppressive drug, Anti-inflammatory, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms typically appear in early adulthood and include reduced flexibility in the spine. This reduced flexibility eventually results in a hunched-forward posture. Pain in the back and joints is also common.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ankle, eyes, heel, hip, joints, lower back, middle back, neck, or shoulder
Pain types: can be arthritic
Pain circumstances: can occur during rest
Joints: back joint dysfunction or stiffness
Eyes: inflammation of the eye's middle layer or redness
Visual: blurred vision or sensitivity to light
Also common: bone tissue formation, fatigue, hunched back, inflamed tendons, inflammatory bowel disease, physical deformity, or sleep disorder

Anorexia nervosa.name: Anorexia nervosa
Anorexia nervosa.overview:
Description
An eating disorder causing people to obsess about weight and what they eat.Anorexia is characterized by a distorted body image, with an unwarranted fear of being overweight.Symptoms include trying to maintain a below-normal weight through starvation or too much exercise.Medical treatment may be needed to restore normal weight. Talk therapy can help with self-esteem and behavior changes.
Anorexia nervosa.subtitle: Common
Anorexia nervosa.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of therapy
treatment.content: Medical treatment may be needed to restore normal weight. Talk therapy can help with self-esteem and behavior changes.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Dialectical behavior therapy, Counseling psychology, Interpersonal psychotherapy, Family therapy, Behavior therapy, Psychotherapy, Brief psychotherapy, and Group psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include trying to maintain a below-normal weight through starvation or too much exercise.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: dehydration, dizziness, fainting, fatigue, low blood pressure, low body temperature, osteoporosis, water-electrolyte imbalance, or feeling cold
Behavioral: binge eating, compulsive behavior, hyperactivity, impulsivity, or social isolation
Weight: underweight, weight loss, or extreme weight loss and thinness
Mood: anxiety, apprehension, or guilt
Gastrointestinal: constipation or vomiting
Menstrual: irregular menstruation or absence of menstruation
<b>Developmental: delayed puberty or slow growth
Also common: brittle nails, bruising, depression, dieting, dry hair, dry skin, headache, sensitivity to cold, or slow heart rate

Anthrax.name: Anthrax
Anthrax.overview:
Description
A rare but serious bacterial illness.Anthrax is caused by a spore-forming bacterium. It mainly affects animals. Humans can become infected through contact with an infected animal or by inhaling spores.Symptoms depend on the route of infection. They can range from a skin ulcer with a dark scab to difficulty breathing.Antibiotic treatment cures most infections. Inhaled anthrax is harder to treat and can be fatal.
Anthrax.subtitle: Extremely rare
Anthrax.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Antibiotic treatment cures most infections. Inhaled anthrax is harder to treat and can be fatal.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms depend on the route of infection. They can range from a skin ulcer with a dark scab to difficulty breathing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest or muscles
Skin: blister, dark scab, small bump, or ulcers
Whole body: fever or malaise
Respiratory: respiratory distress or shortness of breath
Also common: coughing, headache, itching, nausea, sore throat, or swollen lymph nodes

Anxiety.name: Anxiety
Anxiety.overview:
Description
A mental health disorder characterized by feelings of worry, anxiety, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with one's daily activitiesExamples of anxiety disorders include panic attacks, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and post-traumatic stress disorder.Symptoms include stress that's out of proportion to the impact of the event, inability to set aside a worry, and restlessness.Treatment includes counseling or medications, including antidepressants.Take a self-assessment
Anxiety.subtitle: Very common
Anxiety.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of therapy
treatment.content: Treatment includes counseling or medications, including antidepressants.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Avoid alcohol, Reduce caffeine intake, Physical exercise, Quitting smoking, Relaxation techniques, Stress management, and Healthy diet

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Cognitive behavioral therapy, Meditation, and Psychotherapy

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: SSRIs, Anxiolytic, Antidepressant, Sedative, and Nerve pain medication

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include stress that's out of proportion to the impact of the event, inability to set aside a worry, and restlessness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Behavioral: hypervigilance, irritability, or restlessness
Cognitive: lack of concentration, racing thoughts, or unwanted thoughts
Whole body: fatigue or sweating
Also common: anxiety, excessive worry, fear, feeling of impending doom, insomnia, nausea, palpitations, or trembling

Appendicitis.name: Appendicitis
Appendicitis.overview:
Description
A condition in which the appendix becomes inflamed and filled with pus, causing pain.The appendix is a pouch on the colon that has no known purpose.Appendicitis begins with pain near the belly button and then moves to the right side. This is often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, poor appetite, fever, and chills.Appendicitis is usually treated with surgery and antibiotics. If untreated, the appendix can rupture and cause an abscess or systemic infection (sepsis).
Appendicitis.subtitle: Common
Appendicitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of surgery
treatment.content: Appendicitis is usually treated with surgery and antibiotics. If untreated, the appendix can rupture and cause an abscess or systemic infection (sepsis).

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Appendicitis begins with pain near the belly button and then moves to the right side. This is often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, poor appetite, fever, and chills.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, mid-abdomen, or right lower abdomen
Pain types: can be dull, sharp, mild, or severe
Whole body: chills, fever, loss of appetite, or malaise
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Also common: abdominal pain migration

Arthritis.name: Arthritis
Arthritis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness that can worsen with age.Different types of arthritis exist, each with different causes including wear and tear, infections, and underlying diseases.Symptoms include pain, swelling, reduced range of motion, and stiffness.Medications, physical therapy, or sometimes surgery helps reduce symptoms and improve quality of life.
Arthritis.subtitle: Very common
Arthritis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and therapy
treatment.content: Medications, physical therapy, or sometimes surgery helps reduce symptoms and improve quality of life.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise, Weight loss, Tai chi, Yoga, Heating pad, Ice packs, and Cold compress

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Steroid, Analgesic, Narcotic, and Immunosuppressive drug

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Hip replacement, Knee replacement, and Joint replacement

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include pain, swelling, reduced range of motion, and stiffness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints, ankle, back, fingers, hands, muscles, neck, or wrist
Pain types: can be intermittent or sharp
Pain circumstances: can occur while sitting
Joints: stiffness, tenderness, or swelling
Muscular: decreased range of motion, difficulty walking, or muscle weakness
Hand: bump on the finger or bony outgrowth in fingers or toes
Whole body: fatigue or malaise
Also common: flare, physical deformity, redness, or stiff neck

Aseptic meningitis.name: Aseptic meningitis
Aseptic meningitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of brain and spinal cord membranes, typically caused by an infection.Meningitis is usually caused by a viral infection but can also be bacterial or fungal. Vaccines can prevent some forms of meningitis.Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.
Aseptic meningitis.subtitle: Rare
Aseptic meningitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, muscles, or neck
Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, lethargy, loss of appetite, malaise, or shivering
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Skin: blotchy rashes or red rashes

Also common: irritability, mental confusion, sensitivity to light, stiff neck, bulging fontanelle, fast breathing, fast heart rate, fear of loud sounds, headache, lack of interest in feeding in infants, sleepiness, sluggishness, or stiff back

Asthma.name: Asthma
Asthma.overview:
Description
A condition in which a person's airways become inflamed, narrow and swell, and produce extra mucus, which makes it difficult to breathe.Asthma can be minor or it can interfere with daily activities. In some cases, it may lead to a life-threatening attack.Asthma may cause difficulty breathing, chest pain, cough, and wheezing. The symptoms may sometimes flare-up.Asthma can usually be managed with rescue inhalers to treat symptoms and controller inhalers that prevent symptoms. Severe cases may require longer-acting inhalers that keep the airways open, as well as oral steroids.
Asthma.subtitle: Very common
Asthma.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and bronchodilators
treatment.content: Asthma can usually be managed with rescue inhalers to treat symptoms and controller inhalers that prevent symptoms. Severe cases may require longer-acting inhalers that keep the airways open, as well as oral steroids.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Asthma may cause difficulty breathing, chest pain, cough, and wheezing. The symptoms may sometimes flare-up.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cough: can occur at night, during exercise, can be chronic, dry, with phlegm, mild, or severe
Respiratory: difficulty breathing, wheezing, breathing through the mouth, fast breathing, frequent respiratory infections, rapid breathing, or shortness of breath at night
Also common: chest pressure, flare, anxiety, early awakening, fast heart rate, or throat irritation

Astigmatism.name: Astigmatism
Astigmatism.overview:
Description
A common imperfection in the eye's curvature.With astigmatism, the front surface of the eye or the lens, inside the eye, is curved differently in one direction than the other.A common symptom is blurry vision.Treatments include prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses. Laser-assisted surgery, such as LASIK, also may help.
Astigmatism.subtitle: Very common
Astigmatism.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of devices
treatment.content: Treatments include prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses. Laser-assisted surgery, such as LASIK, also may help.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A common symptom is blurry vision.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: blurred vision, eye strain, or headache

Atopic eczema.name: Atopic eczema
Atopic eczema.overview:
Description
An itchy inflammation of the skin.Atopic dermatitis usually develops in early childhood and is more common in people who have a family history of the condition.The main symptom is a rash that typically appears on the arms and behind the knees, but can also appear anywhere.Treatment includes avoiding soap and other irritants. Certain creams or ointments also may provide relief from the itching.
Atopic eczema.subtitle: Very common
Atopic eczema.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatment includes avoiding soap and other irritants. Certain creams or ointments also may provide relief from the itching.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Ultraviolet light therapy, Barrier cream, PUVA, Urea, Coal tar extract, and Moisturizer

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is a rash that typically appears on the arms and behind the knees, but can also appear anywhere.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: rashes, dryness, flakiness, bumps, fissures, peeling, or redness
Also common: itching

Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.name: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (adhd)
Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.overview:
Description
A chronic condition including attention difficulty, hyperactivity, and impulsiveness.ADHD often begins in childhood and can persist into adulthood. It may contribute to low self-esteem, troubled relationships, and difficulty at school or work.Symptoms include limited attention and hyperactivity.Treatments include medication and talk therapy.
Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.subtitle: Very common
Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of therapy
treatment.content: Treatments include medication and talk therapy.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Anger management, Counseling psychology, Psychoeducation, Family therapy, and Applied behavior analysis

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Stimulant, Cognition-enhancing medication, and Antihypertensive drug

Cognitive: absent-mindedness, difficulty focusing, forgetfulness, problem paying attention, or short attention span
Mood: anger, anxiety, boredom, excitement, or mood swings
Also common: depression or learning disability

Skin: blotchy rashes or red rashes

Bacterial vaginosis.name: Bacterial vaginosis
Bacterial vaginosis.overview:
Description
Bacterial overgrowth in the vagina.Bacterial vaginosis tends to affect women of childbearing age. Activities that change the balance of bacteria in the vagina, such as sexual intercourse or frequent douching, can increase a person’s risk.In some cases, there are no symptoms. In other cases, there may be abnormal vaginal discharge, itching, or odor.Treatment can include prescription cream, gel, or medication. Recurrence within three to 12 months is common, requiring additional treatment.
Bacterial vaginosis.subtitle: Very common
Bacterial vaginosis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment can include prescription cream, gel, or medication. Recurrence within three to 12 months is common, requiring additional treatment.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: In some cases, there are no symptoms. In other cases, there may be abnormal vaginal discharge, itching, or odor.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Groin: abnormal vaginal discharge, vaginal itching, or vaginal odor

Benign prostate enlargement.name: Benign prostate enlargement
Benign prostate enlargement.overview:
Description
Age-associated prostate gland enlargement that can cause urination difficulty.This type of prostate enlargement isn't thought to be a precursor to prostate cancer.With this condition, the urinary stream may be weak, or stop and start. In some cases, it can lead to infection, bladder stones, and reduced kidney function.Treatments include medications that relax the bladder or shrink the prostate, surgery, and minimally invasive surgery.
Benign prostate enlargement.subtitle: Very common
Benign prostate enlargement.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care and urinary retention medications
treatment.content: Treatments include medications that relax the bladder or shrink the prostate, surgery, and minimally invasive surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: With this condition, the urinary stream may be weak, or stop and start. In some cases, it can lead to infection, bladder stones, and reduced kidney function.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Urinary: dribbling after urination, excessive urination at night, frequent urination, sense of incomplete bladder emptying, urge to urinate and leaking, or weak urinary stream
Also common: incontinence or sexual dysfunction

Beriberi.name: Beriberi
Beriberi.overview:
Description
A disease in which the body doesn't have enough vitamin B-1 (thiamin).Beriberi is usually caused by poor diet or alcoholism.Symptoms include loss of appetite, weakness, pain in the limbs, shortness of breath, and swollen feet or legs.Treatments include B-1 supplements and eating more B-1-rich foods, such as whole-grain cereals, beans, and beef.
Beriberi.subtitle: Rare
Beriberi.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments include B-1 supplements and eating more B-1-rich foods, such as whole-grain cereals, beans, and beef.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include loss of appetite, weakness, pain in the limbs, shortness of breath, and swollen feet or legs.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Muscular: muscle weakness, problems with coordination, or loss of muscle
Heart: enlarged heart or fast heart rate
Also common: peripheral neuropathy, limb, loss of appetite, sensation of pins and needles, shortness of breath, or swelling in extremities

Bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma).name: Bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma)
Bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma).overview:
Description
A cancer in the slender tubes that carry the digestive fluid bile through the liver.It's a rare but aggressive form of cancer.Symptoms include yellow skin and eyes (jaundice), intensely itchy skin, and stool that's white in color.Treatment may include surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.
Bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma).subtitle: Very rare
Bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma).smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may include surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP), Transarterial chemoembolization, and Radiation therapy

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: surgery to remove pancreatic tumors and Hepatectomy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include yellow skin and eyes (jaundice), intensely itchy skin, and stool that's white in color.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Whole body: fever or weakness
Also common: dark urine, itching, pale feces, weight loss, or yellow skin and eyes

Bipolar disorder.name: Bipolar disorder
Bipolar disorder.overview:
Description
A disorder associated with episodes of mood swings ranging from depressive lows to manic highs.The exact cause of bipolar disorder isn’t known, but a combination of genetics, environment, and altered brain structure and chemistry may play a role.Manic episodes may include symptoms such as high energy, reduced need for sleep, and loss of touch with reality. Depressive episodes may include symptoms such as low energy, low motivation, and loss of interest in daily activities.  Mood episodes last days to months at a time and may also be associated with suicidal thoughts.Treatment is usually lifelong and often involves a combination of medications and psychotherapy.
Bipolar disorder.subtitle: Very common
Bipolar disorder.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of medications and therapy
treatment.content: Treatment is usually lifelong and often involves a combination of medications and psychotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Psychoeducation, Family therapy, and Psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Manic episodes may include symptoms such as high energy, reduced need for sleep, and loss of touch with reality. Depressive episodes may include symptoms such as low energy, low motivation, and loss of interest in daily activities.  Mood episodes last days to months at a time and may also be associated with suicidal thoughts.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Mood: mood swings, sadness, elevated mood, anger, anxiety, apathy, apprehension, euphoria, general discontent, guilt, hopelessness, loss of interest, or loss of interest or pleasure in activities
Behavioral: irritability, risk taking behaviors, disorganized behavior, aggression, agitation, crying, excess desire for sex, hyperactivity, impulsivity, restlessness, or self-harm
Cognitive: unwanted thoughts, delusion, lack of concentration, racing thoughts, slowness in activity, or false belief of superiority
Psychological: depression, manic episode, agitated depression, or paranoia
Weight: weight gain or weight loss
Sleep: difficulty falling asleep or excess sleepiness
Also common: fatigue or rapid and frenzied speaking

Bladder cancer.name: Bladder cancer
Bladder cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that begins in the bladder.This cancer typically affects older adults. It's usually diagnosed early, when it's still treatable. It's likely to recur, so follow-up tests are typically recommended.The most common symptom is blood in the urine.Treatments include surgery, biological therapy, and chemotherapy.
Bladder cancer.subtitle: Rare
Bladder cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery, biological therapy, and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Ureterostomy, Radiation therapy, and Urinary diversion

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Ureterosigmoidostomy, Surgical removal of all or part of the bladder, Cystoprostatectomy, and Cystourethrectomy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The most common symptom is blood in the urine.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur during urination
Urinary: dark urine, frequent urination, or blood in urine

Blood poisoning (sepsis).name: Blood poisoning (sepsis)
Blood poisoning (sepsis).overview:
Description
A life-threatening complication of an infection.Sepsis occurs when chemicals released in the bloodstream to fight an infection trigger inflammation throughout the body. This can cause a cascade of changes that damage multiple organ systems, leading them to fail, sometimes even resulting in death.Symptoms include fever, difficulty breathing, low blood pressure, fast heart rate, and mental confusion.Treatment includes antibiotics and intravenous fluids.
Blood poisoning (sepsis).subtitle: Common
Blood poisoning (sepsis).smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and fluids
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics and intravenous fluids.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Mechanical ventilation, Hospitalization, Fluid replacement, and IV fluids

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Vasoconstrictor, Antibiotics, Blood pressure support, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fever, difficulty breathing, low blood pressure, fast heart rate, and mental confusion.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: low blood pressure, chills, dizziness, fatigue, fever, flushing, low body temperature, or shivering
Cognitive: altered level of consciousness or mental confusion
Respiratory: fast breathing or shortness of breath
Also common: delirium, fast heart rate, insufficient urine production, organ dysfunction, skin discoloration, or sleepiness

Bone cancer.name: Bone cancer
Bone cancer.overview:
Description
A mass of unusual cells growing in a bone. Most bone tumors aren't cancerous.Causes of bone tumors include abnormal healing of an injury, inherited conditions, radiation therapy. It can also be caused by bone cancer or another cancer that has spread to the bone from other parts of the body.A bone tumor may cause a painless mass. Some people have dull, aching pain. And in some cases, minor injury causes a fracture near the tumor.Treatments include surgery and radiation. Some noncancerous tumors go away without treatment.
Bone cancer.subtitle: Rare
Bone cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery and radiation. Some noncancerous tumors go away without treatment.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Bone grafting, Arthrodesis, Wide local excision, and Limb sparing surgical resection

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A bone tumor may cause a painless mass. Some people have dull, aching pain. And in some cases, minor injury causes a fracture near the tumor.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bones or joints
Also common: bone fracture, feeling tired, limping, swelling, or weight loss

Botulism.name: Botulism
Botulism.overview:
Description
A rare poisoning caused by toxins produced by Clostridium botulinum bacteria.Botulism can be fatal and requires emergency medical care.  It can occur in infants, be spread in food, or infect a wound.Symptoms include difficulty swallowing or speaking, facial weakness, and paralysis.Treatments are an antitoxin injection and breathing assistance.
Botulism.subtitle: Extremely rare
Botulism.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Spreads through contaminated food or water
Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care and transfusions
treatment.content: Treatments are an antitoxin injection and breathing assistance.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include difficulty swallowing or speaking, facial weakness, and paralysis.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: constipation, nausea, or vomiting
Eyes: dilated pupil, drooping of upper eyelid, or weak eye muscles
Mouth: drooling or dryness
Visual: blurred vision or double vision
Whole body: dizziness or fatigue
Also common: difficulty speaking, difficulty swallowing, facial muscle weakness, paralysis with weak muscles, shortness of breath, slow reflexes, or urinary retention

Bowel cancer.name: Bowel cancer
Bowel cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer of the colon or rectum, located at the digestive tract's lower end.Early cases can begin as noncancerous polyps. These often have no symptoms but can be detected by screening. For this reason, doctors recommend screenings for those at high risk or over the age of 50.Colorectal cancer symptoms depend on the size and location of the cancer. Some commonly experienced symptoms include changes in bowel habits, changes in stool consistency, blood in the stool, and abdominal discomfort.Colorectal cancer treatment depends on the size, location, and how far the cancer has spread.
Bowel cancer.subtitle: Common
Bowel cancer.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Colorectal cancer treatment depends on the size, location, and how far the cancer has spread. Common treatments include surgery to remove the cancer, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Colorectal cancer symptoms depend on the size and location of the cancer. Some commonly experienced symptoms include changes in bowel habits, changes in stool consistency, blood in the stool, and abdominal discomfort.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: blood in stool, change in bowel habits, constipation, narrow stools, or passing excessive amounts of gas
Whole body: anemia or fatigue
Also common: abdominal discomfort or weight loss

Brain tumours.name: Brain tumours
Brain tumours.overview:
Description
A cancerous or noncancerous mass or growth of abnormal cells in the brain.Tumors can start in the brain, or cancer elsewhere in the body can spread to the brain.Symptoms include new or increasingly strong headaches, blurred vision, loss of balance, confusion, and seizures. In some cases, there may be no symptoms.Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Brain tumours.subtitle: Common
Brain tumours.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include new or increasingly strong headaches, blurred vision, loss of balance, confusion, and seizures. In some cases, there may be no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Headache: can be acute or persistent
Muscular: difficulty walking, instability, muscle weakness, problems with coordination, weakness of one side of the body, or weakness of the arms and legs
Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, or vertigo
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Sensory: pins and needles or reduced sensation of touch
Cognitive: inability to speak or understand language or mental confusion
Also common: blurred vision, difficulty speaking, personality change, seizures, or sleepiness

Breast cancer.name: Breast cancer
Breast cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts.Breast cancer can occur in women and rarely in men.Symptoms of breast cancer include a lump in the breast, bloody discharge from the nipple, and changes in the shape or texture of the nipple or breast.Treatment depends on the stage of cancer. It may consist of chemotherapy, radiation, and surgery.
Breast cancer.subtitle: Common
Breast cancer.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment depends on the stage of cancer. It may consist of chemotherapy, radiation, and surgery.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Mammaplasty, Tissue expansion, Lymph node dissection, Lumpectomy, and Mastectomy

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Estrogen modulator, Chemotherapy, Hormone based chemotherapy, and Bone health

symptoms.content: Symptoms of breast cancer include a lump in the breast, bloody discharge from the nipple, and changes in the shape or texture of the nipple or breast.

symptom_list: Breast: discomfort, inverted nipple, lumps, or nipple discharge
Also common: redness or swollen lymph nodes

Bronchiectasis.name: Bronchiectasis
Bronchiectasis.overview:
Description
A condition in which the lungs' airways become damaged, making it hard to clear mucus.Bronchiectasis may result from an infection or medical condition, such as pneumonia or cystic fibrosis. Mucus builds up and breeds bacteria, causing frequent infections.Symptoms include a daily cough that occurs over months or years and daily production of large amounts of phlegm.Treatment may include physical therapy and medications, such as antibiotics and drugs to help loosen mucus.
Bronchiectasis.subtitle: Rare
Bronchiectasis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.content: Treatment may include physical therapy and medications, such as antibiotics and drugs to help loosen mucus.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Physical therapy, Pulmonary rehabilitation, and Airway clearance technique

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a daily cough that occurs over months or years and daily production of large amounts of phlegm.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest
Cough: can be chronic, with blood, or with phlegm
Respiratory: shortness of breath, sinusitis, or wheezing
Whole body: fatigue or inability to exercise
Also common: phlegm, recurrent infection, or weight loss

Bronchitis.name: Bronchitis
Bronchitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the lining of bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from the lungs.Acute bronchitis is often caused by a viral respiratory infection and improves by itself.Symptoms of bronchitis include coughing up thickened mucus and shortness of breath.Treatments usually includes soothing remedies to help with coughing, which may last weeks. Antibiotics are not usually recommended.
Bronchitis.subtitle: Very common
Bronchitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and cough medications
treatment.content: Treatments usually includes soothing remedies to help with coughing, which may last weeks. Antibiotics are not usually recommended.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Narcotic, and Cough medicine

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms of bronchitis include coughing up thickened mucus and shortness of breath.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cough: can be chronic, dry, or with phlegm
Whole body: fatigue or malaise
Nasal: runny nose or post-nasal drip
Also common: chest pressure, headache, shortness of breath, sleeping difficulty, or sore throat

Brucellosis.name: Brucellosis
Brucellosis.overview:
Description
An infection spread from animals to people, mostly by unpasteurized dairy products.Brucellosis is a bacterial infection that affects thousands of people worldwide. Avoiding unpasteurized dairy products and taking precautions when working with animals or in a laboratory can help prevent brucellosis.Symptoms may include joint and muscle pain, fever, weight loss, and fatigue. Some people develop belly pain and cough.Treatment includes antibiotics. Relapses are common.
Brucellosis.subtitle: Very rare
Brucellosis.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics. Relapses are common.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms may include joint and muscle pain, fever, weight loss, and fatigue. Some people develop belly pain and cough.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, back, joints, or muscles
Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, loss of appetite, or night sweats
Also common: coughing, headache, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Bubonic plague.name: Bubonic plague
Bubonic plague.overview:
Description
A rare but serious bacterial infection that's transmitted by fleas.The bubonic plague is caused by the bacteria Yersinia pestis. It can spread through contact with infected fleas.Symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, which can be as large as chicken eggs, in the groin, armpit, or neck. They may be tender and warm. Others include fever, chills, headache, fatigue, and muscle aches.Bubonic plague requires urgent hospital treatment with strong antibiotics.
Bubonic plague.subtitle: Extremely rare
Bubonic plague.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Bubonic plague requires urgent hospital treatment with strong antibiotics.

symptoms.content: Symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, which can be as large as chicken eggs, in the groin, armpit, or neck. They may be tender and warm. Others include fever, chills, headache, fatigue, and muscle aches.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or muscles
Cough: can be with blood
Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, or malaise
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Also common: bleeding, delirium, headache, phlegm, shortness of breath, or swollen and tender lymph node

Bulimia.name: Bulimia
Bulimia.overview:
Description
A serious eating disorder marked by binging, followed by methods to avoid weight gain.Bulimia is a potentially life-threatening eating disorder.People with this condition binge eat. They then take steps to avoid weight gain. Most commonly, this means vomiting (purging). But it can also mean excessive exercising or fasting.Treatments include counseling, medications, and nutrition education.
Bulimia.subtitle: Common
Bulimia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antidepressants and therapy
treatment.content: Treatments include counseling, medications, and nutrition education.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Cognitive therapy, Dialectical behavior therapy, Counseling psychology, Psychoeducation, Family therapy, Behavior therapy, and Psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: People with this condition binge eat. They then take steps to avoid weight gain. Most commonly, this means vomiting (purging). But it can also mean excessive exercising or fasting.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Behavioral: binge eating, compulsive behavior, impulsivity, self-harm, vomiting after overeating, or lack of restraint
Whole body: dehydration, fatigue, food aversion, hunger, or water-electrolyte imbalance
Mood: anxiety, general discontent, guilt, or mood swings
Mouth: bad breath, dental cavities, or dryness
Gastrointestinal: constipation, heartburn, or inflamed esophagus
Weight: body weight changes or weight loss
Menstrual: absence of menstruation or irregular menstruation
Also common: abnormality of taste, depression, poor self-esteem, or sore throat

Bunion.name: Bunion
Bunion.overview:
Description
A bony bump that forms on the joint at the base of the big toe.A bunion is formed when the big toe pushes against the next toe. Tight shoes, foot stress, and arthritis are causes.The main symptoms are bone deformity, pain, and stiffness.Treatments include changing shoes, padding the foot, and pain medications. Painful bunions can be removed surgically.
Bunion.subtitle: Very common
Bunion.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Treatments include changing shoes, padding the foot, and pain medications. Painful bunions can be removed surgically.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Wide shoes, Bunion pad, and Cold compress

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptoms are bone deformity, pain, and stiffness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints
Foot: deformity at base of big toe or thick skin at base of big toe
Joints: stiffness or swelling
Also common: redness or tenderness

Calculi.name: Calculi
Calculi.overview:
Description
A small, hard deposit that forms in the kidneys and is often painful when passed.Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals and acid salts that stick together in concentrated urine. They can be painful when passing through the urinary tract, but usually don't cause permanent damage.The most common symptom is severe pain, usually in the side of the abdomen, that's often associated with nausea.Treatment includes pain relievers and drinking lots of water to help pass the stone. Medical procedures may be needed to remove or break up larger stones.
Calculi.subtitle: Common
Calculi.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and urinary retention medications
treatment.content: Treatment includes pain relievers and drinking lots of water to help pass the stone. Medical procedures may be needed to remove or break up larger stones.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Monitoring for changes or improvement, Increase fluid intake, and IV fluids

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Urinary retention medication, Narcotic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Diuretic

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Extracorporeal shockwave therapy, Ureteroscopic stone removal, and Laser lithotripsy

symptoms.content: The most common symptom is severe pain, usually in the side of the abdomen, that's often associated with nausea.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:

Pain types: can be severe, sharp, or sudden in the abdomen
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Urinary: blood in urine or frequent urination
Also common: sweating

Celiacs disease.name: Celiacs disease
Celiacs disease.overview:
Description
An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.Over time, the immune reaction to eating gluten creates inflammation that damages the small intestine's lining, leading to medical complications. It also prevents absorption of some nutrients (malabsorption).The classic symptom is diarrhea.  Other symptoms include bloating, gas, fatigue, low blood count (anemia), and osteoporosis. Many people have no symptoms.The mainstay of treatment is a strict gluten-free diet that can help manage symptoms and promote intestinal healing.
Celiacs disease.subtitle: Common
Celiacs disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: The mainstay of treatment is a strict gluten-free diet that can help manage symptoms and promote intestinal healing.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The classic symptom is diarrhea.  Other symptoms include bloating, gas, fatigue, low blood count (anemia), and osteoporosis. Many people have no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or joints

Whole body: bone loss, fatigue, or malnutrition
<b>Developmental: delayed puberty or slow growth
Also common: cramping, itching, lactose intolerance, skin rash, or weight loss

Cellulitis.name: Cellulitis
Cellulitis.overview:
Description
A common and potentially serious bacterial skin infection.With cellulitis, the bacteria enter the skin.Cellulitis may spread rapidly. Affected skin appears swollen and red and may be hot and tender.Without treatment with an antibiotic, cellulitis can be life-threatening.
Cellulitis.subtitle: Common
Cellulitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Without treatment with an antibiotic, cellulitis can be life-threatening.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Cellulitis may spread rapidly. Affected skin appears swollen and red and may be hot and tender.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the skin
Skin: warmness, blister, red rashes, or swelling
Whole body: chills, fever, or malaise
Also common: pus

Cerebral palsy.name: Cerebral palsy
Cerebral palsy.overview:
Description
A congenital disorder of movement, muscle tone, or posture.Cerebral palsy is due to abnormal brain development, often before birth.Symptoms include exaggerated reflexes, floppy or rigid limbs, and involuntary motions. These appear by early childhood.Long-term treatment includes physical and other therapies, drugs, and sometimes surgery.
Cerebral palsy.subtitle: Rare
Cerebral palsy.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Long-term treatment includes physical and other therapies, drugs, and sometimes surgery.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Occupational therapy, Stretching, and Physical therapy

symptoms.content: Symptoms include exaggerated reflexes, floppy or rigid limbs, and involuntary motions. These appear by early childhood.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Muscular: difficulty walking, difficulty with bodily movements, muscle rigidity, permanent shortening of muscle, problems with coordination, stiff muscles, overactive reflexes, involuntary movements, muscle weakness, muscle spasms, or paralysis of one side of the body
<b>Developmental: failure to thrive, learning disability, slow growth, or speech delay in a child
Speech: speech disorder or stuttering

Also common: constipation, difficulty swallowing, drooling, hearing loss, leaking of urine, paralysis, physical deformity, scissor gait, seizures, spastic gait, teeth grinding, tremor, or difficulty raising the foot

Cervical cancer.name: Cervical cancer
Cervical cancer.overview:
Description
A malignant tumor of the cervix, the lowermost part of the uterus.A malignant tumor of the lower most part of the uterus (womb) that can be prevented by PAP smear screening and a HPV vaccine.There may be no symptoms. In a few cases, there may be irregular bleeding or pain.Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Cervical cancer.subtitle: Rare
Cervical cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year

Also common: fatigue, nausea, or weight loss

Chagas disease.name: Chagas disease
Chagas disease.overview:
Description
An infectious disease caused by a parasite found in the feces of the triatomine bug.Chagas disease is common in places where the triatomine bug transmits the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi. These places include South America, Central America, and Mexico.The disease can be mild, causing  swelling and fever, or it can be long lasting. Left untreated, it can cause congestive heart failure.Treatment for Chagas disease focuses on taking medications that kill the parasite and on managing symptoms.
Chagas disease.subtitle: Common
Chagas disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antiparasitics
treatment.content: Treatment for Chagas disease focuses on taking medications that kill the parasite and on managing symptoms.

symptoms.content: The disease can be mild, causing  swelling and fever, or it can be long lasting. Left untreated, it can cause congestive heart failure.

Whole body: fever or body ache
Also common: headache, painless swelling around eye, palpitations, or skin rash

Chalazion.name: Chalazion
Chalazion.overview:
Description
A slow-growing, inflammatory lump in the oil gland of the eyelid.A chalazion is most common in adults ages 30 to 50 who also have rosacea or blepharitis.A chalazion may feel like a small, painless bead in the eyelid at first. Over a few days, it may get bigger, red, and rubbery, but remain painless.Some chalazions may not need treatment. Hot compresses may help larger ones. A lasting chalazion may need to be removed by a doctor.
Chalazion.subtitle: Common
Chalazion.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Some chalazions may not need treatment. Hot compresses may help larger ones. A lasting chalazion may need to be removed by a doctor.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A chalazion may feel like a small, painless bead in the eyelid at first. Over a few days, it may get bigger, red, and rubbery, but remain painless.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: lump on the eyelid or eyelid redness

Chickenpox.name: Chickenpox
Chickenpox.overview:
Description
A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.Chickenpox is highly contagious to those who haven't had the disease or been vaccinated against it.The most characteristic symptom is an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.Chickenpox can be prevented by a vaccine. Treatment usually involves relieving symptoms although high-risk groups may receive antiviral medications.
Chickenpox.subtitle: Rare
Chickenpox.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: Chickenpox can be prevented by a vaccine. Treatment usually involves relieving symptoms although high-risk groups may receive antiviral medications.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The most characteristic symptom is an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: blister, scab, ulcers, or red spots
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: headache, itching, sore throat, or swollen lymph nodes

Chilblains.name: Chilblains
Chilblains.overview:
Description
Skin sores or bumps that occur after exposure to very cold temperatures.Chilblains may be an abnormal blood vessel response. Women, underweight people, and those with Raynaud's phenomenon are at increased risk.Common symptoms include itching, bumps, and red- to violet-colored patches on the hands or feet.The skin usually clears up on its own within one to three weeks, though it may recur for years. Medications can help, and so can dressing appropriately for cold weather.
Chilblains.subtitle: Rare
Chilblains.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.content: The skin usually clears up on its own within one to three weeks, though it may recur for years. Medications can help, and so can dressing appropriately for cold weather.

Also common: itching or swelling

Chlamydia.name: Chlamydia
Chlamydia.overview:
Description
A common sexually transmitted infection that may not cause symptoms.Chlamydia affects people of all ages but is most common in young women.Many who have chlamydia don't develop symptoms, but they can still infect others through sexual contact. Symptoms may include genital pain and discharge from the vagina or penis.Antibiotic therapy for the affected patient and the patient's sexual partners is recommended. Screening for other common sexually transmitted infections should also be performed.
Chlamydia.subtitle: Common
Chlamydia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Antibiotic therapy for the affected patient and the patient's sexual partners is recommended. Screening for other common sexually transmitted infections should also be performed.

Cholera.name: Cholera
Cholera.overview:
Description
A bacterial disease causing severe diarrhea and dehydration, usually spread in water.Cholera is fatal if not treated right away.Key symptoms are diarrhea and dehydration. Rarely, shock and seizures may occur in severe cases.Treatment includes rehydration, IV fluids, and antibiotics.
Cholera.subtitle: Extremely rare
Cholera.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Spreads through contaminated food or water
Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes rehydration, IV fluids, and antibiotics.

additional.text: IV fluids and Oral rehydration therapy

Gastrointestinal: nausea, severe diarrhea, vomiting, or watery diarrhea
Whole body: dehydration, lethargy, or water-electrolyte imbalance

Chronic fatigue syndrome.name: Chronic fatigue syndrome
Chronic fatigue syndrome.overview:
Description
A disease characterized by profound fatigue, sleep abnormalities, pain, and other symptoms that are made worse by exertion.Chronic fatigue syndrome occurs more commonly in women. The cause of this condition is unknown, but may include environmental or genetic factors.The main symptom is fatigue for over six months. The fatigue often worsens with activity, but doesn't improve with rest.There is no cure or approved treatment for this condition. However, some symptoms can be treated or managed to provide relief.
Chronic fatigue syndrome.subtitle: Common
Chronic fatigue syndrome.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.content: There is no cure or approved treatment for this condition. However, some symptoms can be treated or managed to provide relief.

Mood: anxiety or apprehension
Also common: depression, headache, muscle weakness, sensitivity to pain, or sore throat

Chronic kidney disease.name: Chronic kidney disease
Chronic kidney disease.overview:
Description
Longstanding disease of the kidneys leading to renal failure.The kidneys filter waste and excess fluid from the blood. As kidneys fail, waste builds up.Symptoms develop slowly and aren't specific to the disease. Some people have no symptoms at all and are diagnosed by a lab test.Medications help manage symptoms. In later stages, filtering the blood with a machine (dialysis) or a transplant may be needed.
Chronic kidney disease.subtitle: Common
Chronic kidney disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Medications help manage symptoms. In later stages, filtering the blood with a machine (dialysis) or a transplant may be needed.

additional.text: Vitamin, Calcium reducer, Bone marrow stimulant, Diuretic, and Dietary supplement

Chronic myeloid leukaemia.name: Chronic myeloid leukaemia
Chronic myeloid leukaemia.overview:
Description
A slowly progressing and uncommon type of blood-cell cancer that begins in the bone marrow.Chronic myelogenous leukemia typically affects older adults. It's caused by a chromosome mutation that occurs spontaneously. Doctors aren't sure what causes the mutation.Many people don't develop symptoms until later stages and the diagnosis is only made through routine blood work. When symptoms do occur, they include bleeding easily, feeling rundown or tired, weight loss, pale skin, and night sweats.Treatments include targeted drugs, stem-cell transplant, chemotherapy, and biological therapy.
Chronic myeloid leukaemia.subtitle: Rare
Chronic myeloid leukaemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include targeted drugs, stem-cell transplant, chemotherapy, and biological therapy.

symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, anemia, malaise, or night sweats
Also common: bleeding, bruising, pallor, reduced ability to exercise, shortness of breath, or weight loss

Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.name: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.overview:
Description
A group of lung diseases that block airflow and make it difficult to breathe.Emphysema and chronic bronchitis are the most common conditions that make up COPD. Damage to the lungs from COPD can't be reversed.Symptoms include shortness of breath, wheezing, or a chronic cough.Rescue inhalers and inhaled or oral steroids can help control symptoms and minimize further damage.
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.subtitle: Very common
Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

symptom_list: Cough: can be dry or with phlegm
Respiratory: frequent respiratory infections, shortness of breath, or wheezing
Whole body: fatigue or inability to exercise
Also common: chest pressure

Cirrhosis.name: Cirrhosis
Cirrhosis.overview:
Description
Chronic liver damage from a variety of causes leading to scarring and liver failure.Hepatitis and chronic alcohol abuse are frequent causes. Liver damage caused by cirrhosis can't be undone, but further damage can be limited.Initially patients may experience fatigue, weakness, and weight loss. During later stages, patients may develop jaundice (yellowing of the skin), gastrointestinal bleeding, abdominal swelling, and confusion.Treatments focus on the underlying cause. In advanced cases, a liver transplant may be needed.
Cirrhosis.subtitle: Common
Cirrhosis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Rubber band ligation, Therapeutic endoscopy, and Transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt

Clostridium difficile.name: Clostridium difficile
Clostridium difficile.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the colon caused by the bacteria Clostridium difficile.Clostridium difficile colitis results from disruption of normal healthy bacteria in the colon, often from antibiotics. C. difficile can also be transmitted from person to person by spores. It can cause severe damage to the colon and even be fatal.Symptoms include diarrhea, belly pain, and fever.Treatment includes antibiotics. Even when treated with antibiotics, the infection may come back. In rare cases, fecal transplant or surgery may be needed.
Clostridium difficile.subtitle: Common
Clostridium difficile.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Spreads by contact with a contaminated object or surface
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

Coccidioidomycosis.name: Coccidioidomycosis
Coccidioidomycosis.overview:
Description
An infection with the fungus coccidioides.The coccidioides fungus is found in soil and causes infection when inhaled. People with suppressed immune systems are particularly at risk.The initial form is often mild, with few symptoms. When symptoms do occur, they may resemble those of the flu, including fever, cough, chills, and chest pain.Mild cases clear up on their own. If symptoms don't improve, antifungal medications may be necessary.
Coccidioidomycosis.subtitle: Rare
Coccidioidomycosis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

Coeliac disease.name: Coeliac disease
Coeliac disease.overview:
Description
An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.Over time, the immune reaction to eating gluten creates inflammation that damages the small intestine's lining, leading to medical complications. It also prevents absorption of some nutrients (malabsorption).The classic symptom is diarrhea.  Other symptoms include bloating, gas, fatigue, low blood count (anemia), and osteoporosis. Many people have no symptoms.The mainstay of treatment is a strict gluten-free diet that can help manage symptoms and promote intestinal healing.
Coeliac disease.subtitle: Common
Coeliac disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

Cold sore.name: Cold sore
Cold sore.overview:
Description
Infection with the herpes simplex virus around the border of the lips.Oral herpes spreads through close personal contact, such as kissing.Oral herpes causes tiny, fluid-filled lesions called cold sores or fever blisters, which can recur.Medications can speed healing and reduce recurrence.
Cold sore.subtitle: Very common
Cold sore.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year

Common cold.name: Common cold
Common cold.overview:
Description
A common viral infection of the nose and throat.In contrast to the flu, a common cold can be caused by many different types of viruses. The condition is usually harmless and symptoms usually resolve within two weeks.Symptoms include a runny nose, sneezing, and congestion. High fever or severe symptoms are reasons to see a doctor, especially in children.Most people recover on their own within two weeks. Over-the-counter products and home remedies can help control symptoms.
Common cold.subtitle: Very common
Common cold.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
