Condyloma.name: Condyloma
Condyloma.overview:
Description
A small bump on the genitals caused by a common sexually transmitted infection.Genital warts are a common sexually transmitted infection caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV).The characteristic symptom is a small bump on the genitals.Vaccines can protect against many genital-wart-causing strains of HPV. Genital warts can be treated with prescription medication applied directly to the warts or can be surgically removed.
Condyloma.subtitle: Very common
Condyloma.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year

Congestive heart disease.name: Congestive heart disease
Congestive heart disease.overview:
Description
A chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.Heart failure can occur if the heart cannot pump (systolic) or fill (diastolic) adequately.Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen legs, and rapid heartbeat.Treatments can include eating less salt, limiting fluid intake, and taking prescription medications. In some cases a defibrillator or pacemaker may be implanted.
Congestive heart disease.subtitle: Common
Congestive heart disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year

Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured

Conjunctivitis.name: Conjunctivitis
Conjunctivitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid.Conjunctivitis, or pink eye, is an irritation or inflammation of the conjunctiva, which covers the white part of the eyeball. It can be caused by allergies or a bacterial or viral infection. Conjunctivitis can be extremely contagious, and is spread by contact with eye secretions from someone who is infected.Symptoms include redness, itching, and tearing of the eyes. It can also lead to discharge or crusting around the eyes.It's important to stop wearing contact lenses while affected by conjunctivitis. It often resolves on its own, but treatment can speed the recovery process. Allergic conjunctivitis can be treated with antihistamines. Bacterial conjunctivitis can be treated with antibiotic eye drops.
Conjunctivitis.subtitle: Very common
Conjunctivitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.content: It's important to stop wearing contact lenses while affected by conjunctivitis. It often resolves on its own, but treatment can speed the recovery process. Allergic conjunctivitis can be treated with antihistamines. Bacterial conjunctivitis can be treated with antibiotic eye drops.

Coronary heart disease.name: Coronary heart disease
Coronary heart disease.overview:
Description
Damage or disease in the heart's major blood vessels.The usual cause is the buildup of plaque. This causes coronary arteries to narrow, limiting blood flow to the heart.Coronary artery disease can range from no symptoms, to chest pain, to a heart attack.Treatments include lifestyle changes, medications, angioplasty, and surgery.
Coronary heart disease.subtitle: Very common
Coronary heart disease.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year

Crohn's disease.name: Crohn's disease
Crohn's disease.overview:
Description
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.Crohn's disease can sometimes cause life-threatening complications.Crohn's disease can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, anemia, and fatigue.  Some people may be symptom free most of their lives, while others can have severe chronic symptoms that never go away.Crohn's disease cannot be cured.  Medications such as steroids and immunosuppressants are used to slow the progression of disease.  If these aren't effective, a patient may require surgery.  Additionally, patients with Crohn's disease may need to receive regular screening for colorectal cancer due to increased risk.
Crohn's disease.subtitle: Rare
Crohn's disease.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of anti-inflammatory medications
treatment.content: Crohn's disease cannot be cured.  Medications such as steroids and immunosuppressants are used to slow the progression of disease.  If these aren't effective, a patient may require surgery.  Additionally, patients with Crohn's disease may need to receive regular screening for colorectal cancer due to increased risk.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Anti-inflammatory, Steroid, Immunosuppressive drug, Vitamin, and Antibiotics

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Crohn's disease can cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, anemia, and fatigue.  Some people may be symptom free most of their lives, while others can have severe chronic symptoms that never go away.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, joints, lower abdomen, or rectum
Pain types: can be mild or severe
Gastrointestinal: bloating, bowel obstruction, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, or flatulence
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Anal: fissures or bleeding
Also common: cramping, depression, flare, mouth ulcer, slow growth, or weight loss

Croup.name: Croup
Croup.overview:
Description
An upper airway infection that blocks breathing and has a distinctive barking cough.Croup generally occurs in children.In addition to a barking cough, symptoms include fever, hoarseness, and labored or noisy breathing.Most cases clear up with home care in three to five days. A doctor may prescribe a steroid for a persistent case. Rarely, a severe case may need hospital care.
Croup.subtitle: Common
Croup.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care
treatment.content: Most cases clear up with home care in three to five days. A doctor may prescribe a steroid for a persistent case. Rarely, a severe case may need hospital care.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Steroid, Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Vasoconstrictor, and Cough medicine

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Oxygen therapy, Can be self-healing, and Airway management

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: In addition to a barking cough, symptoms include fever, hoarseness, and labored or noisy breathing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cough: can be barking
Respiratory: difficulty breathing, fast breathing, noisy breathing, shortness of breath, or wheezing
Whole body: fatigue or fever
Nasal: congestion or runny nose
Speech: hoarseness or impaired voice
Also common: agitation, drooling, phlegm, or sore throat

Cystic fibrosis.name: Cystic fibrosis
Cystic fibrosis.overview:
Description
An inherited life-threatening disorder that damages the lungs and digestive system.Cystic fibrosis affects the cells that produce mucus, sweat, and digestive juices. It causes these fluids to become thick and sticky. They then plug up tubes, ducts, and passageways.Symptoms vary and can include cough, repeated lung infections, inability to gain weight, and fatty stools.Treatments may ease symptoms and reduce complications. Newborn screening helps with early diagnosis.
Cystic fibrosis.subtitle: Rare
Cystic fibrosis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments may ease symptoms and reduce complications. Newborn screening helps with early diagnosis.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Dietary supplement, Antibiotics, Penicillin, and Cough medicine

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms vary and can include cough, repeated lung infections, inability to gain weight, and fatty stools.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Cough: can be chronic, with blood, or with phlegm
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, fat in stool, heartburn, severe constipation, or bulky stools
Respiratory: pulmonary hypertension, shortness of breath, sinusitis, or wheezing
<b>Developmental: delayed development, delayed puberty, or slow growth
Whole body: fatigue or inability to exercise
Also common: acute bronchitis, deformity of nails, infection, male infertility, nasal polyps, pneumonia, salty sweat, or weight loss

Cystitis.name: Cystitis
Cystitis.overview:
Description
An infection in any part of the urinary system, the kidneys, bladder, or urethra.Urinary tract infections are more common in women. They usually occur in the bladder or urethra, but more serious infections involve the kidney.A bladder infection may cause pelvic pain, increased urge to urinate, pain with urination, and blood in the urine. A kidney infection may cause back pain, nausea, vomiting, and fever.Common treatment is with antibiotics.
Cystitis.subtitle: Very common
Cystitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Common treatment is with antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: A bladder infection may cause pelvic pain, increased urge to urinate, pain with urination, and blood in the urine. A kidney infection may cause back pain, nausea, vomiting, and fever.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bladder, groin, lower abdomen, or pelvis
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination or during sexual intercourse
Urinary: foul smelling urine, frequent urination, bladder spasm, cloudy urine, dark urine, persistent urge to urinate, sense of incomplete bladder emptying, or blood in urine
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or malaise
Also common: cramping or vaginal irritation

Deep vein thrombosis.name: Deep vein thrombosis
Deep vein thrombosis.overview:
Description
A blood clot in a deep vein, usually in the legs.This condition is serious because blood clots can loosen and lodge in the lungs.Leg pain or swelling may occur, but there may be no symptoms.Treatments include medications and use of compression stockings.
Deep vein thrombosis.subtitle: Common
Deep vein thrombosis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of blood thinners
treatment.content: Treatments include medications and use of compression stockings.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Leg pain or swelling may occur, but there may be no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the calf, foot, or leg
Also common: swelling in extremities, tenderness, or warm skin

Dengue.name: Dengue
Dengue.overview:
Description
A mosquito-borne viral disease occurring in tropical and subtropical areas.Those who become infected with the virus a second time are at a significantly greater risk of developing severe disease.Symptoms are high fever, rash, and muscle and joint pain. In severe cases there is serious bleeding and shock, which can be life threatening.Treatment includes fluids and pain-relievers. Severe cases require hospital care.
Dengue.subtitle: Very rare
Dengue.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications and fluids
treatment.content: Treatment includes fluids and pain-relievers. Severe cases require hospital care.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Fluid replacement, Can be self-healing, Oral rehydration therapy, and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms are high fever, rash, and muscle and joint pain. In severe cases there is serious bleeding and shock, which can be life threatening.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, back, back of the eyes, bones, joints, or muscles
Whole body: chills, fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Skin: rashes or red spots
Also common: bleeding, easy bruising, headache, or sore throat

Dental abscess.name: Dental abscess
Dental abscess.overview:
Description
A pocket of pus in a tooth caused by an infection.The infection can result from an untreated cavity, injury, or old dental work.Symptoms include pain, bad breath, and fever.The abscess must be drained. A root canal or antibiotics may be needed. Sometimes, the tooth needs to be pulled.
Dental abscess.subtitle: Common
Dental abscess.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and procedures
treatment.content: The abscess must be drained. A root canal or antibiotics may be needed. Sometimes, the tooth needs to be pulled.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Root canal, Incision and drainage, Dental filling, and Tooth extraction

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antibiotics, Penicillin, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Analgesic

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include pain, bad breath, and fever.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the jaw
Mouth: toothache, bad breath, dental cavities, or tooth loss
Also common: pus, fever, or swollen lymph nodes

Depression.name: Depression
Depression.overview:
Description
A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities, causing significant impairment in daily life.Possible causes include a combination of biological, psychological, and social sources of distress. Increasingly, research suggests these factors may cause changes in brain function, including altered activity of certain neural circuits in the brain.The persistent feeling of sadness or loss of interest that characterizes major depression can lead to a range of behavioral and physical symptoms. These may include changes in sleep, appetite, energy level, concentration, daily behavior, or self-esteem. Depression can also be associated with thoughts of suicide.The mainstay of treatment is usually medication, talk therapy, or a combination of the two. Increasingly, research suggests these treatments may normalize brain changes associated with depression.Take a self-assessment
Depression.subtitle: Very common
Depression.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antidepressants
treatment.content: The mainstay of treatment is usually medication, talk therapy, or a combination of the two. Increasingly, research suggests these treatments may normalize brain changes associated with depression.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Cognitive behavioral therapy, Behavior therapy, and Psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The persistent feeling of sadness or loss of interest that characterizes major depression can lead to a range of behavioral and physical symptoms. These may include changes in sleep, appetite, energy level, concentration, daily behavior, or self-esteem. Depression can also be associated with thoughts of suicide.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Mood: anxiety, apathy, general discontent, guilt, hopelessness, loss of interest or pleasure in activities, mood swings, or sadness
Behavioral: agitation, excessive crying, irritability, restlessness, or social isolation
Sleep: early awakening, excess sleepiness, insomnia, or restless sleep
Whole body: excessive hunger, fatigue, or loss of appetite
Cognitive: lack of concentration, slowness in activity, or thoughts of suicide
Weight: weight gain or weight loss
Also common: poor appetite or repeatedly going over thoughts

Dermatitis herpetiformis.name: Dermatitis herpetiformis
Dermatitis herpetiformis.overview:
Description
A chronic, very itchy skin rash made up of bumps and blisters.The exact cause of dermatitis herpetiformis isn't known. Genetics, gluten sensitivity, and disorders in which the immune system attacks healthy cells (autoimmune disorders) may play a role.The main symptom is an off-and-on skin rash.Antibiotics and a gluten-free diet are treatments.
Dermatitis herpetiformis.subtitle: Rare
Dermatitis herpetiformis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications and anti-inflammatories
treatment.content: Antibiotics and a gluten-free diet are treatments.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The main symptom is an off-and-on skin rash.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: rashes, blister, darkening of the skin, small bump, or redness
Also common: itching

Diphtheria.name: Diphtheria
Diphtheria.overview:
Description
A serious infection of the nose and throat that's easily preventable by a vaccine.A sheet of thick, gray matter covers the back of the throat, making breathing hard.Symptoms include sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes, and weakness.Treatments include antibiotics and an antitoxin that neutralizes the diphtheria toxin. A vaccine is available.
Diphtheria.subtitle: Very rare
Diphtheria.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatments include antibiotics and an antitoxin that neutralizes the diphtheria toxin. A vaccine is available.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include sore throat, fever, swollen lymph nodes, and weakness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: chills, fatigue, fever, or malaise
Respiratory: noisy breathing or shortness of breath
Skin: rashes or ulcers
Speech: hoarseness or impaired voice
Throat: difficulty swallowing or soreness
Also common: coughing, muscle weakness, runny nose, swelling, or swollen lymph nodes

Discoid eczema.name: Discoid eczema
Discoid eczema.overview:
Description
Coin-shaped rashes or sores.With nummular dermatitis, coin-shaped rashes or sores appear on the skin. It may occur after an injury.The sores may spread, ooze, itch, and crust over. The condition can last for months.Treatments can include lotions and bandages. Antihistamines can help with itching. It also helps to avoid irritants such as excess bathing.
Discoid eczema.subtitle: Common
Discoid eczema.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of skin care
treatment.content: Treatments can include lotions and bandages. Antihistamines can help with itching. It also helps to avoid irritants such as excess bathing.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Petroleum jelly, Moisturizer, and Barrier cream

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The sores may spread, ooze, itch, and crust over. The condition can last for months.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: dryness, flakiness, rashes, redness, coin shaped rashes, darkening of the skin, or ulcers
Also common: lesion or itching

Diverticular disease and diverticulitis.name: Diverticular disease and diverticulitis
Diverticular disease and diverticulitis.overview:
Description
A condition in which small, bulging pouches develop in the digestive tract.It's common in people over age 40.Usually, no symptoms occur, unless the diverticula become inflamed or infected (diverticulitis) which can result in fever and abdominal pain.Treatment generally isn't needed unless there is inflammation (diverticulitis).
Diverticular disease and diverticulitis.subtitle: Common
Diverticular disease and diverticulitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: Treatment generally isn't needed unless there is inflammation (diverticulitis).

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Usually, no symptoms occur, unless the diverticula become inflamed or infected (diverticulitis) which can result in fever and abdominal pain.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: change in bowel habits or constipation

Down's syndrome.name: Down's syndrome
Down's syndrome.overview:
Description
A genetic chromosome 21 disorder causing developmental and intellectual delays.Down syndrome is a genetic disorder caused when abnormal cell division results in extra genetic material from chromosome 21.Down syndrome causes a distinct facial appearance, intellectual disability, developmental delays, and may be associated with thyroid or heart disease.Medical specialists will conduct additional screenings. Early intervention programs with a team of therapists and special educators who can treat each child's specific situation are helpful in managing Down syndrome.
Down's syndrome.subtitle: Common
Down's syndrome.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of therapy and self care
treatment.content: Medical specialists will conduct additional screenings. Early intervention programs with a team of therapists and special educators who can treat each child's specific situation are helpful in managing Down syndrome.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Speech therapy, Occupational therapy, and Physical therapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Down syndrome causes a distinct facial appearance, intellectual disability, developmental delays, and may be associated with thyroid or heart disease.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: <b>Developmental: delayed development, learning disability, short stature, or speech delay in a child
Eyes: lazy eye or spots

Also common: difficulty thinking and understanding, brachycephaly, upslanting palpebral fissures, atlantoaxial instability, bent little finger, congenital heart disease, displacement of the tongue, excess skin on the back of the neck, flaccid muscles, hearing loss, immune deficiency, low-set ears, mouth breathing, obesity, obstructive sleep apnea, polycythemia, seborrheic dermatitis, single line on palm, thickening of the skin of the palms and soles, or vision disorder

Dysentery.name: Dysentery
Dysentery.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the intestines accompanied by bloody diarrhea.Dysentery is most often caused by shigella bacteria (shigellosis) or an amoeba. Dysentery is often spread through contaminated food or water.A key symptom is bloody diarrhea. There may also be abdominal pain, cramps, fever, and malaise.Prompt medical care is needed for bloody diarrhea. Treatment may include increased fluid intake, rehydration solutions, IV fluids, and antibiotics.
Dysentery.subtitle: Rare
Dysentery.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Spreads through contaminated food or water
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids
treatment.content: Prompt medical care is needed for bloody diarrhea. Treatment may include increased fluid intake, rehydration solutions, IV fluids, and antibiotics.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: IV fluids, Oral rehydration therapy, and Fluid replacement

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A key symptom is bloody diarrhea. There may also be abdominal pain, cramps, fever, and malaise.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: blood in stool, diarrhea, inability to empty bowels, indigestion, nausea, vomiting, or flatulence
Whole body: dehydration, fever, or malaise
Also common: cramping or weight loss

Dystonia.name: Dystonia
Dystonia.overview:
Description
Involuntary muscle contractions that cause repetitive or twisting movements.Dystonia may affect one or more parts of the body, and sometimes the entire body. The condition can be mild or severe.The main symptom is involuntary muscle contractions that result in slow repetitive movements, cramps, or abnormal posture.Treatments may include drugs, injections, and physical therapy.
Dystonia.subtitle: Common
Dystonia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of medications to increase dopamine
treatment.content: Treatments may include drugs, injections, and physical therapy.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Sensory maneuvers to interrupt dystonia (sensory trick) and Physical therapy

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Muscle relaxant, Neurotoxin, Dopamine promoter, Anti-Tremor, and Sedative

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The main symptom is involuntary muscle contractions that result in slow repetitive movements, cramps, or abnormal posture.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Muscular: cramping or involuntary movements
Also common: eyelid twitching, torticollis, twisting movements, or voice box spasms

Ebola.name: Ebola
Ebola.overview:
Description
A virus that causes severe bleeding, organ failure, and can lead to death.Humans may spread the virus to other humans through contact with bodily fluids such as blood.Initial symptoms include fever, headache, muscle pain, and chills. Later, a person may experience internal bleeding resulting in vomiting or coughing blood.Treatment is supportive hospital care.
Ebola.subtitle: Extremely rare
Ebola.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and supportive care
treatment.content: Treatment is supportive hospital care.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Oxygen therapy, Supportive intensive care, and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Initial symptoms include fever, headache, muscle pain, and chills. Later, a person may experience internal bleeding resulting in vomiting or coughing blood.

symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, chest, joints, or muscles
Whole body: chills, dehydration, fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, malaise, or sweating
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, or vomiting blood
Also common: coughing up blood, eye redness, headache, mental confusion, red spots on skin, or sore throat

Ectopic pregnancy.name: Ectopic pregnancy
Ectopic pregnancy.overview:
Description
A pregnancy in which the fertilized egg implants outside the uterus.The fertilized egg can't survive outside the uterus. If left to grow, it may damage nearby organs and cause life-threatening loss of blood.Symptoms include pelvic pain and vaginal bleeding.To prevent complications, treatment is needed. In the early stages, medications may be sufficient. Later stages require surgery.
Ectopic pregnancy.subtitle: Rare
Ectopic pregnancy.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of chemotherapy
treatment.content: To prevent complications, treatment is needed. In the early stages, medications may be sufficient. Later stages require surgery.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Vacuum aspiration and Dilation and evacuation

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include pelvic pain and vaginal bleeding.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the pelvis, abdomen, or side part of the body
Gastrointestinal: bloating, nausea, or vomiting
Also common: abnormal vaginal bleeding or cramping

Encephalitis.name: Encephalitis
Encephalitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the brain, often due to infection.The infection may be bacterial or viral. In some cases, encephalitis may be the result of an immune system disorder.Mild cases may cause no symptoms or mild flu-like symptoms. Severe cases can be life-threatening. Immediate medical attention is needed for symptoms such as confusion, hallucinations, seizures, weakness, and loss of sensation.In addition to addressing the underlying cause, treatments include symptomatic relief and supportive care.
Encephalitis.subtitle: Rare
Encephalitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: In addition to addressing the underlying cause, treatments include symptomatic relief and supportive care.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Fluid replacement and Can be self-healing

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Mild cases may cause no symptoms or mild flu-like symptoms. Severe cases can be life-threatening. Immediate medical attention is needed for symptoms such as confusion, hallucinations, seizures, weakness, and loss of sensation.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles
Muscular: muscle weakness, problems with coordination, rhythmic muscle contractions, or unsteady gait
Whole body: fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, or malaise
Cognitive: altered level of consciousness, disorientation, or mental confusion
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Psychological: delirium or hallucination
Also common: irritability, light sensitivity, headache, stiff neck, reduced sensation of touch, or seizures

Endometriosis.name: Endometriosis
Endometriosis.overview:
Description
A disorder in which tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside the uterus.With endometriosis, the tissue can be found on the ovaries, fallopian tubes or the intestines.The most common symptoms are pain and menstrual irregularities.Effective treatments, such as hormones and excision surgery, are available.
Endometriosis.subtitle: Common
Endometriosis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of hormones
treatment.content: Effective treatments, such as hormones and excision surgery, are available.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Cauterization, Ablation, Electrocoagulation, and Endometrial ablation

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The most common symptoms are pain and menstrual irregularities.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the lower abdomen, lower back, pelvis, rectum, or vagina
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse or while defecating
Menstrual: abnormal menstruation, heavy menstruation, irregular menstruation, painful menstruation, or spotting
Gastrointestinal: constipation or nausea
Abdominal: abdominal fullness or cramping
Also common: infertility

Epilepsy.name: Epilepsy
Epilepsy.overview:
Description
A disorder in which nerve cell activity in the brain is disturbed, causing seizures.Epilepsy may occur as a result of a genetic disorder or an acquired brain injury, such as a trauma or stroke.During a seizure, a person experiences abnormal behavior, symptoms, and sensations, sometimes including loss of consciousness.  There are few symptoms between seizures.Epilepsy is usually treated by medications and in some cases by surgery, devices, or dietary changes.
Epilepsy.subtitle: Common
Epilepsy.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of anticonvulsants
treatment.content: Epilepsy is usually treated by medications and in some cases by surgery, devices, or dietary changes.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nerve pain medication, Sedative, and Anticonvulsant

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: During a seizure, a person experiences abnormal behavior, symptoms, and sensations, sometimes including loss of consciousness.  There are few symptoms between seizures.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fainting or fatigue
Muscular: rhythmic muscle contractions or muscle spasms
Sensory: aura or pins and needles
Also common: seizures, amnesia, anxiety, depression, headache, sleepiness, staring spells, or temporary paralysis after a seizure

Erectile dysfunction (impotence).name: Erectile dysfunction (impotence)
Erectile dysfunction (impotence).overview:
Description
Occurs when a man can't get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.Erectile dysfunction can be a sign of a physical or psychological condition. It can cause stress, relationship strain, and low self-confidence.The main symptom is a man's inability to get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.Patients suffering from erectile dysfunction should first be evaluated for any underlying physical and psychological conditions. If treatment of the underlying conditions doesn't help, medications and assistive devices, such as pumps, can be prescribed.
Erectile dysfunction (impotence).subtitle: Very common
Erectile dysfunction (impotence).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Patients suffering from erectile dysfunction should first be evaluated for any underlying physical and psychological conditions. If treatment of the underlying conditions doesn't help, medications and assistive devices, such as pumps, can be prescribed.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is a man's inability to get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Sexual: sexual dysfunction or reduced sex drive
Also common: soft erections, trouble getting an erection, trouble maintaining an erection, or anxiety

Erectile dysfunctions.name: Erectile dysfunctions
Erectile dysfunctions.overview:
Description
Occurs when a man can't get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.Erectile dysfunction can be a sign of a physical or psychological condition. It can cause stress, relationship strain, and low self-confidence.The main symptom is a man's inability to get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.Patients suffering from erectile dysfunction should first be evaluated for any underlying physical and psychological conditions. If treatment of the underlying conditions doesn't help, medications and assistive devices, such as pumps, can be prescribed.
Erectile dysfunctions.subtitle: Very common
Erectile dysfunctions.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Patients suffering from erectile dysfunction should first be evaluated for any underlying physical and psychological conditions. If treatment of the underlying conditions doesn't help, medications and assistive devices, such as pumps, can be prescribed.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is a man's inability to get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Sexual: sexual dysfunction or reduced sex drive
Also common: soft erections, trouble getting an erection, trouble maintaining an erection, or anxiety

Ewing sarcoma.name: Ewing sarcoma
Ewing sarcoma.overview:
Description
A cancer that most often occurs in and around the bones.Ewing's sarcoma typically occurs in children and young adults. It often begins in the legs, bones of the pelvis, and arms.Bone pain, localized swelling, and tenderness are symptoms. In rare cases bone fractures may also be found.Treatments include chemotherapy, surgery, and radiation.
Ewing sarcoma.subtitle: Extremely rare
Ewing sarcoma.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include chemotherapy, surgery, and radiation.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Bone pain, localized swelling, and tenderness are symptoms. In rare cases bone fractures may also be found.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, bones, or joints
Also common: limping, palpable soft-tissue mass, or swelling

Febrile seizures.name: Febrile seizures
Febrile seizures.overview:
Description
Convulsion in a child that may be caused by a spike in body temperature (fever).A febrile seizure most commonly occurs on the first day of a fever. It may last a few minutes and is usually harmless.Symptoms may include staring, severe shaking, or tightening of the muscles. A child may lose consciousness.Children should be evaluated if it's their first seizure. Emergency medical care is needed for repeated seizures or those lasting over 10 minutes. Medications to treat fever and persistent seizures may be used.
Febrile seizures.subtitle: Rare
Febrile seizures.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Children should be evaluated if it's their first seizure. Emergency medical care is needed for repeated seizures or those lasting over 10 minutes. Medications to treat fever and persistent seizures may be used.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms may include staring, severe shaking, or tightening of the muscles. A child may lose consciousness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fever or fainting
Muscular: muscle spasms or muscle rigidity
Also common: severe shaking or staring spells

Fibroids.name: Fibroids
Fibroids.overview:
Description
Noncancerous growths in the uterus that can develop during a woman's childbearing years.The cause of fibroids isn't well understood. Risk factors include a family history of fibroids, obesity, or early onset of puberty.Symptoms include heavy menstrual bleeding, prolonged periods, and pelvic pain. In some cases, there are no symptoms.Treatments include medications and removal of the fibroid.
Fibroids.subtitle: Common
Fibroids.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments include medications and removal of the fibroid.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Birth control, Hormone, and Sex hormone suppression

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Hysterectomy, Uterine myomectomy, and Laparoscopic surgery

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Ablation, Uterine artery embolization, and Endometrial ablation

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include heavy menstrual bleeding, prolonged periods, and pelvic pain. In some cases, there are no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, lower back, or pelvis
Menstrual: abnormal menstruation, heavy menstruation, irregular menstruation, painful menstruation, or spotting
Also common: abdominal distension or cramping

Fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
Fibromyalgia.overview:
Description
Widespread muscle pain and tenderness.Fibromyalgia is often accompanied by fatigue and altered sleep, memory, and mood.Widespread muscle pain and tenderness are the most common symptoms.Medications, talk therapy, and stress reduction may help control symptoms.
Fibromyalgia.subtitle: Very common
Fibromyalgia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and therapy
treatment.content: Medications, talk therapy, and stress reduction may help control symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Stress management, Relaxation techniques, and Physical exercise

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Biofeedback, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Hydrotherapy, Chiropractic treatment techniques, Stretching, Graded exercise therapy, Massage, and Acupuncture

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: SSRIs, Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Nerve pain medication, and Muscle relaxant

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Widespread muscle pain and tenderness are the most common symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles, abdomen, back, or neck
Pain types: can be chronic, diffuse, sharp, or severe
Pain circumstances: can occur at night
Whole body: fatigue, feeling tired, or malaise
Muscular: muscle tenderness, delayed onset muscle soreness, or muscle spasms
Gastrointestinal: constipation, nausea, or passing excessive amounts of gas
Mood: anxiety, mood swings, or nervousness
Cognitive: forgetfulness or lack of concentration
Hand: sensation of coldness or tingling
Sensory: pins and needles or sensitivity to pain
Sleep: difficulty falling asleep or sleep disturbances
Also common: depression, flare, headache, irritability, joint stiffness, painful menstruation, sensitivity to cold, or tingling feet

Flu.name: Flu
Flu.overview:
Description
A common viral infection that can be deadly, especially in high-risk groups.The flu attacks the lungs, nose, and throat. Young children, older adults, pregnant women, and people with chronic disease or weak immune systems are at high risk.Symptoms include fever, chills, muscle aches, cough, congestion, runny nose, headaches, and fatigue.The flu is treated primarily with rest and fluid to let the body fight the infection on its own. Over-the-counter anti-inflammatory pain relievers may help with symptoms. An annual vaccine can help prevent the flu and limit its complications.
Flu.subtitle: Very common
Flu.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and activity modifications
treatment.content: The flu is treated primarily with rest and fluid to let the body fight the infection on its own. Over-the-counter anti-inflammatory pain relievers may help with symptoms. An annual vaccine can help prevent the flu and limit its complications.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Decongestant, Cough medicine, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, and Antiviral drug

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fever, chills, muscle aches, cough, congestion, runny nose, headaches, and fatigue.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles
Cough: can be dry or with phlegm
Whole body: chills, dehydration, fatigue, fever, flushing, loss of appetite, body ache, or sweating
Nasal: congestion, runny nose, or sneezing
Also common: chest pressure, head congestion, headache, nausea, shortness of breath, sore throat, or swollen lymph nodes

Foetal alcohol syndrome.name: Foetal alcohol syndrome
Foetal alcohol syndrome.overview:
Description
Physical and mental damage in a child due to alcohol exposure while in the womb.This condition can be prevented by abstaining from alcohol during pregnancy.Distinctive facial features, learning disabilities, bone and joint deformities, heart defects, and hyperactivity are some symptoms.The syndrome is irreversible. Treatment, especially if early, can help reduce some symptoms.
Foetal alcohol syndrome.subtitle: Rare
Foetal alcohol syndrome.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of therapy
treatment.content: The syndrome is irreversible. Treatment, especially if early, can help reduce some symptoms.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Distinctive facial features, learning disabilities, bone and joint deformities, heart defects, and hyperactivity are some symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: <b>Developmental: delayed development, failure to thrive, learning disability, low birth weight, short stature, or slow growth
Behavioral: aggression, antisocial behavior, hyperactivity, impulsivity, or irritability
Also common: misshapen face, anxiety, congenital heart disease, hearing loss, intellectual disability, malnutrition, poor coordination, single line on palm, speech impairment, or vision disorder

Food poisoning.name: Food poisoning
Food poisoning.overview:
Description
Illness caused by food contaminated with bacteria, viruses, parasites, or toxins.Infectious organisms or their toxins are the most common causes of food poisoning.Food poisoning symptoms may include cramping, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.Most food poisoning is mild and resolves without treatment. Ensuring adequate hydration is the most important aspect of treatment.
Food poisoning.subtitle: Very common
Food poisoning.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Spreads through contaminated food or water
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care
treatment.content: Most food poisoning is mild and resolves without treatment. Ensuring adequate hydration is the most important aspect of treatment.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Monitoring for changes or improvement, Fluid replacement, and Oral rehydration solution (ORS)

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Food poisoning symptoms may include cramping, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or rectum
Whole body: chills, dehydration, dizziness, fatigue, fever, lightheadedness, loss of appetite, malaise, or sweating
Gastrointestinal: bloating, diarrhea, gagging, indigestion, nausea, vomiting, flatulence, or stomach cramps
Also common: headache or weakness

Fungal nail infection.name: Fungal nail infection
Fungal nail infection.overview:
Description
A nail fungus causing thickened, brittle, crumbly, or ragged nails.Usually, the problems caused by this condition are cosmetic.The main symptoms are changes in the appearance of nails. Rarely, the condition causes pain or a slightly foul odor.Treatments include oral antifungal drugs, medicated nail polish or cream, or nail removal.
Fungal nail infection.subtitle: Very common
Fungal nail infection.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antifungals
treatment.content: Treatments include oral antifungal drugs, medicated nail polish or cream, or nail removal.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptoms are changes in the appearance of nails. Rarely, the condition causes pain or a slightly foul odor.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Nails: discoloration, thickening, or brittle

Gerd.name: Gerd
Gerd.overview:
Description
A digestive disease in which stomach acid or bile irritates the food pipe lining.This is a chronic disease that occurs when stomach acid or bile flows into the food pipe and irritates the lining. Acid reflux and heartburn more than twice a week may indicate GERD.Symptoms include burning pain in the chest that usually occurs after eating and worsens when lying down.Relief from lifestyle changes and over-the-counter medications is usually temporary. Stronger medication may be needed.
Gerd.subtitle: Very common
Gerd.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and antacids
treatment.content: Relief from lifestyle changes and over-the-counter medications is usually temporary. Stronger medication may be needed.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Elevate head of bed, Dietary modification, and Weight loss

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include burning pain in the chest that usually occurs after eating and worsens when lying down.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Gastrointestinal: belching, heartburn, nausea, or regurgitation
Also common: bitter taste, discomfort in upper abdomen, or dry cough

Gallbladder cancer.name: Gallbladder cancer
Gallbladder cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that develops in the gallbladder, a small organ below the liver.The gallbladder's size and location make it easier for the cancer to grow undetected.There may be no symptoms. When symptoms occur, they may include abdominal pain, bloating, itchiness, and fever.Treatments include surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.
Gallbladder cancer.subtitle: Very rare
Gallbladder cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Wedge resection, Lymph node dissection, Laparoscopic surgery, and Cholecystectomy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: There may be no symptoms. When symptoms occur, they may include abdominal pain, bloating, itchiness, and fever.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: bloating, indigestion, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: fever, loss of appetite, or malaise
Also common: itching, lump in the abdomen, weight loss, or yellow skin and eyes

Gallstones.name: Gallstones
Gallstones.overview:
Description
A hardened deposit within the fluid in the gallbladder, a small organ under the liver.Gallstones are hardened deposits of digestive fluid.Gallstones can vary in size and number and may or may not cause symptoms.People who experience symptoms usually require gallbladder removal surgery. Gallstones that don't cause symptoms usually don't need treatment.
Gallstones.subtitle: Very common
Gallstones.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: People who experience symptoms usually require gallbladder removal surgery. Gallstones that don't cause symptoms usually don't need treatment.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Gallstones can vary in size and number and may or may not cause symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back or upper-right abdomen
Pain types: can be severe
Gastrointestinal: indigestion, nausea, or vomiting
Abdominal: cramping from gallstones or discomfort

Ganglion cyst.name: Ganglion cyst
Ganglion cyst.overview:
Description
A noncancerous lump, often on the tendons or joints of wrists and hands.The cause of ganglion cysts is unknown.A ganglion cyst is round, small, and usually painless. Although rare, it can be painful if it presses a nerve. In a few cases, the cyst can interfere with joint movement.A ganglion cyst often clears on its own. If troublesome, it can be drained or removed.
Ganglion cyst.subtitle: Common
Ganglion cyst.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: A ganglion cyst often clears on its own. If troublesome, it can be drained or removed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A ganglion cyst is round, small, and usually painless. Although rare, it can be painful if it presses a nerve. In a few cases, the cyst can interfere with joint movement.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the wrist
Also common: lump or pain in the affected area

Gangrene.name: Gangrene
Gangrene.overview:
Description
Dead tissue caused by an infection or lack of blood flow.The death of tissue often occurs in the extremities or skin from loss of blood supply. The condition often affects toes, fingers, and limbs, but can affect muscles and organs.Symptoms include discolored skin, severe pain followed by numbness, and foul discharge.Gangrene requires urgent care. Treatment includes antibiotics and removing dead tissue.
Gangrene.subtitle: Rare
Gangrene.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of procedures and antibiotics
treatment.content: Gangrene requires urgent care. Treatment includes antibiotics and removing dead tissue.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include discolored skin, severe pain followed by numbness, and foul discharge.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: blister, blue skin from poor circulation, dark scab, discoloration, or ulcers
Whole body: fever or low blood pressure
Also common: creaky joints, pus, reduced sensation of touch, or foul-smelling discharge

Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (gord).name: Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (gord)
Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (gord).overview:
Description
A digestive disease in which stomach acid or bile irritates the food pipe lining.This is a chronic disease that occurs when stomach acid or bile flows into the food pipe and irritates the lining. Acid reflux and heartburn more than twice a week may indicate GERD.Symptoms include burning pain in the chest that usually occurs after eating and worsens when lying down.Relief from lifestyle changes and over-the-counter medications is usually temporary. Stronger medication may be needed.
Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (gord).subtitle: Very common
Gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (gord).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
