Gastroenteritis.name: Gastroenteritis
Gastroenteritis.overview:
Description
An intestinal infection marked by diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and fever.Stomach flu is typically spread by contact with an infected person or through contaminated food or water.Diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and low-grade fever are common symptoms.Avoiding contaminated food and water and washing hands often can help prevent infection. Rest and rehydration are the mainstays of treatment.
Gastroenteritis.subtitle: Very common
Gastroenteritis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids
treatment.content: Avoiding contaminated food and water and washing hands often can help prevent infection. Rest and rehydration are the mainstays of treatment.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Can be self-healing, Fluid replacement, Oral rehydration therapy, and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and low-grade fever are common symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, stomach cramps, belching, gagging, indigestion, nausea, vomiting, or flatulence
Whole body: chills, dehydration, fatigue, fever, lethargy, lightheadedness, or loss of appetite
Also common: fast heart rate, headache, insufficient urine production, weakness, or weight loss

Genital herpes.name: Genital herpes
Genital herpes.overview:
Description
A common sexually transmitted infection marked by genital pain and sores.Caused by the herpes simplex virus, the disease can affect both men and women.Pain, itching, and small sores appear first. They form ulcers and scabs. After initial infection, genital herpes lies dormant in the body. Symptoms can recur for years.Medications can be used to manage outbreaks.
Genital herpes.subtitle: Very common
Genital herpes.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antivirals and self care
treatment.content: Medications can be used to manage outbreaks.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Pain, itching, and small sores appear first. They form ulcers and scabs. After initial infection, genital herpes lies dormant in the body. Symptoms can recur for years.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the penis or vagina
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination
Also common: genital sores, sensation of pins and needles, or skin rash

Genital warts.name: Genital warts
Genital warts.overview:
Description
A small bump on the genitals caused by a common sexually transmitted infection.Genital warts are a common sexually transmitted infection caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV).The characteristic symptom is a small bump on the genitals.Vaccines can protect against many genital-wart-causing strains of HPV. Genital warts can be treated with prescription medication applied directly to the warts or can be surgically removed.
Genital warts.subtitle: Very common
Genital warts.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of topical anti-tumor medications
treatment.content: Vaccines can protect against many genital-wart-causing strains of HPV. Genital warts can be treated with prescription medication applied directly to the warts or can be surgically removed.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The characteristic symptom is a small bump on the genitals.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: warts, itchiness around anus, itching, itching of vagina, or skin burning sensation

Glandular fever.name: Glandular fever
Glandular fever.overview:
Description
Often called mono or kissing disease, an infection with the Epstein-Barr virus.Mono is transmitted by saliva.Symptoms include fatigue, fever, rash, and swollen glands. The elderly may not have typical symptoms.Treatment involves rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain and fever-reducing medicines to ease symptoms.
Glandular fever.subtitle: Very common
Glandular fever.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: Treatment involves rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain and fever-reducing medicines to ease symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Throat lozenge, Bed rest, and Activity restriction

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fatigue, fever, rash, and swollen glands. The elderly may not have typical symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Whole body: fatigue, fever, chills, malaise, or body ache
Also common: sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, swollen tonsils, headache, or nausea

Goitre.name: Goitre
Goitre.overview:
Description
Abnormal enlargement of the butterfly-shaped gland below the Adam's apple (thyroid).A goiter commonly develops as a result of iodine deficiency or inflammation of the thyroid gland.Not all goiters cause symptoms. Symptoms that do occur might include swelling, and cough. Rarely, symptoms may include throat tightness or trouble breathing.A small goiter that doesn't cause symptoms may not need treatment. In some cases, medication or surgery is needed.
Goitre.subtitle: Common
Goitre.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: A small goiter that doesn't cause symptoms may not need treatment. In some cases, medication or surgery is needed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Not all goiters cause symptoms. Symptoms that do occur might include swelling, and cough. Rarely, symptoms may include throat tightness or trouble breathing.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Neck: lump or swelling
Also common: coughing, fast heart rate, inability to tolerate heat, shortness of breath, throat tightness, underactive thyroid, or weight gain

Gonorrhea.name: Gonorrhea
Gonorrhea.overview:
Description
A sexually transmitted bacterial infection that, if untreated, may cause infertility.Regular screening can help detect instances when an infection is present despite having no symptoms.Symptoms include painful urination and abnormal discharge from the penis or vagina. Men may experience testicular pain and women may experience pain in the lower belly. In some cases, gonorrhea has no symptoms.Gonorrhea can be treated with antibiotics.
Gonorrhea.subtitle: Very common
Gonorrhea.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Gonorrhea can be treated with antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include painful urination and abnormal discharge from the penis or vagina. Men may experience testicular pain and women may experience pain in the lower belly. In some cases, gonorrhea has no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the lower abdomen, pelvis, testicle, or vagina
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse or during urination
Groin: abnormal vaginal discharge, discharge from penis, or increased vaginal discharge
Also common: fever, frequent urge to urinate, irregular menstruation, pus, or sore throat

Gout.name: Gout
Gout.overview:
Description
A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.Pain and inflammation occur when too much uric acid crystallizes and deposits in the joints.Symptoms of gout include severe pain, redness, and swelling in joints, often the big toe. Attacks can come suddenly, often at night.During an acute attack, anti-inflammatory medications can help relieve pain and shorten the length of the attack.  Patients with chronic gout can use behavioral modification such as diet, exercise, and decreased intake of alcohol to help minimize the frequency of attacks. Additionally, patients with chronic gout are often put on medications such as colchicine.
Gout.subtitle: Very common
Gout.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and anti-inflammatories
treatment.content: During an acute attack, anti-inflammatory medications can help relieve pain and shorten the length of the attack.  Patients with chronic gout can use behavioral modification such as diet, exercise, and decreased intake of alcohol to help minimize the frequency of attacks. Additionally, patients with chronic gout are often put on medications such as colchicine.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise, Weight loss, and Ice packs

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Analgesic, Uric acid reducer, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Anti-inflammatory, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms of gout include severe pain, redness, and swelling in joints, often the big toe. Attacks can come suddenly, often at night.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints, ankle, foot, knee, or toe
Joints: lumps, stiffness, or swelling
Also common: physical deformity or redness

Gum disease.name: Gum disease
Gum disease.overview:
Description
A serious gum infection that damages gums and can destroy the jawbone.Periodontitis is common but fairly preventable. The cause is usually poor oral hygiene. Periodontitis can lead to tooth loss. It's a risk factor for heart and lung diseases.Symptoms include swollen, red, and tender gums.Treatment includes professionally cleaning the pockets around teeth to prevent damage to surrounding bone. Advanced cases may require surgery.
Gum disease.subtitle: Very common
Gum disease.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of improved dental hygiene
treatment.content: Treatment includes professionally cleaning the pockets around teeth to prevent damage to surrounding bone. Advanced cases may require surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include swollen, red, and tender gums.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Mouth: bad breath, toothache, bright red gums, loose teeth, receding gums, tender gums, or tooth loss
Also common: swelling or bleeding

Hiv.name: Hiv
Hiv.overview:
Description
HIV causes AIDS and interferes with the body's ability to fight infections.The virus can be transmitted through contact with infected blood, semen, or vaginal fluids.Within a few weeks of HIV infection, flu-like symptoms such as fever, sore throat, and fatigue can occur. Then the disease is usually asymptomatic until it progresses to AIDS. AIDS symptoms include weight loss, fever or night sweats, fatigue, and recurrent infections.No cure exists for AIDS, but strict adherence to anti-retroviral therapy (ART) can dramatically slow the disease's progress, prevent secondary infections and complications, and prolong life.
Hiv.subtitle: Rare
Hiv.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of HIV antivirals
treatment.content: No cure exists for AIDS, but strict adherence to anti-retroviral therapy (ART) can dramatically slow the disease's progress, prevent secondary infections and complications, and prolong life.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Within a few weeks of HIV infection, flu-like symptoms such as fever, sore throat, and fatigue can occur. Then the disease is usually asymptomatic until it progresses to AIDS. AIDS symptoms include weight loss, fever or night sweats, fatigue, and recurrent infections.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Cough: can be dry
Whole body: fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, malaise, night sweats, or sweating
Gastrointestinal: nausea, persistent diarrhea, vomiting, or watery diarrhea
Throat: difficulty swallowing or soreness
Groin: sores or swelling
Mouth: ulcers or white tongue
Also common: opportunistic infection, headache, oral thrush, pneumonia, red blotches, severe unintentional weight loss, skin rash, or swollen lymph nodes

Haemorrhoids (piles).name: Haemorrhoids (piles)
Haemorrhoids (piles).overview:
Description
Swollen and inflamed veins in the rectum and anus that cause discomfort and bleeding.Hemorrhoids are usually caused from straining during bowel movements, obesity, or pregnancy.Discomfort is a common symptom, especially during bowel movements or when sitting. Other symptoms include itching and bleeding.A high-fiber diet can be effective, along with stool softeners. In some cases, a medical procedure to remove the hemorrhoid may be needed to provide relief.
Haemorrhoids (piles).subtitle: Very common
Haemorrhoids (piles).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications and laxatives
treatment.content: A high-fiber diet can be effective, along with stool softeners. In some cases, a medical procedure to remove the hemorrhoid may be needed to provide relief.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: High fiber diet, Ice packs, Cold compress, Witch hazel extract, and Zinc oxide

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Steroid, Local anesthetic, and Dietary supplement

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Cauterization, Rubber band ligation, Freezing, Sclerotherapy, and Stapled hemorrhoidopexy

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Discomfort is a common symptom, especially during bowel movements or when sitting. Other symptoms include itching and bleeding.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the rectum
Pain circumstances: can occur while sitting
Anal: discomfort, itchiness, swelling, or bleeding
Also common: constipation

Hand, foot and mouth disease.name: Hand, foot and mouth disease
Hand, foot and mouth disease.overview:
Description
A common children's virus causing sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet.The condition is spread by direct contact with saliva or mucus.Symptoms include fever, sore throat, feeling unwell, irritability, and loss of appetite.The virus usually clears up on its own within 10 days. Pain medications help relieve symptoms.
Hand, foot and mouth disease.subtitle: Common
Hand, foot and mouth disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: The virus usually clears up on its own within 10 days. Pain medications help relieve symptoms.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fever, sore throat, feeling unwell, irritability, and loss of appetite.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Whole body: dehydration, fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, or malaise
Skin: blister, peeling, rashes, or red spots
Also common: canker sore, coughing, headache, irritability, or sore throat

Hay fever.name: Hay fever
Hay fever.overview:
Description
An allergic response causing itchy, watery eyes, sneezing, and other similar symptoms.Allergic rhinitis occurs seasonally or year-round. Diagnosis involves history-taking, examination of the nasal passages, and sometimes skin testing.Symptoms include sneezing, runny nose, and red, watery, and itchy eyes.Antihistamine medications can reduce symptoms.
Hay fever.subtitle: Very common
Hay fever.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and antihistamines
treatment.content: Antihistamine medications can reduce symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Steroid, Antihistamine, Decongestant, Eye decongestant, Bronchodilator, and Anti-inflammatory

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include sneezing, runny nose, and red, watery, and itchy eyes.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear
Nasal: congestion, loss of smell, redness, runny nose, post-nasal drip, sneezing, or stuffy nose
Eyes: itchiness, puffy eyes, redness, or watery eyes
Respiratory: breathing through the mouth or wheezing
Also common: coughing, fatigue, headache, itching, phlegm, or throat irritation

Head and neck cancer.name: Head and neck cancer
Head and neck cancer.overview:
Description
A group of cancers of the mouth, sinuses, nose, or throat.Smoking is a significant risk factor.Symptoms can occur in mouth, sinuses, nose, or throat and include a sore or lump that doesn't heal, a persistent sore throat, trouble swallowing, and changes in the voice.Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Head and neck cancer.subtitle: Rare
Head and neck cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Laryngectomy, Neck dissection, and Flap surgery

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms can occur in mouth, sinuses, nose, or throat and include a sore or lump that doesn't heal, a persistent sore throat, trouble swallowing, and changes in the voice.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear
Also common: enlarged neck lymph nodes, hoarseness, or mouth ulcer

Hearing loss.name: Hearing loss
Hearing loss.overview:
Description
Total or significant loss of hearing.Deafness is usually the result of inner ear or nerve damage. It may be caused by a congenital defect, injury, disease, certain medications, exposure to loud noise, or age-related wear and tear.The chief symptom is an inability to hear sound.For some, hearing may be possible with surgery or a hearing device. Lip-reading skills, written or printed text, and sign language may help with communication.
Hearing loss.subtitle: Common
Hearing loss.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: For some, hearing may be possible with surgery or a hearing device. Lip-reading skills, written or printed text, and sign language may help with communication.

additional.subtitle: Devices
additional.text: Cochlear implant, Bone-Anchored hearing aid, and Hearing aid

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The chief symptom is an inability to hear sound.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: hearing problem, ringing in the ears, sensitivity to sound, social isolation, or speech delay in a child

Heart failure.name: Heart failure
Heart failure.overview:
Description
A chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.Heart failure can occur if the heart cannot pump (systolic) or fill (diastolic) adequately.Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen legs, and rapid heartbeat.Treatments can include eating less salt, limiting fluid intake, and taking prescription medications. In some cases a defibrillator or pacemaker may be implanted.
Heart failure.subtitle: Common
Heart failure.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments can include eating less salt, limiting fluid intake, and taking prescription medications. In some cases a defibrillator or pacemaker may be implanted.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise, Quitting smoking, Weight loss, and Low sodium diet

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Diuretic, Beta blocker, ACE inhibitor, Antihypertensive drug, Dietary supplement, Blood pressure support, Vasodilator, and Antianginal

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include shortness of breath, fatigue, swollen legs, and rapid heartbeat.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest
Cough: can be dry or with phlegm
Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, inability to exercise, or loss of appetite
Respiratory: fast breathing, shortness of breath at night, shortness of breath on exercise, or shortness of breath on lying down
Gastrointestinal: water retention or bloating
Also common: excess urination at night, palpitations, swollen feet, swollen legs, or weight gain

Hepatitis a.name: Hepatitis a
Hepatitis a.overview:
Description
A highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus.Hepatitis A is preventable by vaccine. It spreads from contaminated food or water, or contact with someone who is infected.Symptoms include fatigue, nausea, abdominal pain, loss of appetite, and low-grade fever.The condition clears up on its own in one or two months. Rest and adequate hydration can help.
Hepatitis a.subtitle: Very rare
Hepatitis a.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Spreads through contaminated food or water
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of preventative measures and self care
treatment.content: The condition clears up on its own in one or two months. Rest and adequate hydration can help.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fatigue, nausea, abdominal pain, loss of appetite, and low-grade fever.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, joints, or muscles
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: dark urine, itching, weight loss, or yellow skin and eyes

Hepatitis c.name: Hepatitis c
Hepatitis c.overview:
Description
An infection caused by a virus that attacks the liver and leads to inflammation.The virus is spread by contact with contaminated blood, for example, from sharing needles or from unsterile tattoo equipment.Most people have no symptoms. Those who do develop symptoms may have fatigue, nausea, loss of appetite, and yellowing of the eyes and skin.Hepatitis C is treated with antiviral medications. In some people, newer medicines can eradicate the virus.
Hepatitis c.subtitle: Common
Hepatitis c.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of hcv antivirals
treatment.content: Hepatitis C is treated with antiviral medications. In some people, newer medicines can eradicate the virus.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Most people have no symptoms. Those who do develop symptoms may have fatigue, nausea, loss of appetite, and yellowing of the eyes and skin.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: bleeding, bloating, fluid in the abdomen, or nausea
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Skin: web of swollen blood vessels in the skin or yellow skin and eyes
Also common: depression or weight loss

Hepatitis d.name: Hepatitis d
Hepatitis d.overview:
Description
A serious liver disease caused by infection with the hepatitis D virus.Hepatitis D occurs only among people who are infected with the Hepatitis B virus.  Transmission requires contact with infectious blood. At-risk populations include intravenous drug abusers and people who have received multiple blood transfusions.Symptoms include abdominal pain, nausea, and fatigue.There are few treatments specifically for hepatitis D although different regimens may be tried. Management also focuses on supportive care.
Hepatitis d.subtitle: Rare
Hepatitis d.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: There are few treatments specifically for hepatitis D although different regimens may be tried. Management also focuses on supportive care.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include abdominal pain, nausea, and fatigue.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Also common: fatigue, nausea, or yellow skin and eyes

Hepatitis e.name: Hepatitis e
Hepatitis e.overview:
Description
A liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus.The hepatitis E virus is mainly transmitted through drinking water contaminated with fecal matter.Symptoms include jaundice, lack of appetite, and nausea.  In rare cases, it may progress to acute liver failure.Hepatitis E usually resolves on its own within four to six weeks. Treatment focuses on supportive care, rehydration, and rest.
Hepatitis e.subtitle: Very rare
Hepatitis e.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Spreads through contaminated food or water
Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.content: Hepatitis E usually resolves on its own within four to six weeks. Treatment focuses on supportive care, rehydration, and rest.

Gastrointestinal: nausea, pale feces, or vomiting
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: dark urine or yellow skin and eyes

Hiatus hernia.name: Hiatus hernia
Hiatus hernia.overview:
Description
A condition in which part of the stomach pushes up through the diaphragm muscle.In hiatal hernia, part of the stomach pushes into the chest cavity. It enters via an opening where the food tube (esophagus) passes on its way to the stomach.Hiatal hernias can have no symptoms. In some cases, they may be associated with heartburn and abdominal discomfort.Hiatal hernias may not require any treatment. Some are treated with drugs and a few types need surgical repair.
Hiatus hernia.subtitle: Common
Hiatus hernia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Hiatal hernias may not require any treatment. Some are treated with drugs and a few types need surgical repair.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Nissen fundoplication, Hernia repair, and Laparoscopic surgery

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Hiatal hernias can have no symptoms. In some cases, they may be associated with heartburn and abdominal discomfort.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or chest
Gastrointestinal: belching, heartburn, hiccup, nausea, regurgitation, or vomiting
Also common: throat irritation

High cholesterol.name: High cholesterol
High cholesterol.overview:
Description
High amounts of cholesterol in the blood.High cholesterol can limit blood flow, increasing risk of heart attack or stroke. It's detected by a blood test.High cholesterol has no symptoms.Treatments include medications, a healthy diet, and exercise.
High cholesterol.subtitle: Very common
High cholesterol.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and statins
treatment.content: Treatments include medications, a healthy diet, and exercise.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise and Low fat diet

symptoms.content: High cholesterol has no symptoms.

symptom_list: Common symptoms: aortic aneurysm, heart attack, peripheral artery disease, or stroke

Hodgkin lymphoma.name: Hodgkin lymphoma
Hodgkin lymphoma.overview:
Description
Cancer of the part of the immune system called the lymphatic system.As the cancer progresses, it limits the body's ability to fight infection.Lymph nodes in the neck, armpits, or groin may swell. Fatigue, fever, and chills are some symptoms.Treatments include chemotherapy, radiation, and in rare cases stem-cell transplant.
Hodgkin lymphoma.subtitle: Rare
Hodgkin lymphoma.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include chemotherapy, radiation, and in rare cases stem-cell transplant.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Lymph nodes in the neck, armpits, or groin may swell. Fatigue, fever, and chills are some symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: shortness of breath, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Huntington's disease.name: Huntington's disease
Huntington's disease.overview:
Description
An inherited condition in which nerve cells in the brain break down over time.It typically starts in a person's 30s or 40s.Usually, Huntington's disease results in progressive movement, thinking (cognitive), and psychiatric symptoms.No cure exists, but drugs, physical therapy, and talk therapy can help manage some symptoms.
Huntington's disease.subtitle: Rare
Huntington's disease.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.content: No cure exists, but drugs, physical therapy, and talk therapy can help manage some symptoms.

symptoms.content: Usually, Huntington's disease results in progressive movement, thinking (cognitive), and psychiatric symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Muscular: abnormality walking, increased muscle activity, involuntary movements, problems with coordination, loss of muscle, or muscle spasms
Cognitive: amnesia, delusion, lack of concentration, mental confusion, slowness in activity, or difficulty thinking and understanding
Behavioral: compulsive behavior, fidgeting, irritability, or lack of restraint
Psychological: delirium, depression, hallucination, or paranoia
Mood: anxiety, apathy, or mood swings
Also common: difficulty speaking, memory loss, tremor, or weight loss

Hypermetropia.name: Hypermetropia
Hypermetropia.overview:
Description
A vision condition in which nearby objects are blurry.Hyperopia is a common vision condition in adults.People with hyperopia must squint to see nearby objects. Reading, writing, computer work, or drawing for long periods of time may cause eye strain and headache.Treatment options include eyeglasses, contact lenses, and surgery such as LASIK.
Hypermetropia.subtitle: Very common
Hypermetropia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.content: Treatment options include eyeglasses, contact lenses, and surgery such as LASIK.

symptoms.content: People with hyperopia must squint to see nearby objects. Reading, writing, computer work, or drawing for long periods of time may cause eye strain and headache.

symptom_list: Visual: blurred vision, vision disorder, or distorted vision
Eyes: eye strain or squinting
Also common: headache

Hyperthyroidism.name: Hyperthyroidism
Hyperthyroidism.overview:
Description
The overproduction of a hormone by the butterfly-shaped gland in the neck (thyroid).Hyperthyroidism is the production of too much thyroxine hormone. It can increase metabolism.Symptoms include unexpected weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat, sweating, and irritability, although the elderly often experience no symptoms.Treatments include radioactive iodine, medications, and sometimes surgery.
Hyperthyroidism.subtitle: Common
Hyperthyroidism.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antithyroid medications
treatment.content: Treatments include radioactive iodine, medications, and sometimes surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include unexpected weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat, sweating, and irritability, although the elderly often experience no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: excess sweating, excessive hunger, fatigue, or heat intolerance
Behavioral: hyperactivity, irritability, or restlessness
Heart: abnormal heart rhythm, fast heart rate, or palpitations
Mood: mood swings, nervousness, or panic attack
Eyes: abnormal protrusion of eyes or puffy eyes
Menstrual: irregular menstruation or short and light menstruation
Sleep: difficulty falling asleep or insomnia
Also common: weight loss, diarrhea, hair loss, muscle weakness, tremor, or warm skin

Hypoglycaemia (low blood sugar).name: Hypoglycaemia (low blood sugar)
Hypoglycaemia (low blood sugar).overview:
Description
Low blood sugar, the body's main energy source.Diabetes treatment and other conditions can cause hypoglycemia.Confusion, heart palpitations, shakiness, and anxiety are symptoms.Consuming high-sugar foods or drinks, such as orange juice or regular soda, can treat this condition. Alternatively, medications can be used to raise blood sugar levels. It's also important that a doctor identify and treat the underlying cause.
Hypoglycaemia (low blood sugar).subtitle: Common
Hypoglycaemia (low blood sugar).smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: Consuming high-sugar foods or drinks, such as orange juice or regular soda, can treat this condition. Alternatively, medications can be used to raise blood sugar levels. It's also important that a doctor identify and treat the underlying cause.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Consume food or drink that is high in sugar

symptoms.content: Confusion, heart palpitations, shakiness, and anxiety are symptoms.

Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Cognitive: mental confusion or unresponsiveness
Mouth: dryness or tingling lips
Also common: anxiety, blurred vision, headache, irritability, pallor, palpitations, sensation of pins and needles, sleepiness, slurred speech, tremor, or unsteadiness

Hypothyroid.name: Hypothyroid
Hypothyroid.overview:
Description
A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.Hypothyroidism's deficiency of thyroid hormones can disrupt such things as heart rate, body temperature, and all aspects of metabolism. Hypothyroidism is most prevalent in older women.Major symptoms include fatigue, cold sensitivity, constipation, dry skin, and unexplained weight gain.Treatment consists of thyroid hormone replacement.
Hypothyroid.subtitle: Very common
Hypothyroid.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of hormones

symptoms.content: Major symptoms include fatigue, cold sensitivity, constipation, dry skin, and unexplained weight gain.

symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, lethargy, or feeling cold
<b>Developmental: delayed puberty or slow growth
Hair: hair loss or dryness

Also common: brittle nails, constipation, dry skin, enlarged thyroid, high cholesterol, irritability, sensitivity to cold, sexual dysfunction, slow heart rate, sluggishness, weight gain, or irregular uterine bleeding

Impetigo.name: Impetigo
Impetigo.overview:
Description
A highly contagious skin infection that causes red sores on the face.Impetigo mainly affects infants and children.The main symptom is red sores that form around the nose and mouth. The sores rupture, ooze for a few days, then form a yellow-brown crust.Antibiotics shorten the infection and can help prevent spread to others.
Impetigo.subtitle: Very common
Impetigo.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of penicillins
treatment.content: Antibiotics shorten the infection and can help prevent spread to others.

symptoms.content: The main symptom is red sores that form around the nose and mouth. The sores rupture, ooze for a few days, then form a yellow-brown crust.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: red rashes or blister
Also common: itching

Influenza.name: Influenza
Influenza.overview:
Description
A common viral infection that can be deadly, especially in high-risk groups.The flu attacks the lungs, nose, and throat. Young children, older adults, pregnant women, and people with chronic disease or weak immune systems are at high risk.Symptoms include fever, chills, muscle aches, cough, congestion, runny nose, headaches, and fatigue.The flu is treated primarily with rest and fluid to let the body fight the infection on its own. Over-the-counter anti-inflammatory pain relievers may help with symptoms. An annual vaccine can help prevent the flu and limit its complications.
Influenza.subtitle: Very common
Influenza.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

Ingrown toenail.name: Ingrown toenail
Ingrown toenail.overview:
Description
A condition in which the corner or side of a toenail grows into the flesh.The condition usually affects the big toe. People who have diabetes are at greater risk of complications.Pain, redness, and swelling can occur at the affected nail.Lifting or removing the toenail can help. Antibiotics might be needed.
Ingrown toenail.subtitle: Very common
Ingrown toenail.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: redness, swelling, tenderness, or limping

Insomnia.name: Insomnia
Insomnia.overview:
Description
Persistent problems falling and staying asleep.Most cases of insomnia are related to poor sleep habits, depression, anxiety, lack of exercise, chronic illness, or certain medications.Symptoms may include difficulty falling or staying asleep and not feeling well-rested.Treatment for insomnia consists of improving sleep habits, behavior therapy, and identifying and treating underlying causes. Sleeping pills may also be used, but should be monitored for side effects.
Insomnia.subtitle: Very common
Insomnia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cognitive: lack of concentration or slowness in activity
Also common: sleeping difficulty, depression, headache, or irritability

Interstitial cystitis.name: Interstitial cystitis
Interstitial cystitis.overview:
Description
A chronic, painful bladder condition.It's often mistaken for a urinary tract infection (UTI), but there is no infection.Symptoms include bladder and pelvic pain or pressure and a frequent urge to urinate.Painful bladder syndrome is often difficult to treat. Therapies may include medications, physical therapy, and biofeedback. Antibiotics haven't been shown to help with painful bladder syndrome.
Interstitial cystitis.subtitle: Common
Interstitial cystitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of lifestyle modification and therapy
treatment.content: Painful bladder syndrome is often difficult to treat. Therapies may include medications, physical therapy, and biofeedback. Antibiotics haven't been shown to help with painful bladder syndrome.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Dietary modification, Bladder training, and Stress management

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Nerve pain medication, and Antihistamine

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include bladder and pelvic pain or pressure and a frequent urge to urinate.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bladder, pelvis, penis, or testicle
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination or during sexual intercourse
Urinary: frequent urge to urinate, frequent urination, bladder spasm, or excessive urination at night

Iron deficiency anaemia.name: Iron deficiency anaemia
Iron deficiency anaemia.overview:
Description
Too few healthy red blood cells due to too little iron in the body.Without enough iron, red blood cells can't carry enough oxygen to body tissues.Iron deficiency often causes low blood cell levels (anemia) and can delay the development of unborn babies.Treatment includes iron supplements and a focus on any underlying causes.
Iron deficiency anaemia.subtitle: Very common
Iron deficiency anaemia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supplements
treatment.content: Treatment includes iron supplements and a focus on any underlying causes.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Iron deficiency often causes low blood cell levels (anemia) and can delay the development of unborn babies.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, lethargy, lightheadedness, or malaise
Also common: brittle nails, hair loss, headache, irritability, restless legs syndrome, or shortness of breath

Iron-deficiency anemia.name: Iron-deficiency anemia
Iron-deficiency anemia.overview:
Description
A condition of too little iron in the body.Iron deficiency is a common cause of too few healthy red blood cells in the body (anemia). In a pregnant woman, iron deficiency puts the baby at risk of developmental delays.Fatigue is the most common symptom.Treatment includes iron supplements and a focus on any underlying causes.
Iron-deficiency anemia.subtitle: Very common
Iron-deficiency anemia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supplements and vitamins
treatment.content: Treatment includes iron supplements and a focus on any underlying causes.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Fatigue is the most common symptom.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, or lightheadedness
Heart: fast heart rate or palpitations
Also common: brittle nails, pallor, or shortness of breath

Irritable bowel syndrome.name: Irritable bowel syndrome
Irritable bowel syndrome.overview:
Description
An intestinal disorder causing pain in the belly, gas, diarrhea, and constipation.The cause of irritable bowel syndrome isn't well understood. A diagnosis is often made based on symptoms.Symptoms include abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and constipation.Some people can control their symptoms by managing diet, lifestyle, and stress. Others will need medication and counseling.
Irritable bowel syndrome.subtitle: Common
Irritable bowel syndrome.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and therapy
treatment.content: Some people can control their symptoms by managing diet, lifestyle, and stress. Others will need medication and counseling.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: High fiber diet, Dietary fiber, Physical exercise, Stress management, and Relaxation techniques

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antidiarrhoeal, Gut antispasmodic, Laxative, Nerve pain medication, Antibiotics, and Dietary supplement

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Biofeedback, Cognitive behavioral therapy, and Brief psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, and constipation.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Pain types: can be recurrent in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: change in bowel habits, constipation, diarrhea, inability to empty bowels, indigestion, nausea, passing excessive amounts of gas, or urgent need to defecate
Abdominal: cramping or discomfort
Also common: anxiety, depression, discomfort, loss of appetite, or symptoms alleviated by defecation

Kaposi's sarcoma.name: Kaposi's sarcoma
Kaposi's sarcoma.overview:
Description
A cancer that causes lesions in the soft tissues.Kaposi sarcoma causes lesions to grow in the skin, lymph nodes, internal organs, and mucous membranes lining the mouth, nose, and throat. It often affects people with immune deficiencies, such as HIV or AIDS.Purple, red, or brown skin blotches are a common sign. Tumors also may develop in other areas of the body.Treatment may include radiation or chemotherapy. Rarely, surgery may be needed.
Kaposi's sarcoma.subtitle: Very rare
Kaposi's sarcoma.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may include radiation or chemotherapy. Rarely, surgery may be needed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Purple, red, or brown skin blotches are a common sign. Tumors also may develop in other areas of the body.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: lesion, rashes, lumps, small bump, swelling, or ulcers
Also common: coughing, fever, mouth ulcer, plaque, shortness of breath, or swollen lymph nodes

Kidney infection.name: Kidney infection
Kidney infection.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the kidney due to a bacterial infection.The inflammation of the kidney is due to a specific type of urinary tract infection (UTI). The UTI usually begins in the urethra or bladder and travels to the kidneys.Fever, frequent urination, and pain in the back, side, or groin are symptoms.Treatment includes antibiotics and often requires hospitalization.
Kidney infection.subtitle: Common
Kidney infection.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics and often requires hospitalization.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Fever, frequent urination, and pain in the back, side, or groin are symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the flank, back, or pelvis
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination
Urinary: urinary tract infection, cloudy urine, foul smelling urine, frequent urge to urinate, frequent urination, or blood in urine
Whole body: chills, fever, fatigue, loss of appetite, or malaise
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: fast heart rate

Kidney stone disease.name: Kidney stone disease
Kidney stone disease.overview:
Description
A small, hard deposit that forms in the kidneys and is often painful when passed.Kidney stones are hard deposits of minerals and acid salts that stick together in concentrated urine. They can be painful when passing through the urinary tract, but usually don't cause permanent damage.The most common symptom is severe pain, usually in the side of the abdomen, that's often associated with nausea.Treatment includes pain relievers and drinking lots of water to help pass the stone. Medical procedures may be needed to remove or break up larger stones.
Kidney stone disease.subtitle: Common
Kidney stone disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and urinary retention medications
treatment.content: Treatment includes pain relievers and drinking lots of water to help pass the stone. Medical procedures may be needed to remove or break up larger stones.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Monitoring for changes or improvement, Increase fluid intake, and IV fluids

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Urinary retention medication, Narcotic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Diuretic

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Extracorporeal shockwave therapy, Ureteroscopic stone removal, and Laser lithotripsy

Urinary: blood in urine or frequent urination
Also common: sweating

Kwashiorkor.name: Kwashiorkor
Kwashiorkor.overview:
Description
Malnutrition produced by a severely inadequate amount of protein in the diet.Protein malnutrition, or kwashiorkor, is mostly found in people living in geographical areas that have limited food resources. It's most commonly seen in children whose diets are low in protein and calories.Delayed growth in children, a swollen belly, and frequent infections are symptoms.Treatment for kwashiorkor may include a slow increase in calories followed by an increase in protein.
Kwashiorkor.subtitle: Very rare
Kwashiorkor.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: Treatment for kwashiorkor may include a slow increase in calories followed by an increase in protein.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: High-protein diet, Breastfeeding, Vitamin and mineral supplementation, and Baby formula

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Delayed growth in children, a swollen belly, and frequent infections are symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: malnutrition, fatigue, loss of appetite, or thirst
Gastrointestinal: bloating or diarrhea
Also common: failure to thrive, severe unintentional weight loss, swelling in extremities, apathy, hair loss, irritability, middle ear infection, or skin rash

Labyrinthitis.name: Labyrinthitis
Labyrinthitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the inner ear or the nerves that connect the inner ear to the brain.Labyrinthitis is usually triggered by an infection, such as a cold or flu.Hearing loss, dizziness, and a spinning sensation (vertigo) are common symptoms. Diagnosing labyrinthitis is challenging because these symptoms are also common in many other conditions.Labyrinthitis usually goes away on its own. Medications can help manage symptoms. Vestibular rehabilitation therapy may help in some cases.
Labyrinthitis.subtitle: Rare
Labyrinthitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antihistamines
treatment.content: Labyrinthitis usually goes away on its own. Medications can help manage symptoms. Vestibular rehabilitation therapy may help in some cases.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antihistamine, Involuntary nervous system blocker, Antiemetic, and Sedative

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Hearing loss, dizziness, and a spinning sensation (vertigo) are common symptoms. Diagnosing labyrinthitis is challenging because these symptoms are also common in many other conditions.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: dizziness, hearing loss, or rapid involuntary eye movement

Lactose intolerance.name: Lactose intolerance
Lactose intolerance.overview:
Description
The inability to fully digest sugar (lactose) in dairy products.Lactose intolerance is usually caused by a deficiency of an enzyme in the body called lactase.Symptoms can include abdominal cramps, bloating, and diarrhea.Treatment focuses on avoidance of dairy products, use of lactose-free products, or the use of lactase supplements.
Lactose intolerance.subtitle: Very common
Lactose intolerance.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of diet modifications
treatment.content: Treatment focuses on avoidance of dairy products, use of lactose-free products, or the use of lactase supplements.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms can include abdominal cramps, bloating, and diarrhea.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: belching, bloating, diarrhea, fat in stool, indigestion, flatulence, or stomach cramps
Also common: baby colic or malaise

Laryngitis.name: Laryngitis
Laryngitis.overview:
Description
An inflammation of the voice box from overuse, irritation, or infection.A viral infection is the most common cause of laryngitis.Laryngitis may last for a short time (acute) or be ongoing (chronic). The main symptoms are hoarseness and loss of voice.Acute laryngitis usually resolves on its own. With chronic laryngitis, treatment is aimed at the underlying condition, such as heartburn or smoking.
Laryngitis.subtitle: Very common
Laryngitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Acute laryngitis usually resolves on its own. With chronic laryngitis, treatment is aimed at the underlying condition, such as heartburn or smoking.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Resting the voice and Throat lozenge

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antacid, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, and Proton-pump inhibitor

symptoms.content: Laryngitis may last for a short time (acute) or be ongoing (chronic). The main symptoms are hoarseness and loss of voice.

Whole body: fever or malaise
Nasal: congestion or runny nose
Speech: impaired voice or hoarseness
Also common: phlegm, sleeping difficulty, or swollen lymph nodes

Lead poisoning.name: Lead poisoning
Lead poisoning.overview:
Description
A buildup of lead in the body, usually over months or years.Lead-based paint and its dust, usually found in older buildings, are common sources of exposure. Young children are especially at risk. Occupational exposure, such as welding, is a more common cause for adults.Symptoms include developmental delays, abdominal pain, neurologic changes, and irritability. At very high levels, it can be fatal.Treatment always involves avoiding further exposure to lead or lead-based products and may include medications to help remove lead from the body.
Lead poisoning.subtitle: Rare
Lead poisoning.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatment always involves avoiding further exposure to lead or lead-based products and may include medications to help remove lead from the body.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include developmental delays, abdominal pain, neurologic changes, and irritability. At very high levels, it can be fatal.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or joints
Gastrointestinal: constipation, nausea, or vomiting
<b>Developmental: learning disability or slow growth
Whole body: fatigue or loss of appetite
Behavioral: hyperactivity or irritability
Also common: baby colic, headache, insomnia, or memory loss

Legionellosis.name: Legionellosis
Legionellosis.overview:
Description
Legionnaires' disease is a type of pneumonia caused by legionella bacteria.Legionnaires' disease doesn't spread from person to person. Instead, the bacteria spreads through mist, such as from air-conditioning units for large buildings. Adults over the age of 50 and people with weak immune systems, chronic lung disease, or heavy tobacco use are most at risk.Many people exposed to the bacteria don't develop symptoms. Those who do develop symptoms may experience cough, fever, chills, shortness of breath, muscle aches, headaches, and diarrhea.Legionnaire's disease can be treated with antibiotics.
Legionellosis.subtitle: Very rare
Legionellosis.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Legionnaire's disease can be treated with antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Many people exposed to the bacteria don't develop symptoms. Those who do develop symptoms may experience cough, fever, chills, shortness of breath, muscle aches, headaches, and diarrhea.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest or muscles
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: fever or chills
Also common: shortness of breath, coughing, headache, or mental confusion

Leprosy.name: Leprosy
Leprosy.overview:
Description
A chronic, curable infectious disease mainly causing skin lesions and nerve damage.Leprosy is caused by infection with the bacterium Mycobacterium leprae. It mainly affects the skin, eyes, nose and peripheral nerves.Symptoms include light colored or red skin patches with reduced sensation, numbness and weakness in hands and feet.Leprosy can be cured with 6-12 months of multi-drug therapy. Early treatment avoids disability.
Leprosy.subtitle: Very rare
Leprosy.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Leprosy can be cured with 6-12 months of multi-drug therapy. Early treatment avoids disability.

symptoms.content: Symptoms include light colored or red skin patches with reduced sensation, numbness and weakness in hands and feet.

Skin: blister, loss of color, rashes, ulcers, or redness
Sensory: reduced sensation of touch, pins and needles, or loss of temperature sensation
Also common: nerve injury or weight loss

Leptospirosis.name: Leptospirosis
Leptospirosis.overview:
Description
A bacterial disease spread through the urine of infected animals.Humans can get leptospirosis through direct contact with urine from infected animals or through water, soil, or food contaminated with their urine. It's most common in warm climates.High fever, headache, bleeding, muscle pain, chills, red eyes, and vomiting are some symptoms.Without treatment, leptospirosis can lead to kidney and liver damage and even death. Antibiotics clear the infection.
Leptospirosis.subtitle: Extremely rare
Leptospirosis.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Without treatment, leptospirosis can lead to kidney and liver damage and even death. Antibiotics clear the infection.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: High fever, headache, bleeding, muscle pain, chills, red eyes, and vomiting are some symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints or muscles
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: chills, fatigue, or high fever
Also common: headache, red eyes, skin rash, or sore throat

Leukemia.name: Leukemia
Leukemia.overview:
Description
A cancer of blood-forming tissues, hindering the body's ability to fight infection.Leukemia is cancer of blood-forming tissues, including bone marrow. Many types exist such as acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.Many patients with slow-growing types of leukemias don't have symptoms. Rapidly growing types of leukemia may cause symptoms that include fatigue, weight loss, frequent infections, and easy bleeding or bruising.Treatment is highly variable. For slow-growing leukemias, treatment may include monitoring. For aggressive leukemias, treatment includes chemotherapy that's sometimes followed by radiation and stem-cell transplant.
Leukemia.subtitle: Rare
Leukemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatment is highly variable. For slow-growing leukemias, treatment may include monitoring. For aggressive leukemias, treatment includes chemotherapy that's sometimes followed by radiation and stem-cell transplant.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Many patients with slow-growing types of leukemias don't have symptoms. Rapidly growing types of leukemia may cause symptoms that include fatigue, weight loss, frequent infections, and easy bleeding or bruising.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bones or joints
Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: bleeding, easy bruising, frequent infections, mouth ulcer, nosebleed, pallor, red spots on skin, shortness of breath, swollen lymph nodes, unintentional weight loss, or weakness

Lichen planus.name: Lichen planus
Lichen planus.overview:
Description
An inflammatory condition of the skin and mucous membranes.Lichen planus occurs when the immune system mistakenly attacks cells of the skin or mucous membranes.On skin, lichen planus appears as purplish, itchy, flat-topped bumps. On mucous membranes, such as in the mouth, it forms lacy white patches, sometimes with painful sores.Lichen planus usually goes away on its own. If symptoms are bothersome, topical creams and oral antihistamines may help.
Lichen planus.subtitle: Common
Lichen planus.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of steroids
treatment.content: Lichen planus usually goes away on its own. If symptoms are bothersome, topical creams and oral antihistamines may help.

symptoms.content: On skin, lichen planus appears as purplish, itchy, flat-topped bumps. On mucous membranes, such as in the mouth, it forms lacy white patches, sometimes with painful sores.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: blister, darkening of the skin, loss of color, peeling, rashes, small bump, ulcers, or redness
Also common: hair loss, itching, or mouth ulcer

Liver cancer.name: Liver cancer
Liver cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that begins in the cells of the liver.The liver is the football-sized organ in the upper right area of the belly.Symptoms are uncommon in the early stages of liver cancer. Later, symptoms may include weight loss, belly pain, vomiting, and yellowed skin.Treatments vary but may include removal of part of the liver, transplant, chemotherapy, and in some cases radiation.
Liver cancer.subtitle: Rare
Liver cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
