Gastrointestinal: bloating, fluid in the abdomen, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: cancer-related fatigue, fatigue, or loss of appetite
Also common: itching, weight loss, or yellow skin and eyes

Lung cancer.name: Lung cancer
Lung cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer that begins in the lungs and most often occurs in people who smoke.Two major types of lung cancer are non-small cell lung cancer and small cell lung cancer. Causes of lung cancer include smoking, secondhand smoke, exposure to certain toxins, and family history.Symptoms include cough (often with blood), chest pain, wheezing, and weight loss. These symptoms often don't appear until the cancer is advanced.Treatments vary but may include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted drug therapy, and immunotherapy.
Lung cancer.subtitle: Common
Lung cancer.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments vary but may include surgery, chemotherapy, radiation therapy, targeted drug therapy, and immunotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Pulmonary lobectomy, Wedge resection, Radiosurgery, and Video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include cough (often with blood), chest pain, wheezing, and weight loss. These symptoms often don't appear until the cancer is advanced.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest or rib
Pain types: can be dull or sharp
Pain circumstances: can occur while breathing
Cough: can be chronic, dry, with phlegm, severe, or with blood
Respiratory: frequent respiratory infections, shortness of breath, or wheezing
Whole body: fatigue or loss of appetite
Also common: chest pressure, hoarseness, swollen lymph nodes, weakness, or weight loss

Lupus erythematosus.name: Lupus erythematosus
Lupus erythematosus.overview:
Description
An inflammatory disease caused when the immune system attacks its own tissues.Lupus (SLE) can affect the joints, skin, kidneys, blood cells, brain, heart, and lungs.Symptoms vary but can include fatigue, joint pain, rash, and fever. These can periodically get worse (flare-up) and then improve.While there's no cure for lupus, current treatments focus on improving quality of life through controlling symptoms and minimizing flare-ups.  This begins with lifestyle modifications, including sun protection and diet.  Further disease management includes medications, such as anti-inflammatories and steroids.
Lupus erythematosus.subtitle: Common
Lupus erythematosus.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of immunosuppressants
treatment.content: While there's no cure for lupus, current treatments focus on improving quality of life through controlling symptoms and minimizing flare-ups.  This begins with lifestyle modifications, including sun protection and diet.  Further disease management includes medications, such as anti-inflammatories and steroids.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms vary but can include fatigue, joint pain, rash, and fever. These can periodically get worse (flare-up) and then improve.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles
Pain types: can be sharp in the chest
Pain circumstances: can occur while breathing
Whole body: anemia, fatigue, fever, or malaise
Hair: hair loss or loss of scalp hair
Skin: red rashes or scaly rashes
Mouth: dryness or ulcers
Also common: anxiety, blood in urine, clinical depression, face rash, flare, headache, joint stiffness, raynaud's syndrome, sensitivity to light, swelling, water retention, or weight loss

Lyme disease.name: Lyme disease
Lyme disease.overview:
Description
A tick-borne illness caused by the bacterium Borrelia burgdorferi.Deer ticks can carry the bacteria that causes Lyme disease.Lyme disease causes a rash, often in a bull's-eye pattern, and flu-like symptoms. Joint pain and weakness in the limbs also can occur.Most people with Lyme disease recover completely with appropriate antibiotic treatment. For those who develop syndromes after their infection is treated, pain medications may provide symptomatic relief.
Lyme disease.subtitle: Common
Lyme disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Most people with Lyme disease recover completely with appropriate antibiotic treatment. For those who develop syndromes after their infection is treated, pain medications may provide symptomatic relief.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antibiotics, Penicillin, and Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Lyme disease causes a rash, often in a bull's-eye pattern, and flu-like symptoms. Joint pain and weakness in the limbs also can occur.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints or muscles
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or malaise
Joints: stiffness or swelling
Also common: bull's-eye pattern rash or headache

Lymphoedema.name: Lymphoedema
Lymphoedema.overview:
Description
Swelling in an arm or leg caused by a lymphatic system blockage.The condition is caused by a blockage in the lymphatic system, part of the immune and circulatory systems.  Lymphedema is most commonly caused by lymph node removal or damage due to cancer treatment.The main symptom is swelling in an arm or leg that may be accompanied by pain or discomfort.Exercise, wrapping, massage, and compression can help.
Lymphoedema.subtitle: Common
Lymphoedema.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of devices and therapy
treatment.content: Exercise, wrapping, massage, and compression can help.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The main symptom is swelling in an arm or leg that may be accompanied by pain or discomfort.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the arms or legs or skin
Skin: dimpled skin like an orange peel or rashes
Also common: swelling in extremities, swollen lymph nodes, or water retention

Lymphoma.name: Lymphoma
Lymphoma.overview:
Description
A cancer of the lymphatic system.The lymphatic system is the body's disease-fighting network. It includes the lymph nodes, spleen, thymus gland, and bone marrow. The main types of lymphoma are Hodgkin's lymphoma and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.Symptoms include enlarged lymph nodes, fatigue, and weight loss.Treatment may involve chemotherapy, medication, radiation therapy, and rarely stem-cell transplant.
Lymphoma.subtitle: Rare
Lymphoma.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may involve chemotherapy, medication, radiation therapy, and rarely stem-cell transplant.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Chemotherapy, Bone marrow stimulant, Steroid, and Blood transfusion

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include enlarged lymph nodes, fatigue, and weight loss.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, loss of appetite, or night sweats
Also common: shortness of breath, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Malaria.name: Malaria
Malaria.overview:
Description
A disease caused by a plasmodium parasite, transmitted by the bite of infected mosquitoes.The severity of malaria varies based on the species of plasmodium.Symptoms are chills, fever, and sweating, usually occurring a few weeks after being bitten.People traveling to areas where malaria is common typically take protective drugs before, during, and after their trip. Treatment includes antimalarial drugs.
Malaria.subtitle: Very rare
Malaria.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antiparasitics
treatment.content: People traveling to areas where malaria is common typically take protective drugs before, during, and after their trip. Treatment includes antimalarial drugs.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms are chills, fever, and sweating, usually occurring a few weeks after being bitten.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or muscles
Whole body: chills, fatigue, fever, night sweats, shivering, or sweating
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Also common: fast heart rate, headache, mental confusion, or pallor

Malnutrition.name: Malnutrition
Malnutrition.overview:
Description
Lack of sufficient nutrients in the body.Malnutrition occurs when the body doesn't get enough nutrients. Causes include a poor diet, digestive conditions, or another disease.Symptoms are fatigue, dizziness, and weight loss. Untreated malnutrition can cause physical or mental disability.Treatment must address any underlying conditions and replace missing nutrients.
Malnutrition.subtitle: Common
Malnutrition.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Treatment must address any underlying conditions and replace missing nutrients.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms are fatigue, dizziness, and weight loss. Untreated malnutrition can cause physical or mental disability.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: <b>Developmental: failure to thrive, short stature, or slow growth
Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, or water-electrolyte imbalance
Muscular: muscle weakness or loss of muscle
Also common: weight loss

Measles.name: Measles
Measles.overview:
Description
A viral infection that's serious for small children but is easily preventable by a vaccine.The disease spreads through the air by respiratory droplets produced from coughing or sneezing.Measles symptoms don't appear until 10 to 14 days after exposure. They include cough, runny nose, inflamed eyes, sore throat, fever, and a red, blotchy skin rash.There's no treatment to get rid of an established measles infection, but over-the-counter fever reducers or vitamin A may help with symptoms.
Measles.subtitle: Extremely rare
Measles.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of preventative measures
treatment.content: There's no treatment to get rid of an established measles infection, but over-the-counter fever reducers or vitamin A may help with symptoms.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Measles symptoms don't appear until 10 to 14 days after exposure. They include cough, runny nose, inflamed eyes, sore throat, fever, and a red, blotchy skin rash.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles
Whole body: fever, malaise, fatigue, or loss of appetite
Nasal: runny nose or sneezing
Also common: skin rash, dry cough, pink eye, diarrhea, headache, koplik's spots, sensitivity to light, sore throat, or swollen lymph nodes

Melanoma.name: Melanoma
Melanoma.overview:
Description
The most serious type of skin cancer.Melanoma occurs when the pigment-producing cells that give color to the skin become cancerous.Symptoms might include a new, unusual growth or a change in an existing mole. Melanomas can occur anywhere on the body.Treatment may involve surgery, radiation, medications, or in some cases chemotherapy.
Melanoma.subtitle: Common
Melanoma.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may involve surgery, radiation, medications, or in some cases chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Skin grafting and Wide local excision

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms might include a new, unusual growth or a change in an existing mole. Melanomas can occur anywhere on the body.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: bigger mole diameter, darkening of the skin, mole color changes, or skin mole with irregular border

Meniere's disease.name: Meniere's disease
Meniere's disease.overview:
Description
An inner ear disorder that causes episodes of vertigo (spinning).Ménière's disease usually starts in one ear, but later may involve both. Smoking, infections, or a high-salt diet may worsen the disease.Symptoms include a spinning sensation (vertigo), hearing loss, ear ringing (tinnitus), and ear pressure. The vertigo may cause severe nausea and imbalance. Hearing loss may become permanent.Drugs for motion sickness or nausea may help manage symptoms.
Meniere's disease.subtitle: Rare
Meniere's disease.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of anti-nausea medications
treatment.content: Drugs for motion sickness or nausea may help manage symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Low sodium diet, Avoid caffeine, Avoid tobacco, and Avoid chocolate

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a spinning sensation (vertigo), hearing loss, ear ringing (tinnitus), and ear pressure. The vertigo may cause severe nausea and imbalance. Hearing loss may become permanent.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: vertigo or dizziness
Ears: feeling of fullness in the ear or ringing
Also common: hearing loss, imbalance, motion sickness, nausea, or rapid involuntary eye movement

Meningitis.name: Meningitis
Meningitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of brain and spinal cord membranes, typically caused by an infection.Meningitis is usually caused by a viral infection but can also be bacterial or fungal. Vaccines can prevent some forms of meningitis.Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.
Meningitis.subtitle: Rare
Meningitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, muscles, or neck
Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, lethargy, loss of appetite, malaise, or shivering
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Skin: blotchy rashes or red rashes

Also common: irritability, mental confusion, sensitivity to light, stiff neck, bulging fontanelle, fast breathing, fast heart rate, fear of loud sounds, headache, lack of interest in feeding in infants, sleepiness, sluggishness, or stiff back

Menopause.name: Menopause
Menopause.overview:
Description
A natural decline in reproductive hormones when a woman reaches her 40s or 50s.Menopause is signaled by 12 months since last menstruation.Common symptoms include hot flashes and vaginal dryness. There may also be sleep disturbances. The combination of these symptoms can cause anxiety or depression.Menopause is a natural process with treatments that focus on symptomatic relief. Vaginal dryness is treated with topical lubricants or estrogens. Medications can reduce the severity and frequency of hot flashes. In special circumstances, oral hormone therapy may be used.
Menopause.subtitle: Very common
Menopause.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Menopause is a natural process with treatments that focus on symptomatic relief. Vaginal dryness is treated with topical lubricants or estrogens. Medications can reduce the severity and frequency of hot flashes. In special circumstances, oral hormone therapy may be used.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Common symptoms include hot flashes and vaginal dryness. There may also be sleep disturbances. The combination of these symptoms can cause anxiety or depression.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse
Whole body: fatigue, night sweats, osteoporosis, hot flashes, or sweating
Sleep: early awakening or insomnia
Menstrual: absence of menstruation or irregular menstruation
Hair: dryness or loss of scalp hair
Also common: anxiety, dry skin, irritability, moodiness, reduced sex drive, or vaginal dryness

Mesothelioma.name: Mesothelioma
Mesothelioma.overview:
Description
A tumor of the tissue that lines the lungs, stomach, heart, and other organs.Cancerous (malignant) mesothelioma is the most common form, usually affecting the lungs.A cough, chest pain, and shortness of breath are symptoms.Treatment may include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy. Supportive treatments can relieve symptoms.
Mesothelioma.subtitle: Very rare
Mesothelioma.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy. Supportive treatments can relieve symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery, Decortication, and Pneumonectomy

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Pleurodesis, Thoracotomy, Radiation therapy, Removal of fluid between the lungs and the chest, and Pericardial window

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: A cough, chest pain, and shortness of breath are symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the chest or rib
Whole body: fatigue, loss of appetite, or night sweats
Gastrointestinal: bloating or nausea
Also common: coughing, shortness of breath, or weight loss

Middle ear infection (otitis media).name: Middle ear infection (otitis media)
Middle ear infection (otitis media).overview:
Description
An infection of the air-filled space behind the eardrum (the middle ear).An ear infection is usually caused by bacteria or viruses.Ear pain and fever are common symptoms. Less commonly, there may be drainage of fluid from the ear or hearing loss.Most ear infections go away on their own. Some require antibiotics.
Middle ear infection (otitis media).subtitle: Very common
Middle ear infection (otitis media).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Most ear infections go away on their own. Some require antibiotics.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Penicillin, Local anesthetic, and Antibiotics

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Ear pain and fever are common symptoms. Less commonly, there may be drainage of fluid from the ear or hearing loss.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear
Whole body: fever, loss of appetite, or vertigo
Ears: inflammation or ringing
Also common: crying, headache, nasal congestion, or nausea

Migraine.name: Migraine
Migraine.overview:
Description
A headache of varying intensity, often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light and sound.Migraine headaches are sometimes preceded by warning symptoms.  Triggers include hormonal changes, certain foods and drinks, stress, and exercise.Migraine headaches can cause throbbing in one particular area that can vary in intensity. Nausea and sensitivity to light and sound are also common symptoms.Preventive and pain-relieving medications can help manage migraine headaches.
Migraine.subtitle: Very common
Migraine.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: Preventive and pain-relieving medications can help manage migraine headaches.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Stress management, Improved sleep habits, Avoid migraine triggers, and Diet modification

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antipsychotic, Analgesic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Stimulant, Nerve pain medication, Triptan, Neurotoxin, and Dietary supplement

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Migraine headaches can cause throbbing in one particular area that can vary in intensity. Nausea and sensitivity to light and sound are also common symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the face or neck
Pain types: can be dull
Headache: can be acute, frequent, or throbbing
Visual: sensitivity to light, distorted vision, or seeing flashes of light
Whole body: dizziness, lightheadedness, or malaise
Sensory: aura or sensitivity to sound
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: irritability, nasal congestion, or scalp tenderness

Miscarriage.name: Miscarriage
Miscarriage.overview:
Description
The spontaneous loss of a woman's pregnancy before the 20th week that can be both physically and emotionally painful.The most common type of pregnancy loss, miscarriages often occur because the fetus isn't developing normally.Symptoms include fluid, blood, or tissue passing from the vagina and pain in the belly or lower back. It’s also common to feel sadness or grief.Unfortunately, the miscarriage process can’t be reversed once it has started. However, medications or procedures such as a dilation and curettage can prevent certain types of complications. In addition, counseling and support is widely available.
Miscarriage.subtitle: Very common
Miscarriage.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care and hormone therapy
treatment.content: Unfortunately, the miscarriage process can’t be reversed once it has started. However, medications or procedures such as a dilation and curettage can prevent certain types of complications. In addition, counseling and support is widely available.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Medical abortion, Dilation and curettage, Vacuum aspiration, and Dilation and evacuation

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fluid, blood, or tissue passing from the vagina and pain in the belly or lower back. It’s also common to feel sadness or grief.

symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen, lower back, or pelvis
Groin: vaginal bleeding, uterine contraction, or vaginal discharge
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: cramping, irregular uterine bleeding, or fatigue

Mononucleosis.name: Mononucleosis
Mononucleosis.overview:
Description
Often called mono or kissing disease, an infection with the Epstein-Barr virus.Mono is transmitted by saliva.Symptoms include fatigue, fever, rash, and swollen glands. The elderly may not have typical symptoms.Treatment involves rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain and fever-reducing medicines to ease symptoms.
Mononucleosis.subtitle: Very common
Mononucleosis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: Treatment involves rest, fluids, and over-the-counter pain and fever-reducing medicines to ease symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Throat lozenge, Bed rest, and Activity restriction

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fatigue, fever, rash, and swollen glands. The elderly may not have typical symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Whole body: fatigue, fever, chills, malaise, or body ache
Also common: sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, swollen tonsils, headache, or nausea

Mouth cancer.name: Mouth cancer
Mouth cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that develops in any part of the mouth.Risk factors include tobacco use, heavy alcohol use, and human papillomavirus (HPV) infection.Symptoms include a sore that doesn't heal, a lump, or a white or red patch on the inside of the mouth.Treatment includes surgery and radiation therapy. In some cases, chemotherapy may be needed.
Mouth cancer.subtitle: Common
Mouth cancer.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment includes surgery and radiation therapy. In some cases, chemotherapy may be needed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a sore that doesn't heal, a lump, or a white or red patch on the inside of the mouth.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear, mouth, or mouth and face
Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Mouth: ulcers, bad breath, or red and white plaques
Also common: coughing or enlarged neck lymph nodes

Multiple myeloma.name: Multiple myeloma
Multiple myeloma.overview:
Description
A cancer of plasma cells.The plasma cells are a type of white blood cell in the bone marrow. With this condition, a group of plasma cells becomes cancerous and multiplies. The disease can damage the bones, immune system, kidneys, and red blood cell count.Symptoms may not be present or may be non-specific, such as loss of appetite, bone pain, and fever.Treatments include medications, chemotherapy, corticosteroids, radiation, or a stem-cell transplant.
Multiple myeloma.subtitle: Rare
Multiple myeloma.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Chemotherapy, Blood transfusion, Steroid, and Bone health

symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back or bones
Whole body: anemia, fatigue, or loss of appetite
Also common: constipation, hypercalcemia, kidney damage, or weight loss

Multiple sclerosis.name: Multiple sclerosis
Multiple sclerosis.overview:
Description
A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.In MS, resulting nerve damage disrupts communication between the brain and the body.Multiple sclerosis causes many different symptoms, including vision loss, pain, fatigue, and impaired coordination.  The symptoms, severity, and duration can vary from person to person. Some people may be symptom free most of their lives, while others can have severe chronic symptoms that never go away.Physical therapy and medications that suppress the immune system can help with symptoms and slow disease progression.
Multiple sclerosis.subtitle: Rare
Multiple sclerosis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of immunosuppressants
treatment.content: Physical therapy and medications that suppress the immune system can help with symptoms and slow disease progression.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Chemotherapy, Anti-inflammatory, Immunosuppressive drug, and Steroid

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Counseling, Support group, Acupuncture, and Physical therapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Multiple sclerosis causes many different symptoms, including vision loss, pain, fatigue, and impaired coordination.  The symptoms, severity, and duration can vary from person to person. Some people may be symptom free most of their lives, while others can have severe chronic symptoms that never go away.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back or eyes
Pain circumstances: can occur in the back due to head nod or with eye movement
Tremor: can occur during precise movements, in the hands, or limbs

Muscular: cramping, difficulty walking, inability to rapidly change motions, involuntary movements, muscle paralysis, muscle rigidity, muscle weakness, problems with coordination, stiff muscles, clumsiness, muscle spasms, or overactive reflexes
Whole body: fatigue, dizziness, heat intolerance, poor balance, or vertigo
Urinary: excessive urination at night, leaking of urine, persistent urge to urinate, or urinary retention
Sensory: pins and needles, abnormality of taste, reduced sensation of touch, or uncomfortable tingling and burning
Visual: blurred vision, double vision, or vision loss
Mood: anxiety or mood swings
Speech: difficulty speaking or slurred speech
Sexual: erectile dysfunction or sexual dysfunction

Also common: constipation, depression, difficulty swallowing, difficulty thinking and understanding, flare, headache, heavy legs, numbness of face, rapid involuntary eye movement, sleep deprivation, tongue numbness, weakness, or difficulty raising the foot

Muscular dystrophy.name: Muscular dystrophy
Muscular dystrophy.overview:
Description
A group of genetic diseases that cause progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.In muscular dystrophies, abnormal genes (mutations) lead to muscle degeneration. Most forms begin in childhood.Damaged muscles become progressively weaker. Most people who have the condition eventually need a wheelchair. Other symptoms include trouble breathing or swallowing.Medications, therapy, breathing aids, or surgery may help maintain function, but life span is often shortened.
Muscular dystrophy.subtitle: Rare
Muscular dystrophy.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of steroids
treatment.content: Medications, therapy, breathing aids, or surgery may help maintain function, but life span is often shortened.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Damaged muscles become progressively weaker. Most people who have the condition eventually need a wheelchair. Other symptoms include trouble breathing or swallowing.

Also common: cardiomyopathy, constantly walking on tip toe, constipation, difficulty swallowing, fatigue, scoliosis, or shallow breathing

Myasthenia gravis.name: Myasthenia gravis
Myasthenia gravis.overview:
Description
A weakness and rapid fatigue of muscles under voluntary control.The condition is caused by a breakdown in communication between nerves and muscles.Symptoms include weakness in the arm and leg muscles, double vision, and difficulties with speech and chewing.Medications, therapy, and surgery can help.
Myasthenia gravis.subtitle: Rare
Myasthenia gravis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

additional.text: Blood transfusion, Muscle strengthener, and Steroid

symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:

Facial: drooping of upper eyelid or muscle weakness
Also common: difficulty speaking, difficulty swallowing, double vision, fatigue, or shortness of breath

Necrotizing fasciitis.name: Necrotizing fasciitis
Necrotizing fasciitis.overview:
Description
A serious bacterial infection that destroys tissue under the skin.Flesh-eating disease occurs when bacteria enter the body through a break in the skin. People with a weakened immune system can be at greater risk of developing this condition.The condition spreads quickly. Symptoms include blisters, fever, fatigue, and pain worse than a person would expect based on the wound's appearance.Treatment involves immediate delivery of IV antibiotics. Surgical removal of dead or infected tissue from the wound is often required.
Necrotizing fasciitis.subtitle: Very rare
Necrotizing fasciitis.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of procedures and antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment involves immediate delivery of IV antibiotics. Surgical removal of dead or infected tissue from the wound is often required.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Surgical drain and Removal of unhealthy tissue

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The condition spreads quickly. Symptoms include blisters, fever, fatigue, and pain worse than a person would expect based on the wound's appearance.

Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, or low blood pressure
Skin: discoloration, redness, blister, or crackling sensation under the skin
Also common: swelling, kidney failure, nausea, or pus

Neuroblastoma.name: Neuroblastoma
Neuroblastoma.overview:
Description
A cancer that is commonly found in the adrenal glands.Neuroblastoma is a cancer often found in the small glands on top of the kidneys (adrenal glands). It can develop in the belly, chest, neck, pelvis, and bones. Children ages five or younger are most commonly affected.Symptoms may include fatigue, loss of appetite, and fever. There may be a lump or compression of tissues in the affected area.Neuroblastoma may require surgery and chemotherapy.
Neuroblastoma.subtitle: Very rare
Neuroblastoma.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Neuroblastoma may require surgery and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation and Radiation therapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms may include fatigue, loss of appetite, and fever. There may be a lump or compression of tissues in the affected area.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or bones
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Eyes: bulging of the eye or dark circles around the eyes
Also common: abdominal distension, coughing, failure to thrive, lump in the abdomen, pallor, shortness of breath, or weight loss

Neuroendocrine tumours.name: Neuroendocrine tumours
Neuroendocrine tumours.overview:
Description
A condition in which the neuroendocrine cells develop into tumors.A neuroendocrine tumor may grow slowly or aggressively and spread to other parts of the body.Many people do not develop symptoms and the tumor is detected incidentally. When symptoms occur, they can vary based on the location of the tumor. In rare cases, skin flushing or fluctuating blood sugar levels may occur.Treatment depends on the type of tumor. Some approaches may include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Neuroendocrine tumours.subtitle: Rare
Neuroendocrine tumours.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment depends on the type of tumor. Some approaches may include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Transarterial chemoembolization, Radiation therapy, and Radiofrequency ablation

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Endocrine surgery, surgery to remove pancreatic tumors, Pancreatectomy, and Hepatectomy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Many people do not develop symptoms and the tumor is detected incidentally. When symptoms occur, they can vary based on the location of the tumor. In rare cases, skin flushing or fluctuating blood sugar levels may occur.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: flushing or low blood sugar

Non-hodgkin lymphoma.name: Non-hodgkin lymphoma
Non-hodgkin lymphoma.overview:
Description
Cancer that starts in the lymphatic system.The condition occurs when the body produces too many abnormal lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell.Symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, belly pain, or chest pain.Treatments may include chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem-cell transplant, or medications.
Non-hodgkin lymphoma.subtitle: Common
Non-hodgkin lymphoma.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments may include chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem-cell transplant, or medications.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Chemotherapy, Bone marrow stimulant, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, belly pain, or chest pain.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Whole body: anemia, fatigue, loss of appetite, or night sweats
Also common: b symptoms, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Obesity.name: Obesity
Obesity.overview:
Description
A disorder involving excessive body fat that increases the risk of health problems.Obesity often results from taking in more calories than are burned by exercise and normal daily activities.Obesity occurs when a person's body mass index is 30 or greater. The main symptom is excessive body fat, which increases the risk of serious health problems.The mainstay of treatment is lifestyle changes such as diet and exercise.
Obesity.subtitle: Very common
Obesity.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: The mainstay of treatment is lifestyle changes such as diet and exercise.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise, Weight loss, Low carbohydrate diet, and Low fat diet

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Obesity occurs when a person's body mass index is 30 or greater. The main symptom is excessive body fat, which increases the risk of serious health problems.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back or joints
Also common: overweight, binge eating, fatigue, pot belly, or snoring

Obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd).name: Obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd)
Obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd).overview:
Description
Excessive thoughts (obsessions) that lead to repetitive behaviors (compulsions).Obsessive-compulsive disorder is characterized by unreasonable thoughts and fears (obsessions) that lead to compulsive behaviors.OCD often centers on themes such as a fear of germs or the need to arrange objects in a specific manner. Symptoms usually begin gradually and vary throughout life.Treatment includes talk therapy, medications, or both.
Obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd).subtitle: Common
Obsessive compulsive disorder (ocd).smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and therapy
treatment.content: Treatment includes talk therapy, medications, or both.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Cognitive behavioral therapy, Aversion therapy, Psychoeducation, Rational emotive behavior therapy, Exposure and response prevention, Psychotherapy, Systematic desensitization, and Group psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: OCD often centers on themes such as a fear of germs or the need to arrange objects in a specific manner. Symptoms usually begin gradually and vary throughout life.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Behavioral: compulsive behavior, agitation, compulsive hoarding, hypervigilance, impulsivity, meaningless repetition of own words, repetitive movements, ritualistic behavior, social isolation, or persistent repetition of words or actions
Mood: anxiety, apprehension, guilt, or panic attack
Psychological: depression or fear
Also common: food aversion, nightmares, or repeatedly going over thoughts

Obstructive sleep apnoea.name: Obstructive sleep apnoea
Obstructive sleep apnoea.overview:
Description
Intermittent airflow blockage during sleep.Obstructive sleep apnea is seen in all age groups, but the frequency increases with age and obesity.Symptoms include snoring and daytime sleepiness.Weight loss, sleeping on one's side, and decreasing alcohol consumption can help. The delivery of pressure via a face or nasal mask (CPAP) is often prescribed. Other common treatments include an oral device and surgery.
Obstructive sleep apnoea.subtitle: Very common
Obstructive sleep apnoea.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Weight loss, sleeping on one's side, and decreasing alcohol consumption can help. The delivery of pressure via a face or nasal mask (CPAP) is often prescribed. Other common treatments include an oral device and surgery.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: BiPap and Continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP)

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Sleeping on side, Avoid alcohol, and Weight loss

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include snoring and daytime sleepiness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Sleep: excessive daytime sleepiness, snoring, gasping during sleep, or insomnia
Respiratory: episodes of no breathing, breathing through the mouth, loud breathing, or shortness of breath
Behavioral: hyperactivity or irritability
Urinary: bedwetting or excessive urination at night
Also common: fatigue, depression, dry mouth, headache, lack of concentration, memory loss, reduced sex drive, sore throat, or teeth grinding

Oesophageal cancer.name: Oesophageal cancer
Oesophageal cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer of the tube that runs from the throat to the stomach (esophagus).Smoking and poorly controlled acid reflux are significant risk factors for esophageal cancer.Symptoms include trouble swallowing, unintentional weight loss, chest pain, worsening indigestion or heartburn, and coughing or hoarseness.Treatment focuses on removing the cancer through surgery. Chemotherapy and radiation also may be used.
Oesophageal cancer.subtitle: Rare
Oesophageal cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment focuses on removing the cancer through surgery. Chemotherapy and radiation also may be used.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include trouble swallowing, unintentional weight loss, chest pain, worsening indigestion or heartburn, and coughing or hoarseness.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: dark stool from digested blood, heartburn, indigestion, nausea, or vomiting blood
Also common: difficulty swallowing, iron deficiency anemia, loss of appetite, or weight loss

Osteoarthritis.name: Osteoarthritis
Osteoarthritis.overview:
Description
A type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down.The wearing down of the protective tissue at the ends of bones (cartilage) occurs gradually and worsens over time.Joint pain in the hands, neck, lower back, knees, or hips is the most common symptom.Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery can help reduce pain and maintain joint movement.
Osteoarthritis.subtitle: Very common
Osteoarthritis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care and therapy
treatment.content: Medications, physical therapy, and sometimes surgery can help reduce pain and maintain joint movement.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Physical exercise, Weight loss, Ice packs, and Menthol

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Dietary supplement, and Narcotic

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Hydrotherapy, Stretching, Physical therapy, and Acupuncture

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Joint pain in the hands, neck, lower back, knees, or hips is the most common symptom.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints, hands, hip, knee, lower back, or neck
Pain circumstances: can occur related to weather
Pain types: can be severe in the joints
Joints: stiffness, crackles, swelling, or tenderness
Hand: bump on the finger or bony outgrowth in fingers or toes
Also common: joint deformity or limping

Osteoporosis.name: Osteoporosis
Osteoporosis.overview:
Description
A condition in which bones become weak and brittle.The body constantly absorbs and replaces bone tissue. With osteoporosis, new bone creation doesn't keep up with old bone removal.Many people have no symptoms until they have a bone fracture.Treatment includes medications, healthy diet, and weight-bearing exercise to help prevent bone loss or strengthen already weak bones.
Osteoporosis.subtitle: Very common
Osteoporosis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supplements and diet modifications
treatment.content: Treatment includes medications, healthy diet, and weight-bearing exercise to help prevent bone loss or strengthen already weak bones.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Vitamin, Dietary supplement, Antacid, Bone health, and Hormone

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Many people have no symptoms until they have a bone fracture.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: bone fracture or loss of height

Osteosarcoma.name: Osteosarcoma
Osteosarcoma.overview:
Description
A type of bone cancer that begins in the cells that form bones.Osteosarcoma most often occurs in the long bones that make up the arms and legs, though it can occur in any bone. It tends to occur in children and young adults.Symptoms include localized bone pain and swelling.Treatment typically involves surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.
Osteosarcoma.subtitle: Very rare
Osteosarcoma.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment typically involves surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Amputation, Bone grafting, and Wide local excision

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include localized bone pain and swelling.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bones or knee
Also common: bone tissue formation, limping, or swelling

Otitis externa.name: Otitis externa
Otitis externa.overview:
Description
An infection of the outer ear canal.Otitis externa is an infection of the outer ear canal that runs from the eardrum to the outside of the head. It's often caused by water remaining in the ear after swimming. This creates a moist environment that helps bacteria or fungi grow.The main symptom is redness in the outer ear accompanied by warmth and pain.A person may be prescribed ear drops and advised to keep the ear dry.
Otitis externa.subtitle: Common
Otitis externa.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: A person may be prescribed ear drops and advised to keep the ear dry.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antibiotics, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Local anesthetic, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is redness in the outer ear accompanied by warmth and pain.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the ear
Also common: feeling of fullness in the ear, hearing loss, itching, redness, or tenderness

Ovarian cancer.name: Ovarian cancer
Ovarian cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer that begins in the female organs that produce eggs (ovaries).Ovarian cancer often goes undetected until it has spread within the pelvis and belly. At this late stage, ovarian cancer is more difficult to treat and can be fatal.Ovarian cancer often has no symptoms in the early stages. Later stages are associated with symptoms, but they can be non-specific, such as loss of appetite and weight loss.Surgery and chemotherapy are generally used to treat ovarian cancer.
Ovarian cancer.subtitle: Rare
Ovarian cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Surgery and chemotherapy are generally used to treat ovarian cancer.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Omentectomy, Salpingoophorectomy, Laparotomy, Hysterectomy, Pelvic lymph node dissection, Lymph node dissection, and Retroperitoneal lymph node dissection

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Ovarian cancer often has no symptoms in the early stages. Later stages are associated with symptoms, but they can be non-specific, such as loss of appetite and weight loss.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or pelvis
Gastrointestinal: bloating, change in bowel habits, indigestion, or nausea
Abdominal: abdominal fullness, fluid in the abdomen, or lump in the abdomen
Whole body: cancer-related fatigue or loss of appetite
Also common: weight loss

Ovarian cyst.name: Ovarian cyst
Ovarian cyst.overview:
Description
A solid or fluid-filled sac or pocket (cyst) within or on the surface of an ovary.Ovarian cysts usually disappear in a few months but can cause complications if they don't.Most ovarian cysts don't cause symptoms. In some cases, menstrual irregularities, pain during intercourse, or irregular bowel movements can occur.Many cysts go away on their own. If not, treatments are birth control pills or surgery.
Ovarian cyst.subtitle: Very common
Ovarian cyst.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of hormones
treatment.content: Many cysts go away on their own. If not, treatments are birth control pills or surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Most ovarian cysts don't cause symptoms. In some cases, menstrual irregularities, pain during intercourse, or irregular bowel movements can occur.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, pelvis, or side part of the body
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse
Menstrual: abnormal menstruation, irregular menstruation, painful menstruation, or spotting
Also common: cramping or excessive hairiness

Overactive thyroid.name: Overactive thyroid
Overactive thyroid.overview:
Description
The overproduction of a hormone by the butterfly-shaped gland in the neck (thyroid).Hyperthyroidism is the production of too much thyroxine hormone. It can increase metabolism.Symptoms include unexpected weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat, sweating, and irritability, although the elderly often experience no symptoms.Treatments include radioactive iodine, medications, and sometimes surgery.
Overactive thyroid.subtitle: Common
Overactive thyroid.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antithyroid medications
treatment.content: Treatments include radioactive iodine, medications, and sometimes surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include unexpected weight loss, rapid or irregular heartbeat, sweating, and irritability, although the elderly often experience no symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: excess sweating, excessive hunger, fatigue, or heat intolerance
Behavioral: hyperactivity, irritability, or restlessness
Heart: abnormal heart rhythm, fast heart rate, or palpitations
Mood: mood swings, nervousness, or panic attack
Eyes: abnormal protrusion of eyes or puffy eyes
Menstrual: irregular menstruation or short and light menstruation
Sleep: difficulty falling asleep or insomnia
Also common: weight loss, diarrhea, hair loss, muscle weakness, tremor, or warm skin

Pancreatic cancer.name: Pancreatic cancer
Pancreatic cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that begins in the organ lying behind the lower part of the stomach (pancreas).The pancreas secretes enzymes that aid digestion and hormones that help regulate the metabolism of sugars. This type of cancer is often detected late, spreads rapidly, and has a poor prognosis.There are no symptoms in the early stages. Later stages are associated with symptoms, but these can be non-specific, such as lack of appetite and weight loss.Treatment may include surgically removing the pancreas, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Pancreatic cancer.subtitle: Rare
Pancreatic cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may include surgically removing the pancreas, radiation, and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: surgery to remove pancreatic tumors and Pancreatectomy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: There are no symptoms in the early stages. Later stages are associated with symptoms, but these can be non-specific, such as lack of appetite and weight loss.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or middle back
Gastrointestinal: fluid in the abdomen or nausea
Whole body: fatigue or loss of appetite
Also common: dark urine, weight loss, or yellow skin and eyes

Parkinson's disease.name: Parkinson's disease
Parkinson's disease.overview:
Description
A disorder of the central nervous system that affects movement, often including tremors.Nerve cell damage in the brain causes dopamine levels to drop, leading to the symptoms of Parkinson's.Parkinson's often starts with a tremor in one hand. Other symptoms are slow movement, stiffness, and loss of balance.Medications can help control the symptoms of Parkinson's.
Parkinson's disease.subtitle: Common
Parkinson's disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of medications to increase dopamine
treatment.content: Medications can help control the symptoms of Parkinson's.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Dopamine promoter, Antidepressant, Cognition-enhancing medication, and Anti-Tremor

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Parkinson's often starts with a tremor in one hand. Other symptoms are slow movement, stiffness, and loss of balance.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Tremor: can occur at rest, in the hands, limbs, or can be postural

Muscular: stiff muscles, difficulty standing, difficulty walking, difficulty with bodily movements, involuntary movements, muscle rigidity, problems with coordination, rhythmic muscle contractions, slow bodily movement, or slow shuffling gait
Sleep: early awakening, nightmares, restless sleep, or sleep disturbances
Whole body: fatigue, dizziness, poor balance, or restlessness
Cognitive: amnesia, confusion in the evening hours, dementia, or difficulty thinking and understanding
Speech: difficulty speaking, soft speech, or voice box spasms
Nasal: distorted sense of smell or loss of smell
Urinary: dribbling of urine or leaking of urine
Mood: anxiety or apathy
Facial: jaw stiffness or reduced facial expression

Also common: blank stare, constipation, depression, difficulty swallowing, drooling, falling, fear of falling, loss in contrast sensitivity, neck tightness, small handwriting, trembling, unintentional writhing, or weight loss

Pelvic inflammatory disease.name: Pelvic inflammatory disease
Pelvic inflammatory disease.overview:
Description
An infection of the female reproductive organs.It usually occurs when sexually transmitted bacteria spread from the vagina to the womb (uterus), fallopian tubes, or ovaries.
Pelvic inflammatory disease.subtitle: Common
Pelvic inflammatory disease.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics.

symptoms.content: Common symptoms include pelvic pain and fever. There may be vaginal discharge.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:

Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse or during urination
Whole body: chills, fatigue, or fever
Groin: cervical motion tenderness, vaginal discharge, or vaginal odor
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: cramping or painful menstruation

Penile cancer.name: Penile cancer
Penile cancer.overview:
Description
A disease in which cancer cells form in the tissues of the penis.Human papillomavirus (HPV) infection may increase the risk of penile cancer. Condom use and the HPV vaccine can help prevent infection with HPV.Penile cancer may begin as a blister on the foreskin, head, or shaft of the penis. It may become a wart-like growth that discharges blood or foul-smelling liquid.Surgery is the most common treatment for all stages of penile cancer. Other options include radiation and chemotherapy.
Penile cancer.subtitle: Very rare
Penile cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Surgery is the most common treatment for all stages of penile cancer. Other options include radiation and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Brachytherapy, Carbon dioxide laser, Radiation therapy, and Mohs surgery

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Lymph node dissection, Penectomy, Wide local excision, and Laser surgery

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Penile cancer may begin as a blister on the foreskin, head, or shaft of the penis. It may become a wart-like growth that discharges blood or foul-smelling liquid.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: lumps or ulcers
Also common: penile lesion, discharge from wound, or swollen lymph nodes

Periodontal disease.name: Periodontal disease
Periodontal disease.overview:
Description
A serious gum infection that damages gums and can destroy the jawbone.Periodontitis is common but fairly preventable. The cause is usually poor oral hygiene. Periodontitis can lead to tooth loss. It's a risk factor for heart and lung diseases.Symptoms include swollen, red, and tender gums.Treatment includes professionally cleaning the pockets around teeth to prevent damage to surrounding bone. Advanced cases may require surgery.
Periodontal disease.subtitle: Very common
Periodontal disease.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of improved dental hygiene
treatment.content: Treatment includes professionally cleaning the pockets around teeth to prevent damage to surrounding bone. Advanced cases may require surgery.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include swollen, red, and tender gums.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Mouth: bad breath, toothache, bright red gums, loose teeth, receding gums, tender gums, or tooth loss
Also common: swelling or bleeding

Peripheral neuropathy.name: Peripheral neuropathy
Peripheral neuropathy.overview:
Description
Weakness, numbness, and pain from nerve damage, usually in the hands and feet.A common cause of peripheral neuropathy is diabetes, but it can also result from injuries, infections, and exposure to toxins.Symptoms include pain, a pins-and-needles sensation, numbness, and weakness.Treatments include antidepressants like amitriptyline, pain medications like oxycodone, anti-seizure medications, and pain-relieving creams. It's also important to treat the underlying condition.
Peripheral neuropathy.subtitle: Very common
Peripheral neuropathy.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of nerve pain medications
treatment.content: Treatments include antidepressants like amitriptyline, pain medications like oxycodone, anti-seizure medications, and pain-relieving creams. It's also important to treat the underlying condition.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Anticonvulsant, Nerve pain medication, Analgesic, Local anesthetic, and Narcotic

symptoms.content: Symptoms include pain, a pins-and-needles sensation, numbness, and weakness.

Pain types: can be burning and tingling or sharp
Pain circumstances: can occur at night
Muscular: cramping, difficulty walking, muscle weakness, problems with coordination, or loss of muscle
Sensory: pins and needles, uncomfortable tingling and burning, oversensitivity, reduced sensation of touch, or sensitivity to pain
Also common: poor balance, slow reflexes, tingling feet, tingling fingers, or weakness

Peritonitis.name: Peritonitis
Peritonitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the membrane lining the abdominal wall and covering the abdominal organs.Peritonitis is usually infectious and often life-threatening. It's caused by leakage or a hole in the intestines, such as from a burst appendix. Even if the fluid is sterile, inflammation can occur.Symptoms usually include pain, tenderness, rigid abdominal muscles, fever, nausea, and vomiting.Antibiotics are almost always needed, along with surgery or drainage.
Peritonitis.subtitle: Common
Peritonitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and fluids
treatment.content: Antibiotics are almost always needed, along with surgery or drainage.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Appendectomy, Laparoscopic surgery, and Exploratory laparotomy

symptoms.content: Symptoms usually include pain, tenderness, rigid abdominal muscles, fever, nausea, and vomiting.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Gastrointestinal: bloating, nausea, or vomiting
Whole body: chills, fever, or loss of appetite
Abdominal: abdominal guarding or fluid in the abdomen
Also common: organ dysfunction

Pertussis.name: Pertussis
Pertussis.overview:
Description
A highly contagious respiratory tract infection that is easily preventable by vaccine.Whooping cough is particularly dangerous for infants.Besides a cough that sounds like "whoop," symptoms include a runny nose, nasal congestion, and sneezing.Treatment includes antibiotics.
Pertussis.subtitle: Rare
Pertussis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics.

Nasal: congestion, runny nose, or sneezing
Whole body: fatigue or fever
Also common: paroxysmal cough, episodes of no breathing, vomiting, or watery eyes

Pleurisy.name: Pleurisy
Pleurisy.overview:
Description
Inflammation of the tissues that line the lungs and chest cavity.Infections, such as the flu, and certain medications can cause pleurisy.Pleurisy causes chest pain that worsens during breathing.Treatment might include anti-inflammatories (NSAIDs), pain relievers, and rest.
Pleurisy.subtitle: Common
Pleurisy.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.content: Treatment might include anti-inflammatories (NSAIDs), pain relievers, and rest.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, and Narcotic

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Removal of fluid between the lungs and the chest

symptoms.content: Pleurisy causes chest pain that worsens during breathing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the side part of the body
Pain circumstances: can occur in the chest while breathing
Respiratory: fast breathing, shallow breathing, or shortness of breath
Also common: dry cough or fever

Pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
Pneumonia.overview:
Description
Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.With pneumonia, the air sacs may fill with fluid or pus. The infection can be life-threatening to anyone, but particularly to infants, children, and people over 65.Symptoms include cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing.Antibiotics can treat many forms of pneumonia. Some forms of pneumonia can be prevented by vaccines.
Pneumonia.subtitle: Very common
Pneumonia.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Antibiotics can treat many forms of pneumonia. Some forms of pneumonia can be prevented by vaccines.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Oxygen therapy, Oral rehydration therapy, and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain types: can be sharp in the chest
Whole body: fever, chills, dehydration, fatigue, loss of appetite, malaise, clammy skin, or sweating
Respiratory: fast breathing, shallow breathing, shortness of breath, or wheezing
Also common: coughing or fast heart rate

Poliomyelitis.name: Poliomyelitis
Poliomyelitis.overview:
Description
A virus that may cause paralysis and is easily preventable by the polio vaccine.Polio is transmitted through contaminated water and food or contact with an infected person.Many people who are infected with the poliovirus don't become sick and have no symptoms. However, those who do get sick develop paralysis, which can sometimes be fatal.Treatment includes bed rest, pain relievers, and portable ventilators.
Poliomyelitis.subtitle: Extremely rare
Poliomyelitis.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Spreads through contaminated food or water
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Treatment includes bed rest, pain relievers, and portable ventilators.

symptoms.content: Many people who are infected with the poliovirus don't become sick and have no symptoms. However, those who do get sick develop paralysis, which can sometimes be fatal.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:

Muscular: muscle weakness, loss of muscle, or muscle quiver
Also common: headache, nausea, or slow growth

Polymyalgia rheumatica.name: Polymyalgia rheumatica
Polymyalgia rheumatica.overview:
Description
An inflammatory disorder causing muscle pain and stiffness around the shoulders and hips.Most people develop polymyalgia rheumatica after age 50. Sometimes this condition occurs with temporal arteritis, a more serious condition that causes inflammation of the lining of the arteries.Symptoms usually develop quickly and include aching of the shoulders, neck, or hipsTreatment is usually a low dose of an oral corticosteroid, such as prednisone. Although treatment often lasts two to three years, most people start to feel better within a day or two.
Polymyalgia rheumatica.subtitle: Common
Polymyalgia rheumatica.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of steroids
treatment.content: Treatment is usually a low dose of an oral corticosteroid, such as prednisone. Although treatment often lasts two to three years, most people start to feel better within a day or two.

Also common: joint stiffness, tenderness, or fatigue

Porphyria.name: Porphyria
Porphyria.overview:
Description
Disorders resulting from buildup of certain chemicals related to red blood cell proteins.Porphyria is a group of disorders caused by an overaccumulation of porphyrin which helps hemoglobin, the protein that carries oxygen in the blood.Symptoms vary depending on the specific type. Acute porphyrias affect the nervous system and other organs. Cutaneous porphyrias primarily affect the skin.Treatment depends on the type of porphyria.
Porphyria.subtitle: Very rare
Porphyria.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

symptoms.content: Symptoms vary depending on the specific type. Acute porphyrias affect the nervous system and other organs. Cutaneous porphyrias primarily affect the skin.

Gastrointestinal: constipation, nausea, or vomiting
Skin: rashes, blister, or darkening of the skin
Muscular: cramping or muscle weakness
Sensory: pins and needles or sensitivity to light
Whole body: nervous system dysfunction or water-electrolyte imbalance
Also common: anxiety, blood in urine, fast heart rate, itching, mental confusion, or seizures

Post-traumatic stress disorder (ptsd).name: Post-traumatic stress disorder (ptsd)
Post-traumatic stress disorder (ptsd).overview:
Description
A disorder in which a person has difficulty recovering after experiencing or witnessing a terrifying event.The condition may last months or years, with triggers that can bring back memories of the trauma accompanied by intense emotional and physical reactions.Symptoms may include nightmares or unwanted memories of the trauma, avoidance of situations that bring back memories of the trauma, heightened reactions, anxiety, or depressed mood.Treatment includes different types of trauma-focused psychotherapy as well as medications to manage symptoms.Take a self-assessment
Post-traumatic stress disorder (ptsd).subtitle: Very common
Post-traumatic stress disorder (ptsd).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of medications and therapy
treatment.content: Treatment includes different types of trauma-focused psychotherapy as well as medications to manage symptoms.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Cognitive behavioral therapy and Eye movement desensitization and reprocessing

symptoms.content: Symptoms may include nightmares or unwanted memories of the trauma, avoidance of situations that bring back memories of the trauma, heightened reactions, anxiety, or depressed mood.

Psychological: flashback, fear, severe anxiety, or mistrust
Mood: loss of interest or pleasure in activities, guilt, or loneliness
Sleep: insomnia or nightmares
Also common: emotional detachment or unwanted thoughts

Postnatal depression.name: Postnatal depression
Postnatal depression.overview:
Description
Depression that occurs after childbirth.Those who develop postpartum depression are at greater risk of developing major depression later on in life.Symptoms might include insomnia, loss of appetite, intense irritability, and difficulty bonding with the baby.Untreated, the condition may last months or longer. Treatment can include counseling, antidepressants, or hormone therapy.Take a self-assessment
Postnatal depression.subtitle: Very common
Postnatal depression.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

symptoms.content: Symptoms might include insomnia, loss of appetite, intense irritability, and difficulty bonding with the baby.

Behavioral: crying, irritability, or restlessness
Whole body: fatigue or loss of appetite
Weight: weight gain or weight loss
Cognitive: lack of concentration or unwanted thoughts
Psychological: depression or fear
Also common: insomnia or repeatedly going over thoughts

Prostate cancer.name: Prostate cancer
Prostate cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer in a man's prostate, a small walnut-sized gland that produces seminal fluid.A man's prostate produces the seminal fluid that nourishes and transports sperm.Symptoms include difficulty with urination, but sometimes there are no symptoms at all.Some types of prostate cancer grow slowly. In some of these cases, monitoring is recommended. Other types are aggressive and require radiation, surgery, hormone therapy, chemotherapy, or other treatments.
Prostate cancer.subtitle: Very common
Prostate cancer.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

Prostatitis.name: Prostatitis
Prostatitis.overview:
Description
Swelling of the small walnut-sized gland (prostate) that produces seminal fluid.Causes of prostatitis may include infection, injury, or an immune system disorder.Symptoms include difficulty urinating, pain in the groin, pelvic area, or genitals, and, sometimes, flu-like symptoms.Prostatitis may get better on its own. If it's caused by a bacterial infection, antibiotics may be prescribed.
Prostatitis.subtitle: Common
Prostatitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Prostatitis may get better on its own. If it's caused by a bacterial infection, antibiotics may be prescribed.

Pain circumstances: can occur during urination
Urinary: dribbling after urination, excessive urination at night, frequent urge to urinate, frequent urination, urinary retention, or blood in urine
Whole body: chills, fatigue, or fever
Also common: discomfort or painful ejaculation

Psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
Psoriasis.overview:
Description
A condition in which skin cells build up and form scales and itchy, dry patches.Psoriasis is thought to be an immune system problem. Triggers include infections, stress, and cold.The most common symptom is a rash on the skin, but sometimes the rash involves the nails or joints.Treatment aims to remove scales and stop skin cells from growing so quickly. Topical ointments, light therapy, and medications can offer relief.
Psoriasis.subtitle: Very common
Psoriasis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.content: Treatment aims to remove scales and stop skin cells from growing so quickly. Topical ointments, light therapy, and medications can offer relief.

Psoriatic arthritis.name: Psoriatic arthritis
Psoriatic arthritis.overview:
Description
A form of arthritis that affects some people who have the skin condition psoriasis.Psoriatic arthritis is a type of inflammatory arthritis.Symptoms include joint pain, stiffness, and swelling, which may flare and subside. Many people with the condition are affected by morning stiffness. Even mild skin psoriasis can have a significant degree of arthritis.Treatment may include medication to reduce inflammation, steroid injections, or joint replacement surgery.
Psoriatic arthritis.subtitle: Common
Psoriatic arthritis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

Pulmonary embolism.name: Pulmonary embolism
Pulmonary embolism.overview:
Description
A condition in which one or more arteries in the lungs become blocked by a blood clot.Most times, a pulmonary embolism is caused by blood clots that travel from the legs or, rarely, other parts of the body (deep vein thrombosis).Symptoms include shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough.Prompt treatment to break up the clot greatly reduces the risk of death. This can be done with blood thinners and drugs or procedures. Compression stockings and physical activity can help prevent clots from forming in the first place.
Pulmonary embolism.subtitle: Common
Pulmonary embolism.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of blood thinners
treatment.content: Prompt treatment to break up the clot greatly reduces the risk of death. This can be done with blood thinners and drugs or procedures. Compression stockings and physical activity can help prevent clots from forming in the first place.

Heart: fast heart rate or palpitations
Respiratory: fast breathing or shortness of breath
Also common: dry cough

Raynaud's phenomenon.name: Raynaud's phenomenon
Raynaud's phenomenon.overview:
Description
A condition in which some areas of the body feel numb and cool in certain circumstances.In Raynaud's phenomenon, smaller arteries that supply blood to the skin constrict excessively in response to cold, limiting blood supply to the affected area.The fingers, toes, ears, and tip of the nose are commonly involved and feel numb and cool in response to cold temperatures or stress. It's often accompanied by changes in the color of the skin.Treatment beyond self-care, such as dressing warmer, usually isn't needed.
Raynaud's phenomenon.subtitle: Common
Raynaud's phenomenon.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.content: Treatment beyond self-care, such as dressing warmer, usually isn't needed.
