Reactive arthritis.name: Reactive arthritis
Reactive arthritis.overview:
Description
Joint pain and swelling triggered by an infection in another part of the body.The infection usually occurs days to weeks before the onset of joint pain. In some cases a preceding infection may only be identified with laboratory testing.Symptoms include joint pain and stiffness, most commonly in the knees, ankles, and feet. In a type of reactive arthritis called Reiter's syndrome, there may be discomfort during urination as well as eye inflammation.If needed, treatment includes anti-inflammatory medication or steroids.
Reactive arthritis.subtitle: Very rare
Reactive arthritis.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

Repetitive strain injury.name: Repetitive strain injury
Repetitive strain injury.overview:
Description
A term used to describe damage and pain caused by repetitive movement and overuse.Repetitive strain injury impacts muscles, nerves, ligaments, and tendons. These types of injuries can be caused by improper technique or overuse. The elderly are most commonly affected.Symptoms include tenderness, stiffness, or tingling in the affected area.Treatment may include anti-inflammatory drugs, physical therapy, ergonomic evaluation, and rarely surgery.
Repetitive strain injury.subtitle: Very common
Repetitive strain injury.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

Restless legs syndrome.name: Restless legs syndrome
Restless legs syndrome.overview:
Description
A condition characterized by a nearly irresistible urge to move the legs, typically in the evenings.Restless legs syndrome typically occurs while sitting or lying down. It generally worsens with age and can disrupt sleep.The main symptom is a nearly irresistible urge to move the legs.Getting up and moving around helps the unpleasant feeling temporarily go away. Self-care steps, lifestyle changes, or medications may help.
Restless legs syndrome.subtitle: Very common
Restless legs syndrome.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured

Retinoblastoma.name: Retinoblastoma
Retinoblastoma.overview:
Description
An eye cancer that begins in the back of the eye (retina), most commonly in children.Retinoblastoma may occur in one or both eyes.Retinoblastoma has few, if any, symptoms at first. It may be noticed if a pupil appears white when light is shined into the eye, sometimes with flash photography. Eyes may appear to be looking in different directions.Treatments include chemotherapy, radiation, and laser therapy.
Retinoblastoma.subtitle: Very rare
Retinoblastoma.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year

Rheumatic fever.name: Rheumatic fever
Rheumatic fever.overview:
Description
A disease that can result from inadequately treated strep throat or scarlet fever.Rheumatic fever causes inflammation, especially of the heart, blood vessels, and joints.Symptoms include fever and painful, tender joints.Treatment involves medication, sometimes for life.
Rheumatic fever.subtitle: Very rare
Rheumatic fever.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year

Rheumatoid arthritis.name: Rheumatoid arthritis
Rheumatoid arthritis.overview:
Description
A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.In rheumatoid arthritis, the body's immune system attacks its own tissue, including joints. In severe cases, it attacks internal organs.Rheumatoid arthritis affects joint linings, causing painful swelling. Over long periods of time, the inflammation associated with rheumatoid arthritis can cause bone erosion and joint deformity.While there's no cure for rheumatoid arthritis, physiotherapy and medication can help slow the disease's progression. Most cases can be managed with a class of medications called anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARDS)

Rheumatoid arthritis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year

Rocky mountain spotted fever.name: Rocky mountain spotted fever
Rocky mountain spotted fever.overview:
Description
An infectious disease with a characteristic rash, often transmitted by the bite of a tick.Rocky Mountain spotted fever is a potentially fatal disease that's usually caused by the bite of a tick infected with rickettsia group bacteria.Symptoms include fever, headache, and muscle aches. A rash may be present, frequently with blackened or crusted skin at the site of a tick bite.Spotted fever responds well to prompt treatment with antibiotics.
Rocky mountain spotted fever.subtitle: Very rare
Rocky mountain spotted fever.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year

Rosacea.name: Rosacea
Rosacea.overview:
Description
A condition that causes redness and often small, red, pus-filled bumps on the face.Rosacea most commonly affects middle-aged women with fair skin. It can be mistaken for acne or other skin conditions.Key symptoms are facial redness with swollen red bumps and small visible blood vessels.Treatments such as antibiotics or anti-acne medications can control and reduce symptoms. Left untreated, it tends to worsen over time.
Rosacea.subtitle: Very common
Rosacea.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year

Rubella.name: Rubella
Rubella.overview:
Description
A contagious viral infection preventable by vaccine and best known by its distinctive red rash.The disease can spread through direct contact with the saliva or mucus of an infected person, or through the air by respiratory droplets produced from coughing or sneezing.Symptoms often appear two to three weeks after exposure, and also include mild fever and headache.Rubella has been declared eliminated in the US. Parents are advised to vaccinate children with the MMR vaccine to prevent its re-emergence.

Salmonellosis.name: Salmonellosis
Salmonellosis.overview:
Description
An infection with salmonella bacteria, commonly caused by contaminated food or water.Salmonella is most common among children. People with compromised immune systems, such as older adults, babies, and people with AIDS, are more likely to have severe cases.Symptoms include diarrhea, fever, chills, and abdominal pain.Most people only need fluids to recover in less than a week. Severe infections may require medical care including IV fluids and sometimes antibiotics.

Salmonellosis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year

symptoms.content: Symptoms include diarrhea, fever, chills, and abdominal pain.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or muscles
Whole body: chills, dehydration, fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Gastrointestinal: diarrhea or blood in stool
Also common: headache

Scabies.name: Scabies
Scabies.overview:
Description
A contagious, intensely itchy skin condition caused by a tiny, burrowing mite.Scabies is contagious and spreads quickly through close physical contact in a family, school, or nursing home.The most common symptom of scabies is intense itching in the area where the mites burrow.Scabies can be treated by killing the mites and their eggs with medication that's applied from the neck down and left on for eight hours. The mites can also be killed using oral medications.
Scabies.subtitle: Common
Scabies.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antiparasitics
treatment.content: Scabies can be treated by killing the mites and their eggs with medication that's applied from the neck down and left on for eight hours. The mites can also be killed using oral medications.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Hot water laundry and Dry cleaning

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The most common symptom of scabies is intense itching in the area where the mites burrow.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: bumps or redness
Also common: itching or skin burrow

Scarlet fever.name: Scarlet fever
Scarlet fever.overview:
Description
A bacterial illness that develops in some people who have strep throat.Scarlet fever is most common in children five to 15 years of age.Symptoms include a bright red rash that covers most of the body, a sore throat, and a high fever.Scarlet fever is treated with antibiotics.
Scarlet fever.subtitle: Very rare
Scarlet fever.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of penicillins
treatment.content: Scarlet fever is treated with antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a bright red rash that covers most of the body, a sore throat, and a high fever.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Skin: red rashes, peeling, roughness, red spots, or red lines in skin folds
Whole body: fever or malaise
Also common: sore throat, enlarged neck lymph nodes, nausea, swollen and bumpy tongue that's red, or swollen tonsils

Schizophrenia.name: Schizophrenia
Schizophrenia.overview:
Description
A disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel, and behave clearly.The exact cause of schizophrenia isn't known, but a combination of genetics, environment, and altered brain chemistry and structure may play a role.Schizophrenia is characterized by thoughts or experiences that seem out of touch with reality, disorganized speech or behavior, and decreased participation in daily activities. Difficulty with concentration and memory may also be present.Treatment is usually lifelong and often involves a combination of medications, psychotherapy, and coordinated specialty care services.
Schizophrenia.subtitle: Common
Schizophrenia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of medications and therapy
treatment.content: Treatment is usually lifelong and often involves a combination of medications, psychotherapy, and coordinated specialty care services.

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Support group, Rehabilitation, Cognitive therapy, Psychoeducation, Family therapy, Behavior therapy, and Group psychotherapy

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Schizophrenia is characterized by thoughts or experiences that seem out of touch with reality, disorganized speech or behavior, and decreased participation in daily activities. Difficulty with concentration and memory may also be present.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Behavioral: social isolation, disorganized behavior, aggression, agitation, compulsive behavior, excitability, hostility, repetitive movements, self-harm, or lack of restraint

Cognitive: thought disorder, delusion, amnesia, belief that an ordinary event has special and personal meaning, belief that thoughts aren't one's own, disorientation, mental confusion, slowness in activity, or false belief of superiority
Mood: anger, anxiety, apathy, feeling detached from self, general discontent, loss of interest or pleasure in activities, elevated mood, or inappropriate emotional response
Psychological: hallucination, paranoia, hearing voices, depression, fear, persecutory delusion, or religious delusion
Speech: circumstantial speech, incoherent speech, rapid and frenzied speaking, or speech disorder
Also common: fatigue, impaired motor coordination, lack of emotional response, or memory loss

Sciatica.name: Sciatica
Sciatica.overview:
Description
Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, which runs down one or both legs from the lower back.It's usually caused when a herniated disk or bone spur in the spine presses on the nerve.Pain originates in the spine and radiates down the back of the leg. Sciatica typically affects only one side of the body.Medication for pain and physical therapy are common treatments.
Sciatica.subtitle: Very common
Sciatica.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Medication for pain and physical therapy are common treatments.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Ice packs and Monitoring for changes or improvement

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Muscle relaxant, Steroid, and Nerve pain medication

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Chiropractic treatment techniques, Stretching, Massage, and Acupuncture

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Pain originates in the spine and radiates down the back of the leg. Sciatica typically affects only one side of the body.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, buttocks, hip, or lower extremities
Pain types: can be mild, severe, radiating, or sharp
Pain circumstances: can occur due to injury or while sitting
Muscular: difficulty walking or muscle weakness
Sensory: leg numbness or pins and needles
Also common: burning sensation, foot numbness, or weakness

Scleroderma.name: Scleroderma
Scleroderma.overview:
Description
Chronic hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues.Scleroderma is a group of rare diseases that more often affects women. It commonly occurs between the ages of 30 and 50.Symptoms include tightening of the skin, joint pain, exaggerated response to cold (Raynaud's disease), and heartburn.Treatments include medication, physical therapy, and surgery.
Scleroderma.subtitle: Rare
Scleroderma.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments include medication, physical therapy, and surgery.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Immunosuppressive drug, Calcium channel blocker, Steroid, and Proton-pump inhibitor

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include tightening of the skin, joint pain, exaggerated response to cold (Raynaud's disease), and heartburn.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints
Skin: rashes, swollen blood vessels in the skin, or ulcers

Also common: acid reflux, chronic cough, difficulty swallowing, dry mouth, fatigue, headache, joint stiffness, raynaud's syndrome, sensitivity to cold, shortness of breath, tight and hardened fingers, or weight loss

Scoliosis.name: Scoliosis
Scoliosis.overview:
Description
A sideways curvature of the spine.Scoliosis occurs most often during the growth spurt just before puberty.Most cases are mild with few symptoms. Some children develop spine deformities that get more severe as they grow. Severe scoliosis can be painful and disabling.Often, no treatment is necessary. Sometimes a brace or surgery is needed.
Scoliosis.subtitle: Very common
Scoliosis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Often, no treatment is necessary. Sometimes a brace or surgery is needed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Most cases are mild with few symptoms. Some children develop spine deformities that get more severe as they grow. Severe scoliosis can be painful and disabling.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back
Also common: leaning to one side, muscle spasms, physical deformity, or uneven waist

Scurvy.name: Scurvy
Scurvy.overview:
Description
A condition caused by a severe lack of vitamin C in the diet.People who don't include enough fruits and vegetables in their diet are at risk.Symptoms may not occur for a few months after a person's dietary intake of vitamin C drops too low. Bruising, bleeding gums, weakness, fatigue, and rash are among scurvy symptoms.Treatment involves taking vitamin C supplements and eating citrus fruits, potatoes, broccoli, and strawberries.
Scurvy.subtitle: Very rare
Scurvy.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supplements
treatment.content: Treatment involves taking vitamin C supplements and eating citrus fruits, potatoes, broccoli, and strawberries.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Diet rich in fruits and vegetables

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms may not occur for a few months after a person's dietary intake of vitamin C drops too low. Bruising, bleeding gums, weakness, fatigue, and rash are among scurvy symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles
Whole body: fatigue, fever, loss of appetite, or malaise
Mouth: bleeding gums or tooth loss
Skin: rashes or red spots
Also common: bruising, coiled hair, failure to thrive, irritability, muscle weakness, swollen gums, or weight loss

Septic shock.name: Septic shock
Septic shock.overview:
Description
A widespread infection causing organ failure and dangerously low blood pressure.Septic shock is a life-threatening condition caused by a severe localized or system-wide infection that requires immediate medical attention.Symptoms include low blood pressure, pale and cool arms and legs, chills, difficulty breathing, and decreased urine output. Mental confusion and disorientation may also develop quickly.Emergency treatment may include supplemental oxygen, intravenous fluids, antibiotics, and other medications.
Septic shock.subtitle: Rare
Septic shock.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and blood pressure support
treatment.content: Emergency treatment may include supplemental oxygen, intravenous fluids, antibiotics, and other medications.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Vasoconstrictor, Penicillin, Antibiotics, and Blood pressure support

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include low blood pressure, pale and cool arms and legs, chills, difficulty breathing, and decreased urine output. Mental confusion and disorientation may also develop quickly.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: low blood pressure, chills, fatigue, fever, or low body temperature
Respiratory: fast breathing or shortness of breath
Also common: fast heart rate, insufficient urine production, or mental confusion

Septicemia.name: Septicemia
Septicemia.overview:
Description
A life-threatening complication of an infection.Sepsis occurs when chemicals released in the bloodstream to fight an infection trigger inflammation throughout the body. This can cause a cascade of changes that damage multiple organ systems, leading them to fail, sometimes even resulting in death.Symptoms include fever, difficulty breathing, low blood pressure, fast heart rate, and mental confusion.Treatment includes antibiotics and intravenous fluids.
Septicemia.subtitle: Common
Septicemia.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and fluids
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics and intravenous fluids.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Mechanical ventilation, Hospitalization, Fluid replacement, and IV fluids

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Vasoconstrictor, Antibiotics, Blood pressure support, and Steroid

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fever, difficulty breathing, low blood pressure, fast heart rate, and mental confusion.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: low blood pressure, chills, dizziness, fatigue, fever, flushing, low body temperature, or shivering
Cognitive: altered level of consciousness or mental confusion
Respiratory: fast breathing or shortness of breath
Also common: delirium, fast heart rate, insufficient urine production, organ dysfunction, skin discoloration, or sleepiness

Shin splints.name: Shin splints
Shin splints.overview:
Description
Pain caused by overuse along the shinbone, the large front bone in the lower leg.Shin splints result when muscles, tendons, and bone tissue become overworked. Shin splints often occur in athletes who've recently intensified or changed their training routines.The main symptom is pain in the leg.Treatment includes rest, ice, and pain relievers.
Shin splints.subtitle: Very common
Shin splints.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Treatment includes rest, ice, and pain relievers.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: RICE (Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation) and Strength training

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is pain in the leg.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the leg
Also common: lower leg pain after exercise

Shingles.name: Shingles
Shingles.overview:
Description
A reactivation of the chickenpox virus in the body, causing a painful rash.Anyone who's had chickenpox may develop shingles. It isn't known what reactivates the virus.Shingles causes a painful rash that may appear as a stripe of blisters on the trunk of the body. Pain can persist even after the rash is gone (this is called postherpetic neuralgia).Treatments include pain relief and antiviral medications such as acyclovir or valacyclovir. A chickenpox vaccine in childhood or a shingles vaccine as an adult can minimize the risk of developing shingles.
Shingles.subtitle: Common
Shingles.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antivirals and nerve pain medications
treatment.content: Treatments include pain relief and antiviral medications such as acyclovir or valacyclovir. A chickenpox vaccine in childhood or a shingles vaccine as an adult can minimize the risk of developing shingles.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antiviral drug, Local anesthetic, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, and Nerve pain medication

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Shingles causes a painful rash that may appear as a stripe of blisters on the trunk of the body. Pain can persist even after the rash is gone (this is called postherpetic neuralgia).
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the skin
Skin: blister, scab, ulcers, or redness
Sensory: oversensitivity or pins and needles
Also common: painful red blister rash in linear distribution, burning sensation, fatigue, or itching

Sickle cell disease.name: Sickle cell disease
Sickle cell disease.overview:
Description
A group of disorders that cause red blood cells to become misshapen and break down.With sickle cell disease, an inherited group of disorders, red blood cells contort into a sickle shape. The cells die early, leaving a shortage of healthy red blood cells (sickle cell anemia), and can block blood flow causing pain (sickle cell crisis).Infections, pain, and fatigue are symptoms of sickle cell disease.Treatments include medications, blood transfusions, and rarely a bone-marrow transplant.
Sickle cell disease.subtitle: Rare
Sickle cell disease.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatments include medications, blood transfusions, and rarely a bone-marrow transplant.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Narcotic, Chemotherapy, Vitamin, and Blood transfusion

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Infections, pain, and fatigue are symptoms of sickle cell disease.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints
Pain types: can be sudden in the chest
Whole body: dizziness, fatigue, low oxygen in the body, or malaise
Urinary: inability to make concentrated or dilute urine or blood in urine
Also common: abnormal breakdown of red blood cells, delayed development, inflamed fingers or toes, pallor, shortness of breath, or yellow skin and eyes

Sickle-cell anemia.name: Sickle-cell anemia
Sickle-cell anemia.overview:
Description
A group of disorders that cause red blood cells to become misshapen and break down.With sickle cell disease, an inherited group of disorders, red blood cells contort into a sickle shape. The cells die early, leaving a shortage of healthy red blood cells (sickle cell anemia), and can block blood flow causing pain (sickle cell crisis).Infections, pain, and fatigue are symptoms of sickle cell disease.Treatments include medications, blood transfusions, and rarely a bone-marrow transplant.
Sickle-cell anemia.subtitle: Rare
Sickle-cell anemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

Pain types: can be sudden in the chest

Urinary: inability to make concentrated or dilute urine or blood in urine
Also common: abnormal breakdown of red blood cells, delayed development, inflamed fingers or toes, pallor, shortness of breath, or yellow skin and eyes

Sinusitis.name: Sinusitis
Sinusitis.overview:
Description
A condition in which the cavities around the nasal passages become inflamed.Acute sinusitis can be triggered by a cold or allergies and may resolve on its own. Chronic sinusitis lasts up to eight weeks and may be caused by an infection or growths.Symptoms include headache, facial pain, runny nose, and nasal congestion.Acute sinusitis usually doesn't require any treatment beyond symptomatic relief with pain medications, nasal decongestants, and nasal saline rinses. Chronic sinusitis may require antibiotics.
Sinusitis.subtitle: Very common
Sinusitis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Acute sinusitis usually doesn't require any treatment beyond symptomatic relief with pain medications, nasal decongestants, and nasal saline rinses. Chronic sinusitis may require antibiotics.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Decongestant, Penicillin, Antibiotics, Steroid, Cough medicine, Antihistamine, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Analgesic

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include headache, facial pain, runny nose, and nasal congestion.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the face, sinuses, back of the eyes, ear, or forehead
Nasal: congestion, distorted sense of smell, itching, loss of smell, or runny nose
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or malaise
Facial: tenderness or swelling
Also common: sinus pressure, headache, inflammation of ear, mouth breathing, phlegm, pus, sleeping difficulty, or throat irritation

Sjogren's syndrome.name: Sjogren's syndrome
Sjogren's syndrome.overview:
Description
An immune system disorder characterized by dry eyes and dry mouth.With this disorder, the body's immune system attacks its own healthy cells that produce saliva and tears. Sjögren's often occurs with other such disorders, such as rheumatoid arthritis and lupus.The main symptoms are dry mouth and dry eyes.Treatments include eye drops, medications, and eye surgery.
Sjogren's syndrome.subtitle: Common
Sjogren's syndrome.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of immunosuppressants
treatment.content: Treatments include eye drops, medications, and eye surgery.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Steroid, Saliva production stimulator, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Immunosuppressive drug

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The main symptoms are dry mouth and dry eyes.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the joints or muscles
Sensory: abnormality of taste, loss of taste, or pins and needles
Mouth: dental cavities, dryness, or ulcers
Speech: hoarseness or impaired voice
Throat: difficulty swallowing or dryness
Also common: dry cough, dry eyes, dry skin, fatigue, joint stiffness, stiffness, swollen lymph nodes, or vaginal dryness

Skin cancer (melanoma).name: Skin cancer (melanoma)
Skin cancer (melanoma).overview:
Description
The most serious type of skin cancer.Melanoma occurs when the pigment-producing cells that give color to the skin become cancerous.Symptoms might include a new, unusual growth or a change in an existing mole. Melanomas can occur anywhere on the body.Treatment may involve surgery, radiation, medications, or in some cases chemotherapy.
Skin cancer (melanoma).subtitle: Common
Skin cancer (melanoma).smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment may involve surgery, radiation, medications, or in some cases chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Skin grafting and Wide local excision

symptoms.content: Symptoms might include a new, unusual growth or a change in an existing mole. Melanomas can occur anywhere on the body.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: bigger mole diameter, darkening of the skin, mole color changes, or skin mole with irregular border

Slapped cheek syndrome.name: Slapped cheek syndrome
Slapped cheek syndrome.overview:
Description
A common and highly contagious childhood ailment causing a distinctive face rash.The rash appears after several days and may spread.The facial rash looks as if the cheeks were slapped. Sore throat, slight fever, upset stomach, headache, fatigue, and itching are among other symptoms.The virus usually clears up on its own, but pain relievers may help with symptoms.
Slapped cheek syndrome.subtitle: Common
Slapped cheek syndrome.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: The virus usually clears up on its own, but pain relievers may help with symptoms.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The facial rash looks as if the cheeks were slapped. Sore throat, slight fever, upset stomach, headache, fatigue, and itching are among other symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fever or fatigue
Also common: rash on the face, coughing, headache, itching, nausea, runny nose, or sore throat

Stevens-johnson syndrome.name: Stevens-johnson syndrome
Stevens-johnson syndrome.overview:
Description
A rare, serious disorder of the skin and mucous membranes.A medical emergency, this is often a reaction to medication or an infection.Flu-like symptoms appear first. A painful rash that spreads and blisters follows.Emergency treatment aims to eliminate the underlying cause and control symptoms and complications.
Stevens-johnson syndrome.subtitle: Very rare
Stevens-johnson syndrome.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of supportive care
treatment.content: Emergency treatment aims to eliminate the underlying cause and control symptoms and complications.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: IV fluids, Fluid replacement, and Wound dressing

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Ensuring adequate nutrition and Artificial tears

symptoms.content: Flu-like symptoms appear first. A painful rash that spreads and blisters follows.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: rashes, blister, peeling, rash of small purplish spots, red spots, or small bump
Whole body: fever or malaise
Also common: coughing, eye redness, itching, mouth ulcer, sensitivity to light, sore throat, or swelling

Stomach cancer.name: Stomach cancer
Stomach cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer that occurs in the stomach.Risk factors may include smoking and a diet of highly processed or salty foods.There may be no symptoms of stomach cancer early on. Later, symptoms include feeling bloated after eating, feeling full after eating small amounts of food, nausea, heartburn, or indigestion.Treatment options include surgery, medications, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Stomach cancer.subtitle: Rare
Stomach cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment options include surgery, medications, radiation, and chemotherapy.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: There may be no symptoms of stomach cancer early on. Later, symptoms include feeling bloated after eating, feeling full after eating small amounts of food, nausea, heartburn, or indigestion.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Gastrointestinal: dark stool from digested blood, indigestion, nausea, or vomiting blood
Whole body: cancer-related fatigue or loss of appetite
Also common: abdominal fullness, difficulty swallowing, or weight loss

Stomach flu.name: Stomach flu
Stomach flu.overview:
Description
An intestinal infection marked by diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and fever.Stomach flu is typically spread by contact with an infected person or through contaminated food or water.Diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and low-grade fever are common symptoms.Avoiding contaminated food and water and washing hands often can help prevent infection. Rest and rehydration are the mainstays of treatment.
Stomach flu.subtitle: Very common
Stomach flu.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids
treatment.content: Avoiding contaminated food and water and washing hands often can help prevent infection. Rest and rehydration are the mainstays of treatment.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Can be self-healing, Fluid replacement, Oral rehydration therapy, and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable

Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, stomach cramps, belching, gagging, indigestion, nausea, vomiting, or flatulence
Whole body: chills, dehydration, fatigue, fever, lethargy, lightheadedness, or loss of appetite
Also common: fast heart rate, headache, insufficient urine production, weakness, or weight loss

Stomach ulcer.name: Stomach ulcer
Stomach ulcer.overview:
Description
A sore that develops on the lining of the esophagus, stomach, or small intestine.Ulcers occur when stomach acid damages the lining of the digestive tract.
Stomach ulcer.subtitle: Common
Stomach ulcer.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

Strabismus.name: Strabismus
Strabismus.overview:
Description
Disorder in which the eyes don't look in exactly the same direction at the same time.Causes of strabismus can include nerve injury or dysfunction of the muscles controlling the eye.The main symptom is eyes that don't look in exactly the same direction at the same time.Crossed eyes can usually be corrected with early treatment. Several treatment options exist to align the eyes. They include special eyewear, use of an eye patch, and rarely surgery.
Strabismus.subtitle: Very common
Strabismus.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of devices
treatment.content: Crossed eyes can usually be corrected with early treatment. Several treatment options exist to align the eyes. They include special eyewear, use of an eye patch, and rarely surgery.

additional.subtitle: Devices
additional.text: Bifocals, Eyepatch, Glasses, and Contact lenses

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The main symptom is eyes that don't look in exactly the same direction at the same time.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Visual: blurred vision or double vision
Also common: eye strain or headache

Strep throat.name: Strep throat
Strep throat.overview:
Description
A bacterial infection that may cause a sore, scratchy throat.The infection is generally transmitted by direct contact with the mucus or sores of someone else with strep.Common symptoms include sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes in the neck.  Rarely, complications can involve the heart or kidneys.Treatment is important to reduce complications.  Oral antibiotics like penicillin, amoxicillin, cephalexin, or azithromycin are commonly used. Other medicines such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen can help with pain and fever.
Strep throat.subtitle: Very common
Strep throat.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of penicillins
treatment.content: Treatment is important to reduce complications.  Oral antibiotics like penicillin, amoxicillin, cephalexin, or azithromycin are commonly used. Other medicines such as acetaminophen or ibuprofen can help with pain and fever.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Penicillin, Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, and Analgesic

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Common symptoms include sore throat, fever, and swollen lymph nodes in the neck.  Rarely, complications can involve the heart or kidneys.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Whole body: fever, chills, or malaise
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: sore throat, enlarged neck lymph nodes, swollen tonsils, tender lymph nodes, tonsillar exudate, bad breath, or headache

Stroke.name: Stroke
Stroke.overview:
Description
Damage to the brain from interruption of its blood supply.A stroke is a medical emergency.Symptoms of stroke include trouble walking, speaking, and understanding, as well as paralysis or numbness of the face, arm, or leg.Early treatment with medications like tPA (clot buster) can minimize brain damage. Other treatments focus on limiting complications and preventing additional strokes.
Stroke.subtitle: Common
Stroke.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured

treatment.title: Treatment consists of blood thinners
treatment.content: Early treatment with medications like tPA (clot buster) can minimize brain damage. Other treatments focus on limiting complications and preventing additional strokes.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Alteplase, Anticoagulant, Statin, Antihypertensive drug, and ACE inhibitor

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Speech therapy, Rehabilitation, Occupational therapy, Physical therapy, and Stroke rehabiliation

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms of stroke include trouble walking, speaking, and understanding, as well as paralysis or numbness of the face, arm, or leg.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Muscular: difficulty walking, instability, paralysis with weak muscles, problems with coordination, stiff muscles, overactive reflexes, or paralysis of one side of the body
Visual: blurred vision, double vision, sudden visual loss, or temporary loss of vision in one eye
Speech: difficulty speaking, slurred speech, or speech loss
Whole body: fatigue, lightheadedness, or vertigo
Limbs: numbness or weakness
Sensory: pins and needles or reduced sensation of touch
Facial: muscle weakness or numbness
Also common: difficulty swallowing, headache, inability to understand, mental confusion, or rapid involuntary eye movement

Sunburn.name: Sunburn
Sunburn.overview:
Description
A type of skin burn resulting from too much exposure to sunlight or sunlamps.Repeated exposure increases the risk of other conditions such as wrinkles, dark spots, and skin cancer.Symptoms include red, painful, itchy skin that's hot to the touch. Skin may also blister.Treatment includes pain relievers and creams to relieve itching.
Sunburn.subtitle: Very common
Sunburn.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of soothing remedies
treatment.content: Treatment includes pain relievers and creams to relieve itching.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, and Local anesthetic

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Ice packs, Aloe, Sunblock, Moisturizer, and Sun protective clothing

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include red, painful, itchy skin that's hot to the touch. Skin may also blister.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: flakiness, peeling, rashes, roughness, warmness, red spots, or redness
Also common: blistering, itching, or swelling

Syphilis.name: Syphilis
Syphilis.overview:
Description
A bacterial infection usually spread by sexual contact that starts as a painless sore.Syphilis develops in stages, and symptoms vary with each stage.The first stage involves a painless sore on the genitals, rectum, or mouth. After the initial sore heals, the second stage is characterized by a rash. Then, there are no symptoms until the final stage which may occur years later. This final stage can result in damage to the brain, nerves, eyes, or heart.Syphilis is treated with penicillin. Sexual partners should also be treated.
Syphilis.subtitle: Rare
Syphilis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of penicillins
treatment.content: Syphilis is treated with penicillin. Sexual partners should also be treated.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: The first stage involves a painless sore on the genitals, rectum, or mouth. After the initial sore heals, the second stage is characterized by a rash. Then, there are no symptoms until the final stage which may occur years later. This final stage can result in damage to the brain, nerves, eyes, or heart.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Groin: painless ulcers, sores, vaginal discharge, or wart-like growths on genitals
Skin: rashes, small bump, or ulcers
Also common: fatigue, itching, mouth ulcer, rash on the palms and soles, sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, weight loss, or rectal lining inflammation

Taeniasis.name: Taeniasis
Taeniasis.overview:
Description
A tapeworm infection that affects the digestive system.Taeniasis is caused by eating undercooked beef or pork that contains tapeworm eggs.Most cases of the infection do not cause symptoms. In severe or chronic cases, symptoms may include belly pain, lost appetite, weight loss, and upset stomach. Tapeworm segments may be visible as they pass through the anus and in the feces.Medications are used to treat taeniasis. Adequate sanitation and cooking meat to safe temperatures can help prevent it.
Taeniasis.subtitle: Very rare
Taeniasis.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Spreads through contaminated food or water
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antiparasitics
treatment.content: Medications are used to treat taeniasis. Adequate sanitation and cooking meat to safe temperatures can help prevent it.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Most cases of the infection do not cause symptoms. In severe or chronic cases, symptoms may include belly pain, lost appetite, weight loss, and upset stomach. Tapeworm segments may be visible as they pass through the anus and in the feces.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Gastrointestinal: nausea or passing worms in stool
Also common: weight loss

Tennis elbow.name: Tennis elbow
Tennis elbow.overview:
Description
An irritation of the tissue connecting the forearm muscle to the elbow.Tennis elbow can be caused by repetitive wrist and arm motions.Pain is the primary symptom. It usually occurs on the outside of the elbow and sometimes in the forearm and wrist.Treatment includes rest, pain relievers, and physical therapy.
Tennis elbow.subtitle: Common
Tennis elbow.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of anti-inflammatories and self care
treatment.content: Treatment includes rest, pain relievers, and physical therapy.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: RICE (Rest, Ice, Compression, Elevation), Cold compress, and Physical exercise

additional.subtitle: Therapies
additional.text: Stretching, Physical therapy, Massage, and Acupuncture

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Pain is the primary symptom. It usually occurs on the outside of the elbow and sometimes in the forearm and wrist.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the elbow or muscles
Also common: swelling or tenderness

Testicular cancer.name: Testicular cancer
Testicular cancer.overview:
Description
Cancer in the male organs that make male hormones and sperm (testicles).The testicles are located inside a loose bag of skin (scrotum) underneath the penis.Symptoms include a lump in either testicle and a feeling of heaviness in the scrotum.Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.
Testicular cancer.subtitle: Very rare
Testicular cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments include surgery, radiation, and chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Inguinal orchiectomy and Retroperitoneal lymph node dissection

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include a lump in either testicle and a feeling of heaviness in the scrotum.
symptoms.subtitle: Can have no symptoms, but people may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the lower back
Whole body: cancer-related fatigue or fatigue
Also common: painless testicular lump, swelling of scrotum, swollen lymph nodes, or weight loss

Tetanus.name: Tetanus
Tetanus.overview:
Description
A serious bacterial infection that causes painful muscle spasms and can lead to death.Tetanus is a potentially fatal bacterial infection that affects the nerves. A vaccine can easily prevent the infection, which has no cure.Tetanus causes painful muscle contractions, particularly in the jaw and neck. It can interfere with the ability to breathe, eventually causing death.Treatment focuses on managing complications.
Tetanus.subtitle: Extremely rare
Tetanus.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Spreads by contact with a contaminated object or surface
Lab tests or imaging not required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and supportive care
treatment.content: Treatment focuses on managing complications.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antibiotics, Penicillin, Sedative, and Dietary supplement

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Tracheotomy and Removal of unhealthy tissue

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Tetanus causes painful muscle contractions, particularly in the jaw and neck. It can interfere with the ability to breathe, eventually causing death.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fever, high blood pressure, nervous system dysfunction, or sweating
Muscular: muscle spasms, facial muscle spasms, or stiff muscles
Respiratory: episodes of no breathing or shortness of breath
Also common: lockjaw, difficulty swallowing, drooling, fast heart rate, irritability, spasm with arched back and neck, or stiff neck

Thalassaemia.name: Thalassaemia
Thalassaemia.overview:
Description
A blood disorder involving less than normal amounts of an oxygen-carrying protein.Thalassemia is an inherited blood disorder characterized by less oxygen-carrying protein (hemoglobin) and fewer red blood cells in the body than normal.Symptoms include fatigue, weakness, paleness, and slow growth.Mild forms may not need treatment. Severe forms may require blood transfusions or a donor stem-cell transplant.
Thalassaemia.subtitle: Rare
Thalassaemia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of vitamins and transfusions
treatment.content: Mild forms may not need treatment. Severe forms may require blood transfusions or a donor stem-cell transplant.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Vitamin, Blood transfusion, and Iron reducer

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include fatigue, weakness, paleness, and slow growth.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: anemia, fatigue, or weakness
Also common: failure to thrive, iron overload, pallor, shortness of breath, or yellow skin and eyes

Thrush.name: Thrush
Thrush.overview:
Description
An infection in which the fungus Candida albicans accumulates in the mouth.It's common in babies, people with immune deficiency, and those who use steroid sprays for asthma.Oral thrush causes white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks.Unsweetened yogurt or an antifungal medication can help.
Thrush.subtitle: Common
Thrush.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antifungals
treatment.content: Unsweetened yogurt or an antifungal medication can help.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Antifungal, Topical antiseptic, and Dietary supplement

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Oral thrush causes white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain circumstances: can occur while swallowing
Mouth: bad breath, dryness, or white tongue
Also common: abnormality of taste, difficulty swallowing, or redness

Thyroid cancer.name: Thyroid cancer
Thyroid cancer.overview:
Description
A cancer of the thyroid, the butterfly-shaped gland at the base of the neck.The cause of thyroid cancer is poorly understood, but may involve a combination of genetic and environmental factors.Some people have no symptoms. Others may notice a lump in the neck.Treatments, which are usually successful, include surgery, hormone therapy, radioactive iodine, radiation, and in some cases chemotherapy.
Thyroid cancer.subtitle: Rare
Thyroid cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatments, which are usually successful, include surgery, hormone therapy, radioactive iodine, radiation, and in some cases chemotherapy.

additional.subtitle: Surgery

Neck: enlarged lymph nodes, lump, or swelling
Also common: thyroid nodules

Tonsillitis.name: Tonsillitis
Tonsillitis.overview:
Description
An inflammation of the two oval-shaped pads of tissue at the back of the throat.Tonsillitis is usually caused by a viral infection but can be from a bacterial infection.Symptoms include sore throat, difficulty swallowing, and tender lymph nodes.Treatment can range from home-care remedies to surgical removal.
Tonsillitis.subtitle: Common
Tonsillitis.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

additional.text: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Analgesic, Penicillin, and Antibiotics

Also common: enlarged neck lymph nodes, sore throat, swollen tonsils, bad breath, excess salivation, mouth breathing, poor appetite, pus, snoring, or tender lymph nodes

Toxic shock syndrome.name: Toxic shock syndrome
Toxic shock syndrome.overview:
Description
A rare, life-threatening complication of certain bacterial infections.Risk factors include recent surgery, open wounds, and the use of superabsorbent tampons.A high fever, low blood pressure, vomiting, and rash are some symptoms.Treatment includes antibiotics and possibly surgery.
Toxic shock syndrome.subtitle: Very rare
Toxic shock syndrome.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics and possibly surgery.

Gastrointestinal: diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting
Skin: peeling or rashes
Also common: organ dysfunction, fast breathing, headache, insufficient urine production, mental confusion, or sore throat

Transient ischaemic attack (tia).name: Transient ischaemic attack (tia)
Transient ischaemic attack (tia).overview:
Description
A brief stroke-like attack that, despite resolving within minutes to hours, still requires immediate medical attention to distinguish from an actual stroke.A transient ischemic attack may be a warning sign of a future stroke.Symptoms include weakness on one side of the body, vision problems, and slurred speech. These are transient and often resolve within 24 hours.Treatment includes medication, surgery, and healthy lifestyle changes.
Transient ischaemic attack (tia).subtitle: Common
Transient ischaemic attack (tia).smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of blood thinners
treatment.content: Treatment includes medication, surgery, and healthy lifestyle changes.

symptoms.content: Symptoms include weakness on one side of the body, vision problems, and slurred speech. These are transient and often resolve within 24 hours.

Whole body: feeling faint, lightheadedness, or vertigo
Speech: slurred speech or impaired voice
Visual: blurred vision or vision loss
Facial: muscle weakness or numbness
Also common: difficulty swallowing, mental confusion, or reduced sensation of touch

Trichomoniasis.name: Trichomoniasis
Trichomoniasis.overview:
Description
A sexually transmitted infection caused by a parasite.Trichomoniasis is among the most common sexually transmitted infections. Risk factors include multiple sexual partners and not using condoms during sex.Trichomoniasis causes a foul-smelling vaginal discharge, genital itching, and painful urination in women. Men typically have no symptoms.  Complications include a risk of premature delivery for pregnant women.Treatment involves both partners taking one large dose of a certain oral antibiotic.
Trichomoniasis.subtitle: Very common
Trichomoniasis.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
Lab tests or imaging always required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment involves both partners taking one large dose of a certain oral antibiotic.

symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse or during urination
Groin: cervix inflammation, vaginal discharge, vaginal inflammation, vaginal irritation, vaginal itching, vaginal odor, or vulval inflammation

Trigeminal neuralgia.name: Trigeminal neuralgia
Trigeminal neuralgia.overview:
Description
A chronic pain condition affecting the trigeminal nerve in the face.The trigeminal nerve carries sensation from the face to the brain. It's most common in women over age 50.Symptoms range from mild to severe facial pain, often triggered by chewing, speaking, or brushing the teeth.Treatment includes medications, injections, and surgery.
Trigeminal neuralgia.subtitle: Rare
Trigeminal neuralgia.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year

Sensory: oversensitivity or uncomfortable tingling and burning
Also common: muscle spasms

Tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
Tuberculosis.overview:
Description
A potentially serious infectious bacterial disease that mainly affects the lungs.The bacteria that cause TB are spread when an infected person coughs or sneezes.Most people infected with the bacteria that cause tuberculosis don't have symptoms. When symptoms do occur, they usually include cough (sometimes blood-tinged), weight loss, night sweats, and fever.Treatment isn't always required for those without symptoms.  Patients with active symptoms will require a long course of treatment involving multiple antibiotics.
Tuberculosis.subtitle: Rare
Tuberculosis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required

Type 1 diabetes.name: Type 1 diabetes
Type 1 diabetes.overview:
Description
A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.It typically appears in adolescence.Symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, hunger, fatigue, and blurred vision.Treatment aims at maintaining normal blood sugar levels through regular monitoring, insulin therapy, diet, and exercise.
Type 1 diabetes.subtitle: Rare
Type 1 diabetes.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured

Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

Typhoid fever.name: Typhoid fever
Typhoid fever.overview:
Description
A bacterial disease spread through contaminated food and water or close contact.Vaccines are recommended in areas where typhoid fever is common.Symptoms include high fever, headache, belly pain, and either constipation or diarrhea.Treatment includes antibiotics and fluids.
Typhoid fever.subtitle: Very rare
Typhoid fever.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year

Ulcerative colitis.name: Ulcerative colitis
Ulcerative colitis.overview:
Description
A chronic, inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation in the digestive tract.Ulcerative colitis is usually only in the innermost lining of the large intestine (colon) and rectum. Forms range from mild to severe. Having ulcerative colitis puts a patient at increased risk of developing colon cancer.Symptoms include rectal bleeding, bloody diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and pain.Treatment includes medications and surgery.
Ulcerative colitis.subtitle: Rare
Ulcerative colitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year

Ulcers.name: Ulcers
Ulcers.overview:
Description
A sore that develops on the lining of the esophagus, stomach, or small intestine.Ulcers occur when stomach acid damages the lining of the digestive tract.
Ulcers.subtitle: Common
Ulcers.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

Underactive thyroid.name: Underactive thyroid
Underactive thyroid.overview:
Description
A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.Hypothyroidism's deficiency of thyroid hormones can disrupt such things as heart rate, body temperature, and all aspects of metabolism. Hypothyroidism is most prevalent in older women.Major symptoms include fatigue, cold sensitivity, constipation, dry skin, and unexplained weight gain.Treatment consists of thyroid hormone replacement.
Underactive thyroid.subtitle: Very common
Underactive thyroid.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong
