symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Major symptoms include fatigue, cold sensitivity, constipation, dry skin, and unexplained weight gain.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fatigue, lethargy, or feeling cold
<b>Developmental: delayed puberty or slow growth
Hair: hair loss or dryness

Also common: brittle nails, constipation, dry skin, enlarged thyroid, high cholesterol, irritability, sensitivity to cold, sexual dysfunction, slow heart rate, sluggishness, weight gain, or irregular uterine bleeding

Urinary tract infection (uti).name: Urinary tract infection (uti)
Urinary tract infection (uti).overview:
Description
An infection in any part of the urinary system, the kidneys, bladder, or urethra.Urinary tract infections are more common in women. They usually occur in the bladder or urethra, but more serious infections involve the kidney.A bladder infection may cause pelvic pain, increased urge to urinate, pain with urination, and blood in the urine. A kidney infection may cause back pain, nausea, vomiting, and fever.Common treatment is with antibiotics.
Urinary tract infection (uti).subtitle: Very common
Urinary tract infection (uti).smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Common treatment is with antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: A bladder infection may cause pelvic pain, increased urge to urinate, pain with urination, and blood in the urine. A kidney infection may cause back pain, nausea, vomiting, and fever.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the bladder, groin, lower abdomen, or pelvis
Pain circumstances: can occur during urination or during sexual intercourse
Urinary: foul smelling urine, frequent urination, bladder spasm, cloudy urine, dark urine, persistent urge to urinate, sense of incomplete bladder emptying, or blood in urine
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or malaise
Also common: cramping or vaginal irritation

Urticaria.name: Urticaria
Urticaria.overview:
Description
A skin rash triggered by a reaction to food, medicine, or other irritants.Hives is a common skin rash triggered by many things including certain foods, medications, and stress.Symptoms include itchy, raised, red, or skin-colored welts on the skin's surface.Hives usually go away without treatment, but antihistamine medications are often helpful in improving symptoms.
Urticaria.subtitle: Very common
Urticaria.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antihistamines
treatment.content: Hives usually go away without treatment, but antihistamine medications are often helpful in improving symptoms.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include itchy, raised, red, or skin-colored welts on the skin's surface.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: raised area of skin, swelling, or inflammation in response to touch
Also common: swelling, itching, or flare

Uveitis.name: Uveitis
Uveitis.overview:
Description
An inflammation of the middle layer of the eye (uvea).The most common type is an inflammation of the iris called iritis (anterior uveitis).Symptoms include redness, pain, light sensitivity, blurred vision, and dark floating spots in the field of vision.A common treatment is eye drops that ease the inflammation. If uveitis is a result of an infection, antibiotics or antiviral medication may be prescribed.
Uveitis.subtitle: Rare
Uveitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: A common treatment is eye drops that ease the inflammation. If uveitis is a result of an infection, antibiotics or antiviral medication may be prescribed.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include redness, pain, light sensitivity, blurred vision, and dark floating spots in the field of vision.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the eyes
Visual: blurred vision, seeing spots, sensitivity to light, or vision loss
Also common: eye redness, swelling, or leaked fluid out of blood vessels or an organ

Vaginal thrush.name: Vaginal thrush
Vaginal thrush.overview:
Description
A yeast infection of the vagina and tissues at the opening of the vagina (vulva).This type of yeast infection is caused by the fungus candida.This condition can cause inflammation, intense itchiness, and a thick, white discharge from the vagina.A single dose of an oral antifungal drug or application of an antifungal cream for one to three days cures mild infections. Complicated infections require longer-term treatment.
Vaginal thrush.subtitle: Common
Vaginal thrush.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antifungals
treatment.content: A single dose of an oral antifungal drug or application of an antifungal cream for one to three days cures mild infections. Complicated infections require longer-term treatment.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: This condition can cause inflammation, intense itchiness, and a thick, white discharge from the vagina.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the vagina
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse or during urination
Groin: vaginal discharge, vaginal itching, vaginal inflammation, or vulval inflammation
Also common: redness

Varicella.name: Varicella
Varicella.overview:
Description
A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.Chickenpox is highly contagious to those who haven't had the disease or been vaccinated against it.The most characteristic symptom is an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.Chickenpox can be prevented by a vaccine. Treatment usually involves relieving symptoms although high-risk groups may receive antiviral medications.
Varicella.subtitle: Rare
Varicella.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of pain medications
treatment.content: Chickenpox can be prevented by a vaccine. Treatment usually involves relieving symptoms although high-risk groups may receive antiviral medications.

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: The most characteristic symptom is an itchy, blister-like rash on the skin.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: blister, scab, ulcers, or red spots
Whole body: fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Also common: headache, itching, sore throat, or swollen lymph nodes

Varicose eczema.name: Varicose eczema
Varicose eczema.overview:
Description
Skin inflammation in the lower legs caused by fluid buildup.Stasis dermatitis is caused by fluid buildup due to varicose veins, circulation issues, or heart disease.Skin discoloration of the ankles or shins, itching, thickened skin, and open sores (ulcers) are symptoms.Treatments may include compression stockings and prescription creams as well as treating the underlying condition.
Varicose eczema.subtitle: Common
Varicose eczema.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required

treatment.title: Treatment consists of skin care
treatment.content: Treatments may include compression stockings and prescription creams as well as treating the underlying condition.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Petroleum jelly, Moisturizer, and Barrier cream

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Skin discoloration of the ankles or shins, itching, thickened skin, and open sores (ulcers) are symptoms.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the leg
Skin: rashes, blister, darkening of the skin, discolored and thick skin on legs, dryness, scaly rashes, ulcers, varicose veins, or redness
Also common: itching or swelling

Varicose veins.name: Varicose veins
Varicose veins.overview:
Description
Gnarled, enlarged veins, most commonly appearing in the legs and feet.Varicose veins are generally benign. The cause of this condition is not known.For many people, there are no symptoms and varicose veins are simply a cosmetic concern. In some cases, they cause aching pain and discomfort or signal an underlying circulatory problem.Treatment involves compression stockings, exercise, or procedures to close or remove the veins.
Varicose veins.subtitle: Very common
Varicose veins.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging not required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of self care
treatment.content: Treatment involves compression stockings, exercise, or procedures to close or remove the veins.

additional.subtitle: Medical procedure
additional.text: Laser therapy, Sclerotherapy, Radiofrequency ablation, and Ambulatory phlebectomy

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: For many people, there are no symptoms and varicose veins are simply a cosmetic concern. In some cases, they cause aching pain and discomfort or signal an underlying circulatory problem.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Skin: swollen blood vessels in the skin or discoloration
Also common: bruising, heavy legs, itching, or swollen legs

Vasovagal syncope.name: Vasovagal syncope
Vasovagal syncope.overview:
Description
A sudden drop in heart rate and blood pressure leading to fainting, often in reaction to a stressful trigger.Common triggers include strain, stress, long periods of standing, heat exposure, or the sight of blood.Symptoms include paleness, nausea, sweating, a rapid heartbeat, and fainting.Treatment usually involves trigger avoidance, but may on rare occasions include medications or a pacemaker.
Vasovagal syncope.subtitle: Very common
Vasovagal syncope.smalltext: More than 3 million US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids and devices
treatment.content: Treatment usually involves trigger avoidance, but may on rare occasions include medications or a pacemaker.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Avoidance of triggers and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Usually self-diagnosable
symptoms.content: Symptoms include paleness, nausea, sweating, a rapid heartbeat, and fainting.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Whole body: fainting, lightheadedness, dizziness, low blood pressure, fatigue, or sweating
Heart: fast heart rate, palpitations, or slow heart rate
Also common: blurred vision, fear, nausea, or pallor

Viral fever.name: Viral fever
Viral fever.overview:
Description
Any of a group of infectious diseases that interfere with the blood's ability to clot.Hemorrhagic fevers are spread by contact with infected animals, people, or insects. Examples include Ebola and yellow fever. Avoiding mosquitoes and rodents can help prevent infection.Initial symptoms may include fever, fatigue, dizziness, and muscle aches.Treatment usually involves supportive care, symptom management, and close monitoring.
Viral fever.subtitle: Extremely rare
Viral fever.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment depends on severity
treatment.content: Treatment usually involves supportive care, symptom management, and close monitoring.

additional.subtitle: Supportive care
additional.text: Oral rehydration therapy and IV fluids

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Initial symptoms may include fever, fatigue, dizziness, and muscle aches.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the muscles, abdomen, or joints
Gastrointestinal: vomiting, dark stool from digested blood, diarrhea, nausea, or vomiting blood
Whole body: fever, chills, or low blood pressure
Also common: bleeding, bruising, eye redness, headache, internal bleeding, nosebleed, red spots on skin, or sore throat

Viral meningitis.name: Viral meningitis
Viral meningitis.overview:
Description
Inflammation of brain and spinal cord membranes, typically caused by an infection.Meningitis is usually caused by a viral infection but can also be bacterial or fungal. Vaccines can prevent some forms of meningitis.Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.
Viral meningitis.subtitle: Rare
Viral meningitis.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging always required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment varies
treatment.content: Depending on the cause, meningitis may get better on its own, or it can be life-threatening, requiring urgent antibiotic treatment.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Symptoms include headache, fever, and stiff neck.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the back, muscles, or neck
Whole body: fever, chills, fatigue, lethargy, loss of appetite, malaise, or shivering
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Skin: blotchy rashes or red rashes

Also common: irritability, mental confusion, sensitivity to light, stiff neck, bulging fontanelle, fast breathing, fast heart rate, fear of loud sounds, headache, lack of interest in feeding in infants, sleepiness, sluggishness, or stiff back

Vitiligo.name: Vitiligo
Vitiligo.overview:
Description
A disease that causes the loss of skin color in blotches.Vitiligo occurs when pigment-producing cells die or stop functioning.Loss of skin color can affect any part of the body, including the mouth, hair, and eyes. It may be more noticeable in people with darker skin.Treatment may improve the appearance of the skin but doesn't cure the disease.
Vitiligo.subtitle: Common
Vitiligo.smalltext: More than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging rarely required
Chronic: can last for years or be lifelong

treatment.title: Treatment consists of steroids
treatment.content: Treatment may improve the appearance of the skin but doesn't cure the disease.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Sunblock, Ultraviolet light therapy, Covermark topical, and Dermablend topical

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Loss of skin color can affect any part of the body, including the mouth, hair, and eyes. It may be more noticeable in people with darker skin.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Common symptoms: loss of skin color or premature hair whitening

Vulval cancer.name: Vulval cancer
Vulval cancer.overview:
Description
A type of cancer that occurs on the outer surface area of female genitals.Vulvar cancer is most commonly diagnosed in older women. Risks include exposure to human papillomavirus (HPV) and smoking. An early diagnosis reduces the likelihood that extensive treatment will be needed.Vulvar cancer commonly forms as a lump or sore on the vulva that often causes itching.Treatment usually involves surgery to remove the cancer and a small amount of surrounding healthy tissue.
Vulval cancer.subtitle: Very rare
Vulval cancer.smalltext: Fewer than 20,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required

treatment.title: Treatment depends on stage
treatment.content: Treatment usually involves surgery to remove the cancer and a small amount of surrounding healthy tissue.

additional.subtitle: Surgery
additional.text: Skin grafting, Vulvectomy, Lymph node dissection, and Wide local excision

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Vulvar cancer commonly forms as a lump or sore on the vulva that often causes itching.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the genital area or pelvis
Pain circumstances: can occur during sexual intercourse
Groin: vulval inflammation or vulval itch
Also common: lesion, skin ulcer, or thickening of skin on vulva

Whooping cough.name: Whooping cough
Whooping cough.overview:
Description
A highly contagious respiratory tract infection that is easily preventable by vaccine.Whooping cough is particularly dangerous for infants.Besides a cough that sounds like "whoop," symptoms include a runny nose, nasal congestion, and sneezing.Treatment includes antibiotics.
Whooping cough.subtitle: Rare
Whooping cough.smalltext: Fewer than 200,000 US cases per year
points: Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics
treatment.content: Treatment includes antibiotics.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Besides a cough that sounds like "whoop," symptoms include a runny nose, nasal congestion, and sneezing.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Cough: can be chronic or severe
Nasal: congestion, runny nose, or sneezing
Whole body: fatigue or fever
Also common: paroxysmal cough, episodes of no breathing, vomiting, or watery eyes

Yellow fever.name: Yellow fever
Yellow fever.overview:
Description
A viral infection spread by a particular species of mosquito.Yellow fever is spread by a species of mosquito common to areas of Africa and South America. Vaccination is recommended before traveling to certain areas.Mild cases cause fever, headache, nausea, and vomiting. Serious cases may cause fatal heart, liver, and kidney conditions.No specific treatment for the disease exists. Efforts focus on managing symptoms and limiting complications.
Yellow fever.subtitle: Extremely rare
Yellow fever.smalltext: Fewer than 1,000 US cases per year
points: Treatment can help, but this condition can't be cured
Lab tests or imaging often required
Short-term: resolves within days to weeks

treatment.title: Treatment consists of fluids
treatment.content: No specific treatment for the disease exists. Efforts focus on managing symptoms and limiting complications.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: Mild cases cause fever, headache, nausea, and vomiting. Serious cases may cause fatal heart, liver, and kidney conditions.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Pain areas: in the abdomen or muscles
Whole body: chills, fatigue, fever, or loss of appetite
Gastrointestinal: nausea or vomiting
Also common: bleeding, delirium, headache, or yellow skin and eyes

Coronavirus.name: Coronavirus
Coronavirus.overview:
Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus. Most people who fall sick with COVID-19 will experience mild to moderate symptoms and recover without special treatment.
The virus that causes COVID-19 is mainly transmitted through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or exhales. These droplets are too heavy to hang in the air, and quickly fall on floors or surfaces.
You can be infected by breathing in the virus if you are within close proximity of someone who has COVID-19, or by touching a contaminated surface and then your eyes, nose or mouth.
Coronavirus.subtitle: Very Common
points: Short-term: resolves within days to weeks
In extreme cases, it might lead to death

treatment.title: Treatment consists of antibiotics and surgery
treatment.content:
Seek immediate medical attention if you have serious symptoms. Always call before visiting your doctor or health facility.
eople with mild symptoms who are otherwise healthy should manage their symptoms at home.
On average it takes 5–6 days from when someone is infected with the virus for symptoms to show, however it can take up to 14 days.

additional.subtitle: Self-care
additional.text: Take rest and drink a lot of fluids to maintain adequate hydration.

additional.subtitle: Medications
additional.text: Continue the medications for other co-morbid illness after consulting the treating physician.

symptoms.title: Requires a medical diagnosis
symptoms.content: COVID-19 affects different people in different ways. Most infected people will develop mild to moderate illness and recover without hospitalization.
symptoms.subtitle: People may experience:
symptom_list: Most common symptoms: fever, dry cough, tiredness
Less common symptoms:, aches and pains, sore throat, diarrhoea, conjunctivitis, headache, loss of taste or smell, a rash on skin, or discolouration of fingers or toes
Serious symptoms:, difficulty breathing or shortness of breath, chest pain or pressure, loss of speech or movement
On average it takes 5–6 days from when someone is infected with the virus for symptoms to show, however it can take up to 14 days.
